loans.name: Enedelia

texts.es:
Enedelia and her husband lived in Tamaulipas. They decided to come and live in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon and start their grocery store, which they have now had for 20 years, to support their children with the expenses of school and to offer them a better quality of life. They have 10 children, of which 8 are married and only 2 live with them: a girl of 14 years and a boy of 17 years, who occasionally help with the business.

She wants to diversify her business and now requests a loan of $1175, which will be repaid in 6 months, to be able to invest in merchandise and grow her business. She wants to be able to sell clothes and shoes there as well. With your help Enedelia will be able to accomplish this.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Enedelia y su esposo vivian en Tamaulipas, decidieron venir a vivir a Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, e iniciaron su tienda de abarrotes, con el cual tienen 20 años, para apoyar a sus hijos en los gastos de la escuela y para brindarles mejor calidad de vida. Ellos tienen 10 hijos de los cuales 8 estan casados y solo 2 vivien copn ellos una mujer de 14 años y un hombre de 17 años, quienes ocasionalmente ayudan en el negocio.

Ella desea diversificar su negocio ahora solicita un prestamo por US $1175 que pagara en 6 meses para poder invertir en mercancia y agrandar su negocio, porque quiere tener venta de ropa y zapatos ahí mismo. con tu ayuda Enedelia podra lograrlo.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes for sale in her store.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Mrs. Chan T. sells groceries in her village in Andong Por Village, Kampong Thom Province. She has six children, one of whom is married. One of her single children works for a garment factory and uses his income to support the family’s expenses. Mrs. T. would like to expand her business so that she can increase her profits. She is asking for a loan of $250 to purchase more grocery stocks for her store.

loans.use: To purchase grocery stocks for her store

loans.name: Carmen Janeth

texts.es:
Carmen became a mother 6 months ago, and her husband is a laborer. Their in-laws help them out, and they live in her parents’ home. She started her business a year ago, selling cosmetics and skin care products. She took a course in facials and started to gain customers. The only thing she desires is to be able to give her son a better quality of life.

She needs a loan of $450.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase work supplies and to be able to provide other services, such as in-home massages, thus being able to increase her profits because she would like to have her own spa in the future. With your help, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Carmen es mama desde hace 6 meses su esposo es obrero, los apoyan sus suegros y viven en la casa de los papas de ella. Ella inicio su negocio hace un año cuando empezó a vender cosméticos y productos para el cuidado de la piel, tomo un curso de faciales y ya empezó a tener clientes. Ella lo único que desea es poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $450 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar material de trabajo y poder ofrecer otros servicios como masajes a domicilio y así poder incrementar sus ganancias, ya que en un futuro desea tener su spa. Con tu ayuda esto será posible.

loans.use: Purchase work supplies

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Guapa se formó gracias una de las integrantes se entero del programa del comité y decidió formar uno nuevo con sus vecinas y amigas. Actualmente el comité está conformado por 16 integrantes, y se encuentran en el sétimo ciclo del programa, en el transcurso de cada ciclo el comité demostró una muy buena organización, pudiendo superar cada problema que fue surgiendo.

-Lucila R. de F. Invertirá en la compra de carne, discos para empanadas, verduras, aceite, panificados, servilletas, etc.

- Aurelia S. de Fleitas Invertirá en la compra de carne, discos para empanadas, verduras, aceite, panificados, servilletas, etc.

- Emilia R. Grance Invertirá en la compra de carne, discos para empanadas, verduras, aceite, panificados, servilletas, etc.

- Nidia A. Leiva Invertirá en la compra de harina, azúcar, levadura, moldes para tortas, entre otros.

- Clotilde G. de Ramírez Invertirá en la compra de una vaca.

- Joana Espínola de Ramírez Invertirá en la compra de arroz, fideos, azúcar, leche, carbón, panificados, frutas y verduras.

- Zulma Alejandra M. Invertirá en la compra de telas, hilos, toallitas, etc.

- María Raquel Gómez Invertirá en la compra de carne, discos para empanadas, verduras, aceite, panificados, servilletas, etc.

- Carolina Gómez Invertirá en la compra de harina, azúcar, levadura, moldes para tortas, entre otros.

- María Karina F. R. Invertirá en la compra de carne, discos para empanadas, verduras, aceite, panificados, servilletas, etc.

- María Natividad G. Invertirá en la compra de arcilla blanca, pintura, etc.

- Natividad O. de G. Invertirá en la compra de arcilla blanca, pintura, etc.

- Luz María Cáceres M. Invertirá en la compra de telas, hilos, toallitas, etc.

- María Cristina R. Invertirá en la compra de semillas, abono, verduras en general.

- Marian Eugenia B. Invertirá en la reparación de congelador.

- Susana Elise T. de Espínola Invertirá en la compra de arroz, fideos, azúcar, leche, carbón, panificados, frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
The committee Kuña Guapa was formed because one of the members found out about the committee program and decided to start a new one with her neighbors and friends. Right now the committee has 16 members, and they are in the seventh cycle of the program. During each of the cycles the committee demonstrated very good organization, being able to overcome each problem that came up.

-Lucila R. de F. will invest in buying meat, discs for empanadas, vegetables, oil, bread products, napkins, etc.

-Aurelia S. de Fleitas will invest in buying meat, discs for empanadas, vegetables, oil, bread products, napkins, etc.

-Emilia R. Grance will invest in buying meat, discs for empanadas, vegetables, oil, bread products, napkins, etc.

-Nidia A. Leiva will invest in buying flour, sugar, yeast, cake baking tins, among other things.

- Clotilde G. de Ramírez will invest in buying a cow.

- Joana Espínola de Ramírez will invest buying rice, pasta, milk, charcoal, bread products, fruits, and vegetables.

- Zulma Alejandra M. will invest in buying cloth, thread, napkins, etc.

- María Raquel Gómez will invest in buying meat, discs for empanadas, vegetables, oil, bread products, napkins, etc.

- Carolina Gómez will invest in buying flour, sugar, yeast, cake baking tins, among other things.

- María Karina F. R. will invest in buying meat, discs for empanadas, vegetables, oil, bread products, napkins, etc.

- María Natividad G. will invest in buying white clay, paint, etc.

- Natividad O. de G. will invest in buying white clay, paint, etc.

- Luz María Cáceres M. will invest in buying cloth, thread, napkins, etc.

- María Cristina R. will invest in buying seed, fertilizer, and vegetables in general.

- Marian Eugenia B. will invest in repairing a freezer.

- Susana Elise T. de Espínola will invest buying rice, pasta, sugar, milk, charcoal, bread products, fruits, and vegetables.


Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying meat, vegetables, oil, bread products, napkins, flour, sugar, yeast, cake baking tins, rice, pasta, milk, charcoal, bread products, fruits, and vegetables, cloth, thread, napkins, a cow, and repairing a freezer among other things.

loans.name: Las Puntuales Group

texts.en:
The Las Puntuales (Punctual Women) group is maD. up of 11 women and 2 men who live in the tropical Santa Cruz region of eastern Bolivia. All of the group members live in the same neighborhood and know each another well; they are committed to guaranteeing one another's loans and to making their repayments on time.

Each of the group members has his or her own business: some sell clothing, cosmetics, party favors, appliances, beef, and coca leaves; others are tailors and seamstresses. Most have between one and five years of experience in their respective businesses, though Rosmery has been selling party supplies for 40 years!

Most of the group plans to use their Kiva loan to buy more merchandise to sell. Most group members have previous experience with group loans at other Bolivian microfinance institutions.

loans.use: Buy bulk merchandise to sell

loans.name: Beti's Group

texts.en:
Beti is 30 years old and married with two children, ages six and eight. She has had a shop in Zanzibar for five years. She works every day from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm and is able to earn a profit of approximately $80.

Beti is looking forward to taking out her first loan with BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more inventory for her shop and increase her profit.

Beti shares this loan with her fellow group member, Zabibu.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her shop.

loans.name: Vojna

texts.en:
Vojna was born in 1976 and she lives in Bijeljna, a village in Bosnia. She is married and has 9-year old twins – a boy and a girl. Vojna currently runs a collection station for milk in her home, in which local farmers bring her their milk and she sells it in bulk to local milk factories.

Vojna requests a loan of 1,000KM from Women for Women International to purchase a milk transportation vehicle.  She currently relies upon farmers to bring her their milk, but not many have the ability to do so.  With the transportation vehicle, she can drive to visit farmers directly, including many in remote locations. She expects that her milk supply will increase significantly, allowing her to demand higher profit margins from the milk factories.  

Although the milk transportation vehicle cost significantly more than 1,000KM, Vojna has already saved up the bulk of the money needed for the purchase.

loans.use: To buy a milk transportation vehicle.

loans.name: Neri

texts.es: Neri tiene 32 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y sus  tres hijos. Hace 3 años inició junto a su esposo, el alquiler de equipos de sonido, actividad que  pudieron percibir que era de  gran utilidad  y demanda en su localidad, por ello se motivaron a comprar equipos y alquilarlos para las fiestas de los pueblos o en los locales  para  diversos eventos. Esta actividad  es muy rentable, debido a la cantidad de fiestas que hay dentro de su zona, y sobre todo porque son pocos los que brindan estos servicios, sin embargo, hay que ser muy cautelosos con los  tipos de personas a quienes se les alquila los equipos y de tener muy claro el trato en caso del daño de los equipos. Este es su primer crédito con MFP. Neri, junto a su esposo, invertirán en la compra de nuevos equipos para mejorar sus servicios.
texts.en:
Neri, 32, is married. She lives with her husband and their three children. Three years ago, she and her husband decided to start a business renting sound equipment, a business that they could see would be in much demand in their area. They bought equipment and rented it for parties, events in local stores, etc. The business is very profitable because there are lots of parties in the neighborhood and few competitors. However, they have to be very careful about who they rent their equipment to and how it should be treated in order to avoid damage to it. This is their first MFP loan. Neri, together with her husband, will invest in the purchase of new equipment in order to improve their services.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sound equipment for rental business.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Mrs. Sokha B. is a villager in Tie Prambiey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She owns a small restaurant where she sells rice soup to the people in the local village. In addition to this business, she also sells grocery products in the restaurant. Since her second business is going well, she wants to expand, so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries for her inventory. Her husband, Mr. Phal Hean, helps her with her businesses. Mrs. Sokha B. is 43 years old.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her inventory.

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi: Chị Hoàng Thị Huyền  năm nay 23 tuổi, chị hiện đang sống cùng chồng  làm nghề lái xe và  1 con nhỏ tại  Thị Trấn Lâm huyện Ý Yên tỉnh Nam Định.Trước khi tham gia Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị rất khó khăn do thu nhập chủ yếu của gia đình chỉ dựa vào lương của chồng. Năm 2005 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn dể đầu tư vào buôn bán hàng tạp hóa. Hiện tại với tổng thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng cuộc sống của gia đình chị dang ngày càng được cải thiện hơn. Vòng vốn tới chị Huyền mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư  vốn kinh doanh hàng tạp hóa
texts.en:
Mrs. Hoàng Thị Huyền, 23 years old, lives with her husband and one young child in the town of Lâm, Ý Yên district, Nam Định province. Her husband works as a driver. Before she became a member of the TYM Fund, the financial situation of her family was very difficult because their income depended solely on her husband’s wages. In 2005, she joined the Fund and used a loan to invest in a grocery shop. Today, with an income of 4,000,000 VND (240 USD) per month, her family’s standard of living is steadily improving. In the next lending cycle, Mrs. Huyền hopes to borrow 10,000,000 VND (600 USD) to increase the inventory of her grocery shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grocery shop

loans.name: Victorio

texts.es:
El   señor Victorio C. Romero  es de la Ciudad de Chore, tiene casa propia,  con 43 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Juana Bautista Garcia de C. de 41 años de edad, tienen 4 hijos.

        Es propietario de una despensa con 6 años de funcionamiento, tambien realiza repartos de mercaderias, tiene un automóvil marca Toyota en el cual se desplaza, tambien se dedica a la agricultura.

Sueña en ampliar su local para poder cargar mas de mercaderias y asi aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Victorio C. Romero is from Chore, and is a 43 year-old homeowner. He is married to Juana Bautista Garcia de C. who is 41 years of age. They have four children together. He has been the owner of a store for six years. He also does deliveries in his Toyota. Mr. C. is also in agriculture. His dream is to grow his store in order to buy more goods to improve his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital for  purchase of goods

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es: LA SEÑORA ES UNA EXCELENTE CLIENTE,  ESTA EN LA SECUENCIA NUEVE DE SU CREDITO INDIVIDUAL, ELLA SE DE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE MEDICAMENTOS, ELLA VIAJA A DISTINTAS FERIAS EN EL DEPARTAMENTO DE LA PAZ, JUNTO A SU ESPOSO SE DEDICAN A LA VENTA DE VITAMINAS, ANALGESICOS Y TONICOS RECONSTITUYENTES, SUEROS, ETC LLEVANDO LA VENTA BASICA DE MEDICAMENTOS A LUGARES POCO ACCESIBLES. LA SEÑORA Y SU ESPOSO TIENEN UNA HIJA EN EDAD ESCOLAR, SON CLIENTES DE MUY BUENA ACTITUD QUE TIENE EL ANHELO DE SUPERARSE Y TENER UN MEJOR FUTURO, ESTAN CONSTRUYENDO SU POCO A POCO.
texts.en:
The Señora is an excellent client. This is her ninth individual loan. She works in the sale of medications. She travels to various fairs in the department of La Paz. She and her husband sell vitamins, analgesics and medical tonics and serums, etc., bringing the sale of basic medicines to places that are difficult to access. The Señora and her husband have a school-age daughter. They are clients with very good attitudes who are eager to better themselves and to have a better future, something they are building little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction Materials for Her Home

loans.name: Maura Del Carmen

texts.es: Maura del Carmen P. M. vive en Soyapango departamento San Salvador. Tiene 39 años de edad, vive con sus  dos hijos, una niña de 16 años de edad y un niño de 11 años de edad ambos estudian. Maura es una mujer muy trabajadora ha sabido asumir los gastos de la familia y las responsabilidades como madre soltera, ella ha logrado establecer un negocio de venta de comida a las personas que trabajan en la zona, Maura tiene un clientela muy solida ya que sus precios son muy accesibles, pero ahora ella solicita un crédito por que quiere invertir en bebidas como gaseosas y jugos para tener variedad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maura del Carmen P. Marroquin lives in the Soyapango district of San Salvador. She is 39 years old and lives with her two children, a 16-year old girl and and 11-year old boy, both of whom are in school. Maura is a very hard working woman and she has always managed to cover the family's expenses and meet the responsibilities of a single mother. She has managed to establish her catering business aimed at the region's workers. Maura has a very solid clientele especially because her prices are so affordable. She is requesting a loan so that she might invest it in soft drink and juices to add selection to the products she can offer her clients.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products for her business.

loans.name: Theara

texts.en: N. Theara is a 52-year-old married woman whose currently living in Kompong Chnang province. She works as a driving teacher with a daily income of $18. Her husband, a militia officer since 1979 has a daily income of $1.14, and is working hard together with her to support their three children two of whom are university students and another one is a driving teacher of his mother’s car. Their monthly expenses are over $200 including the school fees, food, electricity and water supplies, and rent. Changing the job from a grocery seller (she used to sell grocery at home) to a teacher of driving car, she earns more income to support her family, so she decided to make a second loan to buy another car and to enlarge her business to the other provinces.

loans.use: buying car

loans.name: Edena

texts.en:
Mrs. Edena O. is 37 years old and has been a member of Paglaum Coop since January 10, 2005. She is married to Mr. Raymax O. who is a barangay kagawad (district councilor) in their barangay (district) and a bona fide resident of Landing, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental.

Recently, she's obtaining her 9th loan for additional capital for her business as a rice retailer. She's very thankful to Paglaum Coop because, through the help of the Coop, she has been able to build her existing business. Her aspiration for her family is to finish her daughter in school so that someday she could find a stable job.

loans.use: To purchase additional rice to sell

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana A. is a food vendor and sells banku. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and eaten with hot peppers and fried fish or soup. She has many customers because banku is enjoyed by many Ghanaian as breakfast, lunch or supper. 

She is sixty years old. She is married with one child. She lives with her child and husband in their apartment. Her husband is sick and cannot work as he used to. She wants to use this loan to buy more ingredients like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her income to support her business. She would be grateful for your support. 

Christiana is a member of Sharp Trust Group. In this community group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and there is peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy more ingredient like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina Isabel R. D. A. resiD. en Cojutepeque ubicado en la zona occidental D. El Salvador. Reina tiene 46 años D. edad vive con su único hijo Álvaro D. 12 años D. edad que actualmente está cursando 6º  grado D. la secundaria. Reina tiene un pequeño puesto ubicado en el mercado donD. comercializa granos básicos como frijoles, maíz, arroz. Reina solicita este crédito por que quiere invertir en la compra D. granos básicos para su negocio ya que le hace falta cantidad D. arroz y maíz, D. esta manera esta madre D. familia lograría aumentar sus ganancias ya que sus clientes no tendrían la necesidad D. ir a otro puesto, ya que donD. Reina harán todas sus compras.
texts.en:
Reina Isabel R. D. A. lives in Cojutepeque which is located in the western area of El Salvador. Reina is 46 years old and lives with her only son Álvaro, who is 12 years old and currently in the 6th graD.. Reina has a small booth located in a market where she sells basic grains such as bean, corn and rice. Reina is requesting this loan because she wants to invest in the purchase of grains for her business since she needs rice and corn. That would allow this mother to be able to increase her income, since her customers won't have a need to go to another stand and will do all their shopping with Reina.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supply her business

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 41 años, vive con sus hijos y su padre, quienes le ayudan en su negocio, el cual realiza desde hace más de 4 años. Ella siempre fue una mujer muy trabajadora y al no poder terminar sus estudios secundaros incursionando en diferentes oficios. Es así que notó en la venta de canela y clavo de olor la fuente para solventar los gastos de su hogar y felizmente no se equivocó, pues ahora obtiene buenos ingresos gracias a esta actividad. El procedimiento no es nada fácil, ya que debe comprar la canela y el clavo al por mayor y empaquetarlo en pequeñas bolsas para su distribución, cada bolsita llega a costar de un sol a más, dependiendo de la cantidad. Las ventas son buenas, porque con los años que viene trabajando en este negocio ya tiene clientes fijos que sólo compran las especerías que ella vende porque saben que son de calidad y buen precio. Es así que ahora Gladys está pensando obtener más ingresos en su negocio comprando mayor cantidad de especerías. En Microfinanzas PRISMA lleva trabajando varios años, pero este es su primer préstamo individual, por lo que promete ser tan puntual como lo fue en su banco comunal. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de especerías para poder aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Gladys is 41 years old and lives with her children and her father, who help her with her business, which she has had for more than 4 years. She has always been a hardworking woman, and when she was not able to finish high school she started working in different jobs. This is how she found out about sellling cinnamon and cloves as a way to cover her household expenses, and fortunately she has succeeded, earning a good income now thanks to this work. Her work is not at all easy; she buys the cinnamon and cloves at wholesale and then repackages it in small bags for sale. Each bag costs one "sol" or more, depending on its size. Sales are good, because over the time that she has been in this business she has built up a steady clientele who only buy spices from her because they know that they are good quality and reasonably priced. That is why Gladys is now thinking about earning more in her business by buying more spices. She has belonged to Microfinanzas PRISMA for several years, but this is her first individual loan, and she promises to be as punctual in this as she has been with her community bank. With the money requested, she will buy more spices in order to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Anenniasa

texts.en:
Anenniasa A. is from the village of Libertad, Quezon Bukidnon. She is 40 years old. Anenniasa is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Anenniasa owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Anenniasa has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Anenniasa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. In that year, Anenniasa has successfully repaid her previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. In 2009, Anenniasa decided to join again HSPFI program as a returnee, and is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase needed materials and ingredients for her food business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the  business and supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Matlab

texts.en:
Matlab S. is 54 years old and lives with his wife and four children, to whom he is a devoted father. He makes the most of every opportunity, such as when he started selling foodstuffs in the food market. He gives his business constant attention all day long, everyday, and in this way he has attracted customers. His income enables him to contribute to the home finances.

In addition he also works as veterinarian. He is motivated in his work by the need to support the family finances and take care of his children's education in school. Matlab is requesting a loan which he will invest in merchandise for his shop. He wishes to stock it with more products and offer the best products every day.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en:
Rovelyn A., is requesting for a loan to finance her variety store which she started through a loan she received from ASHI when she became a member four years ago. She wants her variety store to sell more items and commodities that are basically needed by people in their daily lives. Through the loan she requests from ASHI, she will be able to attain her plan of growing her business and satisfy her costumers with the convenience her store can offer. 
Looking back at the years when Rovelyn didn't have no one for financial and emotional support after her husband. Her eldest child then was only four years old and the youngest was eight month old. She can't afford to put up a business of her own because she has no business capital. She sells vegetables at times and had been doing other kinds of livelihood sporadically. Now, her two children are ages 28 and 33. She wasn't able to send them to school however they tried their best to find a way to earn money in order to help their mother. Her eldest daughter is working in Manila as a while domestic helper while the youngest was left in Antique and lives with her.
Through loans she can avail from ASHI, Rovelyn would really be doing a hardwok to grow her business for her children to take over someday.

loans.use: Will be used to finance a variety store.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es: La señora Juliana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sarita Colonia”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 34 años, 02 hijos que aun dependen de ella.Juliana, hoy nos cuenta que esta muy contenta de haber podido salir adelante con el apoyo del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, es una mujer que a pesar de algunas dificultades que ha tenido en su vida, logro salir a delante, y así decidió implementar su propio negocio. Anteriormente, se dedicaba a la venta de chupetes en su misma casa, donde poco a poco fue ahorrando, porque ya tenia planeado emprender su negocio de venta de frutas en el Mercado Central “Pomarrosa”, nos cuenta que ventas le salen muy bien ya que es muy conocida por sus clientes. Actualmente continúa con el mismo negocio, y esta muy contenta con lo que hace.En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden al Mercado a comprar donde cuenta con todo lo necesario que el ama de casa necesita, para preparar sus jugos u otras cosas, es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con una sonrisa.Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00, comprará sacos de naranjas, mandarinas, limones cidras, racimos de bananas y plátanos,  para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes y encuentren lo que necesiten. Juliana, se siente aun con muchas fuerzas para seguir adelante, y poder cumplir con sus metas y sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento  Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a implementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juliana is a member of the communal bank “Sarita Colonia” which is in the Juanjui district of the province of San Martín. She is married, 34 years old, and has 2 dependent children. Juliana tells us that she is very happy to have been able to get ahead with Manuela Ramos’ support. She is a woman who has been able to get ahead in life in spite of the difficulties she has experienced. This is why she decided to start her own business. She used to sell popsicles from her home. She saved bit by bit because she had her business plan of selling fruit in the central market “Pomarrosa” in mind. She tells us that her sales are high because she knows her customers well. Nowadays she has the same business and is happy doing it. She has a loyal group of customers who go to the market each day to buy from her where she sells everything a house wife might need to make juices and other things. She always takes care of her customers personally and with a smile. To better serve her customers, she will buy sacks of oranges, mandarins, lemons, citrus, bananas, and plantains with the 1,500 (soles) loan. Juliana still maintains a lot of energy to get ahead and accomplish her goals and dreams. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of fruit

loans.name: Martha Eugenia

texts.es:
Con mucho entusiasmo, la señora Martha M. se ha destacado por ser una excelente trabajadora que se dedica a atender su negocio de pulpería donde ofrece todo tipo de productos y en especial comestibles.

Ella ha acudido a Ceprodel con el propósito de solicitar un crédito para la compra de dichos productos y de esta manera continuar en su negocio buscando lograr la satisfacción de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señora Martha M. has distinguished herself as an excellent and enthusiastic worker who is dedicated to her small general store where she offers all types of products, especially food products. She has turned to CEPRODEL to request a loan to purchase products for her store so that she can continue to run her business in a way that satisfies her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase products for a small general store

loans.name: Leonard's Group

texts.en:
N. Leonard is the leader of her lending group in Ibanda. She is a 36-year-old widow with two children of her own, and she also takes care of two dependents. For the past five years Leonard has been in the business of selling agricultural produce from Bwagonga trading centre. She is able to make 100,000 UGX weekly profit and this enables her to take care of her children, including paying their school fees.

Leonard dreams of becoming the largest supplier of agricultural produce, especially green bananas, thus enabling her to make more profit and provide her children with the very best education. Leonard needs a loan to buy more produce for resale, since loans help her offer a variety of produce.

loans.use: To buy more produce to expand variety

loans.name: Lhagvadorj

texts.en:
E. is a 37-year-old widow who lives with her three children in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest children, 17 and 15 years old, both attend a local secondary school, and her youngest child, 5 years old, attends kindergarten.

E. operates a retail vegetable business out of a rented shipping container at a local market in her town. She began her business in 2003 after growing and selling her own vegetables the previous year. She would like to begin importing fruits and vegetables from China, because they are cheaper to import than other types of produce. She works hard to provide for her three children and wants to be able to continue to pay their education fees, so that they can all get a good education and not have to struggle like she has.

E. is requesting a 620,000 tugrug loan to import produce from China and to purchase other kinds of vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To import produce from China and purchase other kinds of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma C. is requesting a larger loan through ASHI to grow her backyard poultry-raising business. "Backyard poultry" refers to raising just a small number of chicks, or less than the minimum number of chicks raised to be qualified as a poultry-raising business. It seemed too early for Elma to dream of having a full-fledged poultry business, considering the size of loan she is qualified to apply for at the moment.

Despite that, she positively sees that her future loans will grow even bigger as she strives to supplement the needs of her growing business. Elma also expects her profits to increase, which will enable her to support the financial needs of her son and his family, especially the education of her grandchildren.

She has nothing else to think about for herself, for she is already 72 years old and soon her life will be over. When that time comes, Elma wants to leave something to her son that will help him in supporting his family's financial needs, especially his children.

loans.use: To purchase chcken food and chicks to raise.

loans.name: Moises

texts.pt:
Moisés E. nasceu no Distrito de Massinga, Província de Inhambane, tem 51 anos de idade, casado e pai de 4 filhos de 27, 24, 21 e 12 anos de idade, destes apenas o ultimo vai a escola. Fez somente 4ª classe do antigo sistema de educação, não continuou porque foi incorporado no serviço militar obrigatório. Vive na casa própria com a sua família no bairro da Zona Verde (arredores da cidade da Matola) e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu de Massinga para Beira em 1977 cumprindo o Serviço militar obrigatório, mais tarde foi transferido para Maputo onde veio a fixar a sua residência. Actualmente é desmobilizado e trabalha no Hospital Central de Maputo como esterilizador ha mais de 2 anos. Por mes consegue ter um rendimento de 2.052.00mt provenientes da pensão da reforma militar mais 2.186.74mt do salário do Hospital e ainda 1.100.00mt pela parte de prestação de serviços para uma clínica. Possui uma conta bancária num dos bancos comerciais.

Já teve um empréstimo numa instituição cujo nome já não se lembra no valor de 3.000.00mt para compra de material de construção da sua casa. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de seus colegas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (chapas de zinco e barrotes) para a cobertura da sua residência.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente este crédito afim de poder aceder a mais empréstimo para o melhoramento da sua casa.
texts.en:
Moisés E. was born in the district of Massinga in the province of Inhambane. He is 51 and is the father of 4 children who are 27, 24, 21, and 12. Only the youngest one is in school. He studied through 4th grade of the old education system. He didn't continue because he was drafted into obligatory military service. He lives in his own home with his family in the Zona Verde neighborhood (on the outskirts of the city of Matola) and doesn't support anyone besides them. He left Massinga for Beira in 1977 to comply with his obligatory military service. Later he was transferred to Maputo where he started his home. Currently he is out of the military and has worked in the Central Hospital of Maputo for more than two years by disinfecting it. He makes a monthly income of 2,052 meticais from his military pension and 2,186.74 meticais a month from the hospital. He also makes 1,100 meticais a month by working at a clinic. He has bank accounts in two commercial banks. He already had a loan with another institution whose name he doesn't remember. His loan was for 3,000 meticais, and he used it to buy construction materials for his home. He became familiar with Hluvuku through his colleagues who are also clients of the institution. This is his first loan with Hluvuku, and it is for 10,000 meticais. He will use it to buy construction materials (metal sheets and bars) to put a roof on his home. He promises to pay back his loan on time so he can receive more loans in the future to make improvements to his home.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials (metal sheets, bars, etc.)

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
N. Nguyễn Thị is a 31-year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh - Hànội. She is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, N. operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chickens for sale.  N. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2.500.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2004, N. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. N. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.028.000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. N. is now requesting a new loan of 5.014.000 VND which will also be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. The loan will be the seventh loan taken out by N. from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


N. Nguyễn Thị là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà nội.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi nhỏ.  Để kiếm sống, N. Tham gia công việc kinh doanh của gia đình.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán.  N. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, N. kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2004, N. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  N. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.014.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Khoản vay sẽ là 7th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  N. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện điều kiện sống chung của gia đình người vay.


Về SEDA:

N. vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a very hard-working woman who lives in Ogbomoso town in Oyo State, Nigeria. She is 62 years old and married with 3 children.

Victoria sells provisions. She has been in this business for over 4 years and in LAPO microfinance for over 2 years. She puts in long hours trying to keep her business sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. Victoria is requesting a loan of 80,000 to buy more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Mohamad Saleh

texts.en: Mohamad Saleh is a 27-year-old single man. He learned hairdressing 18 years ago. In 2000, after good experience in this occupation, he decided to open his own salon. Today, Mohamad Saleh is requesting to borrow $1,200 to improve the decor of his salon and buy specially designed barber chairs.

loans.use: to improve the decor of his salon and buy specially designed barber chairs

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
Nuestra socia MICAELA, pertenecen al banco comunal “SOL DE ORO”, la socia vive en la ciudad de Cusco, en el barrio de san jerónimo ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad.

Nuestra socia tiene 50 años y es divorciada, la socia tiene 2 hijos de 19 y 14 años ella alterna sus diferentes actividades con el comercio minorista, nuestra socia alquila un stand en un colegio en el cuál puso una tienda escolar tipo abarrotes en donde ella vende todo tipo de golosinas, sándwich, bebidas calientes y frías, cuadernos, lapiceros, lápices, borradores y jugos de frutas. Nuestra socia también tiene en su casa propia departamentos los cuales los alquila y de ahí también tiene otro ingreso adicional, lo cual le permite viajar y pasear, ahora nuestra socia que está en el grupo desde hace 6 años atrás mantiene este grupo para seguir conectada a sus amigas del banco y también de este modo utilizar el préstamo para comprar mercadería para su stand escolar para la época vacacional, nuestra socia invertirá el dinero exclusivamente en esta tienda escolar.

La socia agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Micaela belongs to the "Sol de Oro" (Golden Sun) communal bank. This member lives in the San Jerónimo neighborhood of Cuzco, about 15 minutes from the downtown area. This member is 50 years old and is divorced. She has 2 children, ages 19 and 14. She alternates her various activities with her retail business. She rents a stand at a school where she has set up a type of school grocery store and sells all kinds of sweets, sandwiches, hot and cold drinks, notebooks, pens, pencils, erasers and fruit juices. She also rents out rooms in her house, from which she earns some extra income that allows her to get out and about. Our member has been in this lending group for six years. She keeps up with the group to stay connected to her friends from the bank and so she can obtain a loan to buy merchandise for her school stand for the vacation season. She will invest the money exclusively in the school store. She appreciates and values the opportunity given to her through this medium, so she promises to pay off her debt in the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for school store

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel, de 43 años, vive feliz en su casa propia al lado de sus tres hijos: Lucero (17), Evelyn (14) y Ángel (3).
Desde hace 2 años, esta laboriosa mujer, se dedica al servicio de fotografías al instante; este oficio consiste en tomar fotos de diferente tamaño y revelarlas al momento. Su establecimiento  está ubicado en un centro comercial muy concurrido de su ciudad y a veces la ayudan sus hijas, pero la mayor parte del tiempo lo realiza sola. Maribel atiende de lunes a sábado durante todo el día y está muy satisfecha porque le genera buenos ingresos, los que le alcanzan para tener una buena calidad de vida. A su vez, le gusta mucho este trabajo porque no requiere de mucho esfuerzo, puede interactuar con sus clientes y además se entretiene mucho. Y como es una mujer emprendedora, para el futuro, tiene planeado ampliar su tienda de fotos, ya que en la actualidad le está quedando algo pequeña.

Este es el 2do préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible la obtención de su crédito, el que la ayudará a seguir progresando. Maribel tiene planeado invertir el dinero que ahora solicita en la compra de una nueva impresora de fotos para continuar laborando tranquilamente.
texts.en:
Maribel, 43 years of age, lives happily in her own house alongside her 3 children: Lucero (17), Evelyn (14) and Ángel (3). For 2 years this hard-working woman has worked in instant photography. This consists of taking photos of different sizes and developing them right afterwards. Her establishment is located in a popular commercial centre in the city and sometimes her daughters help her, but the biggest part of the business she does alone. Maribel attends the store from Monday to Saturday all day, and is very satisfied because she generates good earnings which allow her to have a good quality of life. She really likes this job because it doesn't require much force, she can interact with her customers and is entertained a lot. As she is a hard-working woman, in the future she has plans to expand her photo shop as now it is actually a little small. This is her second loan with MFP and she is very thankful to all those peoples that have made it possible for her to receive her loan, which willl help her to progress. Maribel plans to invest the money that she is seeking in the purchase of a new photo printer to continue working peacefully.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a photo printer

loans.name: Mouhyi Eldin

texts.en:
Mouhyi Eldin is a 26-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. Mouhyi Eldin has owned a coffee shop for almost two years. He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his coffee shop. This is the first time that he has requested a loan. 

Mouhyi Eldin is special in his work because he knows how to treat his customers and they feel comfortable coming to his shop and resting while enjoying a nice coffee with pleasant people. His clients are his friends, neighbors, and others. When he first started his business, he passed through financial issues. Mouhyi Eldin decided on doing his business because he likes owning his own business and working on his own, and he has experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Loveth

texts.en: Loveth, a businesswoman who cooks and sells fufu (cassava dough) at retail prices, loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is requesting a loan NGN 50,000 to purchase more cassava to cook more fufu to sell, hoping to expand her business. As a hard working woman with the determination to excel, Loveth aspires to lift her business and family above poverty. A 35-year-old married mother of seven children, she says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava to cook more cassava dough (fufu) to sell

loans.name: Yasser

texts.en:
Yasser Hassan N. 32 years old, married, and has seven members in his family. Two of his kids are in school. 

Yasser used to work in Israel as he had permission for entrance, but it was revoked because of the political situation here in Palestine. After that he started to buy sheep and sell them for a small profit. He then enlarged his business and started to make yogurt to sell to his neighbors and nearby grocery stores. 

Yasser wants this loan to enlarge his business by buying extra sheep and making more yogurt, which may increase his profits.

loans.use: To buy sheep for yogurt production

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es:
El joven Mario Alberto V. tiene poco tiempo que radica en Nuevo Laredo. 
Actual mente esta rentando un casa, pero el desea tener su propio patrimonio, ya que quiere que sus papas se vengan a vivir con el, y quieren que lleguen a un lugar seguro y que sea para ellos. 
Para obtener su propia vivienda le esta haciendo falta un monto el cual por el momento no cuenta, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo. Para que le entreguen su vivienda  y así tener su propio patrimonio. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como empleado de un restaurante de pizza.
texts.en:
Mario Alberto V. has lived in Nuevo Laredo for a short period of time. He currently rents his house but would like to have his own property because he wants to bring his parents to live with him and he wants to have a safe place for them to come to that would be his. He’s still missing a certain amount in order to own his own home so he is asking for loan to cover this shortfall so that he can obtain his own property. He plans to repay the loan with earnings from his job as an employee of a pizza restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay difference on housing loan from INFONAVIT (Government subsidized housing)

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina B. believes that along with her supportive and loving husband and children, she can jump up through the wall of poverty and experience life in new dimensions. Through the proceeds of the business she has built up and has been growing (with the help of her husband), and with the help of the loans she has been receiving from ASHI since she became a member in 2002, her dream can come true. 

Now Gina is requesting a much larger loan to grow her hog-raising business. She wishes to purchase more piglets to raise for breeding and selling to people in her village or in the market. From the proceeds, she will create savings for her family’s education so they can graduate from college and have their own careers in the future.

loans.use: To purchase piglets for raising and breeding

loans.name: Ronnah

texts.en:
Despite being poor and having limited access to a lot of opportunities to improve herself and life, having been married and becoming  a mother to her two-year-old only child at an early age, Ronnah felt happy and blessed when she became a member of ASHI in 2008. Aside from being able to receive a loan and finance her own business, she is happy about the opportunity of meeting other women and mothers in their village and listening to their sharing of experiences in growing a business and how they balance their own career being a wife and mother at the same time as a business woman. Aside from her family, members of ASHI in the center she belongs to are her inspiration to become a better and more productive woman.

Ronnah wants to support the education of her only child until she graduates from college. Therefore she has started growing her small “sari-sari” store now while Jorin Mikaela, her daughter, is still young. “Sari-sari” means a small volume of various grocery items, foodstuffs, beverages and other commodities. People tend to buy things they need from here than going to market and spending carfare. Profit gained from this business is Ronnah’s means of supporting the needs of her family. She also wants to start up a hog fattening and hog-raising business in their backyard through the loan she requests, so that her father whom she supports will have his own means to earn an income.

Looking forward to her small “sari-sari” store turning into a big grocery store which sells complete commodities through loans she can access through ASHI, Ronnah hopes to build up a savings fund to finance her dream of building their own house and living independently from her father.

loans.use: To purchase a large volume of various grocery items, etc.

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “ESMERALDA”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de San Sebastián, perteneciente ala provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Tania;   ella tiene  29 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y la socia tiene un hijo de 2 años, ella alterna sus actividades con la venta de materiales de construcción, Nuestra socia compra todo tipo de materiales para construir y los vende al por menor a las diferentes tiendas de ferreterías. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Tania is a member of the Esmeralda Communal Bank. She lives in the District of San Sebastián, which is part of the Province and Department of Cusco.

Sra. Tania is 29 years old, in a common law marriage, and has a two year old son. She divides her time between her household activities and selling construction materials. Tania buys all types of construction materials and sells them at retail to different hardware stores.

She values and has endless appreciation for the support that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to submit her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction supplies to sell

loans.name: La Union Hace La Fuerza 1 Group

texts.en:
Guillermina is the coordinator of her group La Union Hace La Fuerza (Union Makes Strength), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the economy is dominated by the sugarcane harvest and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her common-law husband and their child.

Guillermina is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza  after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing and beauty products by purchasing more merchandise. She will use the profits to buy school supplies for her son with the goal of sending him to university some day. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothing and Avon beauty products

loans.name: Frevisminda

texts.en:
Frevisminda O., from the village of Poblacion, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur, is 48 years old, separated from her spouse, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Frevisminda owns and operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as milo, milk sachet, coffee, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Engaged in her business for over a year, she earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Frevisminda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 20000 PHP from GDMPC that was used to purchase additional products to sell, Frevisminda is requesting a new loan, her third, of 30000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nathalie Angele

texts.fr:
Nathalie Angèle T. est une femme de 35 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de LEKHAR depuis 2004 et a 13 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit auprès de CAURIE-MICRO FINANCE et a toujours remboursé sans difficulté. 

Elle pratique depuis plus 5ans un petit commerce de tissus et de bijoux. Elle dispose d'une bonne clientèle dans son village et dans les villages environnants. 

Son nouveau prêt de 500.000 francs CFA lui permettra d'acheter des tissus et bijoux en grande quantité pour escompter plus de bénéfices.  

Nathalie Angèle T. est soutien de sa famille maternelle, ses bénéfices lui permettront de participer en grande partie à la prise en charge de la nourriture de ladite famille maternelle.
texts.en:
Nathalie Angèle T., 35, is married and the mother of three children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" of LEKHAR since 2004, has received 13 consecutive loans from CAURIE-MICRO FINANCE, and has always reimbursed them without difficulty. For more than five years she has been involved in a small business selling cloth and costume jewelry. She has a good clientele in her village and in the surrounding villages. Her new loan in the amount of 500,000 francs CFA will allow her to buy large quantities of cloth and jewelry so as to benefit from a reduced cost to her and thus make more profit. Nathalie Angèle T. helps support her mother's family; her profit will go a long way toward allowing her to cover the expense of feeding her mother's family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy cloth and costume jewelry for resale

loans.name: Rossel

texts.en:
Rossel B. is from the village of Tupsan, Regueño, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 30 years old. Rossel is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Rossel owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling coconuts in the local community. Rossel has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rossel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rossel is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional coconuts. This loan will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template to help the field staff post loans in English and provide quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional coconuts

loans.name: Edith Stefanie

texts.es:
Edith de 23 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil, ella vende ropa y perfumes por catalogo. 

Una amiga la inscribió en una compañía de venta de ropa por catalogo, tuvo que seguir esta actividad por su hijo ya que no esta casada,  trabaja desde muy temprano de lunes a viernes y los fines de semana se va a pueblos a vender productos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar ropa y perfumes para surtir mas la mercadería. En el futuro quiere tener su propio local para la mejor venta y asi asegurar el futuro de su hijo.
texts.en:
Edith, 23, lives the urban El Paraiso neighborhood of Guayaquil. She sells clothing and perfumes through a catalog. A friend got her to sign up with a company that sells clothing by catalog. She had to continue this activity for her son, since she is not married. She works every day from the early morning hours from Monday until Friday, and on the weekends she goes to the towns to sell her products. With the loan she wants to buy clothing and perfumes to increase her inventory of merchandise. In the future she wants to have her own store so that she can have better sales and in this way secure the future of her son.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing and perfume

loans.name: Jose Valentin

texts.es:
Don José es un señor de 52 años de edad, reside en San Rafael Oriente de San Miguel junto a su esposa y dos hijas una de 18 y la otra de 20 años de edad, quienes dependen económicamente de él. Don José es agricultor dedicándose a este trabajo desde joven el cual lo aprendió por sus patrones que le enseñaron a la siembra de Maíz, no posee horario de trabajo y actualmente tiene la dificultad de contar con capital para la siembra y ayudar a la familia con los gastos.
Él necesita un Préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas como Maíz, Abono y fertilizantes, para poder realizar el cultivo.
Este préstamo le será de mucha ayuda pues contara con los recursos necesarios para hacer un buen trabajo con la tierra, con el único inconveniente seria  que ocurra algún desastre natural y dañe sus cultivos, de lo contrario el obtendrá una mejor cosecha ya que le brindara los cuidados necesarios  y obtendrá mayores ingresos que solventen los gastos familiares.
Su sueño es sacar a su familia adelante, bríndales una mejor calidad de vida y buen desarrollo en la educación de sus hijas.
texts.en:
José, 52, lives in San Rafael Oriente, San Miguel with his wife and two daughters who are 18 and 20 years of age and depend on him economically. José is a farmer. He’s been farming from a very young age ever since he learned from his bosses how to plant corn. He doesn’t have a fixed work schedule and he currently is facing difficulties in having capital available to plant and help his family meet their expenses. He needs a loan in order to buy farming supplies like corn, manure and fertilizers in order to plant. The loan will be of great use to him because he will have the necessary resources to do a good job with the land. The only problem would be if some natural disaster were to occur that would damage his crops. Otherwise, he will obtain a good harvest because he will provide proper care thus obtaining higher income to meet family expenses. His dream is to have his family succeed, to provide them with a better quality of life and to see his daughters’ education unfold properly.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, manure and fertilizers.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora, de 31 años, es una mujer fuerte y luchadora, vive con Ronald, de 26 años, ambos tienen 3 hijos Josue de 12, Yens de 8 y Yoice de 4 años, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la selva peruana (comunidad nativa Centro Pumpuriani). Todas las mañanas como de costumbre, se dirige con su hija Yoice a cuidar sus cultivos de café, plátano y yuca; lo que les gusta es poder limpiar, podar y cuidar de sus plantaciones; ya que desde los 12 años su abuelita le enseñó a trabajar la tierra y sobrevivir de ella. Cuando sus cultivos están maduros los vende a los comerciantes que llegan constantemente a la comunidad, caso contrario sucede con el cultivo de Yuca. Nora viaja una vez por semana al mercado central de su ciudad para poder vender su producto. Ahora esta pensando sembrar maíz híbrido (llamado también polenta), ya que tiene mayor demanda en la zona; de la misma manera sembrará plantas estables como cítricos y con ello asegurará su producción en el futuro. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP y como presidenta de su banco comunal incentiva el apoyo entre sus integrantes, esta segura que de esa manera podrán progresar. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de 2 cuadras de terreno de cultivo, donde sembrará maíz.
texts.en:
Thirty-one year old Nora is a strong, hardworking woman.  She lives with Ronald, 26, and together they have three children:  Josue, 12, Yens, 8 and Yoice, 4.  They live in their own home in the Peruvian jungle (the native community Centro Pumpuriani).

Each morning she and her daughter Yoice take care of her coffee, plantain and yuca crops.  They like being able to clean, prune and care for their crops.  When she was twelve years old her grandmother showed her how to work the land and survive from it.

When her crops are ripe she sells them to traders who constantly come to the community.  It is the opposite with the yuca crop, once a week Nora travels to the central market of the city to sell this product.

Now she is thinking of growing hybrid corn (also known as polenta), since there is much demand in the area.  At the same time, she will grow stable crops like citrus, to ensure future production.

This is her fourth loan from MFP and as president of her communal bank, she encourages support between group members, she is sure that this will allow them to progress.  With the loan that she requests, she will purchase two blocks of arable land to grow corn.

loans.use: For the purchase of two blocks of land to grow corn.

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en:
Sherly A. is from the village of Minlagas, Gingoog City. She is 38 years old. Sherly is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Sherly owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables especially eggplant for sale. Sherly has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Sherly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sherly is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Sherly from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

location.town: San Luis, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Perfecto

texts.es: El Señor Perfecto B. H., es un adulto mayor de 65 años, es casado y su esposa labora como comerciante, apoyando con sus ingresos a la economía del hogar, ellos tienen 6 hijos mayores de edad, el señor Perfecto es agricultor y cuenta con una experiencia de más de 20 años, tiempo al que se han enfrentado a problemas de  infecciones de plagas, así mismo los gases que emanan el volcán que se encuentra en las cercanías, afectan de sobremanera sus cosechas, a futuro desea realizar un estudio de conservación de suelo y establecer una cerca viva que le permita mejores condiciones económicas para su negocio, por ahora solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes, que brinden un mantenimiento Fitosanitario a sus cultivos, para un aumento en el volumen de ganancias que le favorezca a futuros proyectos que mejore la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Mr. Perfecto B. H. is an older man, 65 years old, and married.  His wife works as a merchant, supporting their household income.  They have 6 grown children.  Mr. Perfecto is a farmer with more than 20 years of experience.  He has faced problems of pest infestations and gases emanating from a nearby volcano that greatly affect his crops.  In the future he wants to study soil conservation and put iup a hedge that will allow him to improve economic conditions for his business.  Now he requests a loan to purchase agricultural inputs and fertilizers for plant health maintenance of his crops.  This will result in an increase in profits to be used for future projects to inprove his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To maintain plant health of his crops.

loans.name: Kunthy

texts.en:
Miss. Kunthy C., 40, is single. She lives with her niece on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Kunthy is a silk weaver. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. She has had one previous Kiva loan. Now  she is asking for her second loan of $100 to purchase weaving materials needed to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials

loans.name: Busayra

texts.en:
Busayra M. is a young mother of four daughters. She is 31 years old. After finishing school in her native village in the south of Kyrgyzstan, she did not have an opportunity to continue her studies. To help her parents raise her brothers and sisters, she began to work as a seamstress. When she was 20, she got married and moved with her husband to Belovodskoe Village. Here they found jobs of a seamstress and mechanic, but they needed to find an additional means of subsistence for their family. 

In 2000, they started their cattle-breeding business with an initial sum of 2,000 Kyrgyz Soms. They worked hard and managed to expand their farm by building a barn and purchasing two bull-calves. Now Busayra plans to take a loan of 60,000 Kyrgyz Soms to buy two calves to fatten and resell. With the revenues, she plans to renovate her house and buy more cattle. Busayra is very hardworking person and does everything to provide her children with a prosperous future.  

About Bai-Tushum:
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Dominador

texts.en:
Dominador A., 59 years old, is from the town of Sta. Josefa. He is married and has 8 children. To make a living, Dominador raises crops.  The main source of income for his business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Dominador has children who still go to school. He is working hard to sustain their education and have them finish college.

Dominador joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dominador has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Dominador is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
As the saying goes, opportunity knocks only once. Lucia G. knows this truth and grabs every opportunity that comes her way. Lucia, 57, reached elementary school. She is a widow who raised her three working children. Together, they live in Pasay City, Philippines.

Lucia presently runs a sari-sari (variety) store in which she sells items that are needed daily by neighbors in her community. Products on her shelves range from soap bars to candies and from energy drinks to rice. Having been in business for at least two years, she knows how to pay her dues on time. She also has an excellent reputation with her fellow community partners in CCT* and, most important, her customers. Monthly, she is able to earn an average of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP).

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She intends to use this money to purchase more products for her store, all the more now that the Christmas season is fast approaching. She also plans to charge up her alkaline water business so that it will also become profitable. Lucia plans to take this opportunity to drive her businesses toward more profitability.

Lucia's life is never without challenges, both in her business and personal life. Nonetheless, she stays focused on the opportunities that lie ahead, and not on the failures of yesterday or the worries of today.


*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to replenish her current inventory

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: El Sr. Rene vive en el barrio villa norte del municipio del Torno, distante a 32 km de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, es nacido en el departamento de Cochabamba, hace unos 20 años que se vino a vivir a la ciudad, es de ocupación mecánico eléctrico, hace unos tres años que se dedica a esta actividad, su esposa con la cual tiene tres hijos se dedica a labores del hogar, el destino el crédito es para comprar herramientas para su taller, se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo y confianza que se le a brindado.
texts.en: Mr. Rene lives in the Villa Norte neighborhood in the town of Torno, 32 km from the city of Santa Cruz.  He was born in the state of Cochabamba and came to live in the city some 20 years ago.  He has worked as an electrical mechanic for 3 years.  He and his wife have 3 children and she takes care of their home.  The loan will be used to buy tools for his workshop.  He is thankful to the institution for the support and trust they have given him.

loans.use: Purchase Tools for his Workshop

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.ru: Ибрагимова Мукаддас проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Ей 34 года. Она разведена, имеет двоих детей. Дети учатся. Сама Мукаддас не имеет высшего образования. Она более 8 лет занимается торговлей. Арендует торговую точку, где продает хозяйственные товары. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Mukaddas I. lives in the town of Qurgan-Tube. She is 34 years old. She is divorced, with two children. Her children are in school. Mukaddas does not have a college degree. She has been working in retail for over eight years. She rents out a stall to sell household goods at. She is taking out a loan in order to increase her sales volume.

loans.use: Increasing sales volume

loans.name: Carmen Soledad

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN RUMIYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Srta. Carmen Soledad; ella tiene 27 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de contadora, ella es propietaria de un estudio contable, donde realiza su carrera profesional, la socia quiere implementar su oficina. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar implementos para su oficina de contabilidad.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Carmen Soledad belongs to the Hatun Rumiyoc Communal Bank.  This bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is 27 years old and single.  She alternates her daily activities with her accounting work.  She is the proprietor of an accounting office, where she works in her professional career.  She wants to equip her office.  She wants the loan to buy implements for her accounting office.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy implements for her accounting office

loans.name: Blanca Aurora

texts.es:
A sus 63 años de edad, Blanca Aurora P. de Marín, se dedica a la confección, negocio que desde hace 10 años se ha convertido en un gran apoyo para cubrir los gastos familiares. Los vecinos son sus principales clientes, pues Blanca además de confeccionar todo tipo de prendas también realiza diferentes arreglos, los cuales tienen gran acogida entre sus clientes. 

Actualmente, Blanca necesita comprar una máquina familiar debido a que la que tiene es muy antigua y no le permite elaborar rápidamente los pedidos.
texts.en:
At 63 years old, Blanca Aurora P. de Marín sews for a living.  Over the past ten years, her business has become a big help in supporting her family.  Her neighbors are her main customers.  In addition to making all types of clothes, Blanca also does different types of mending and repairs, which are popular among her customers.

Currently, Blanca needs to buy a sewing machine since the one she uses is very old and doesn't allow her to finish orders quickly.

loans.use: Buying a sewing machine

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a forty six year old married man with five children.  He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda, and has been in retail for two years.  He was initially in farming, from where he mobilized the capital for the retail business. The biggest challenge for his business is bad debtors.   He envisions having a big retail business in future and he also hopes to purchase a motorcycle.  John is requesting this loan to buy sugar and soap for retail sale.

loans.use: To buy sugar and soap for sale.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna B. is from the village of Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 52 years old. Anna is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Anna owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, junk foods, breads, shampoo, soap and beverages in the local community. Anna has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Anna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.
