Anna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and junk foods. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Anna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods & junk foods

location.town: Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Dulamjav

texts.en:
Dulamjav is a 47-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two daughters in an apartment in Suhbaatar district, Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband is a manager in a private company with monthly salary of 350,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT). Her older daughter, Gunbileg, goes to a college and the younger one attends a local secondary school. 

Dulamjav manages a construction-goods trading business at a rented stall at a Bolor trading center. She started her business in 2002. Even though she graduated as a veterinarian in 1985, she never worked as a vet. She had to become businesswoman in order to earn money and provide better living conditions for her family. 

She is a diligent lady who says, "I want to expand my business in the future." She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase more construction goods for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more construction goods

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Danaya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 52 ans,  6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de YOLLA, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’habits et de condiments alimentaires.                                                                                                                           
Les femmes du groupe Danaya sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire.                                                                       
MINATA C. compte acheter des habits pour enfants et adultes avec les revendeurs de Fana. Elle effectue ses ventes au village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Danaya group are all married, average 52 years of age, and have six children.  They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Yolla, in the Fana prefecture, in the region of Koulikoro (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
They know each other through family ties, as neighbors and as friends.  They are in the business of selling clothing and food condiments. 
The women of the Danaya group are on their fifth joint loan.
MINATA C. plans to buy children’s and adult clothing from the dealers in Fana.  She makes her sales in the village, for cash and on credit, to a clientele of men and women.
She foresees making an average monthly profit of 15,000 CFA which will be used to make payments on her loan and to make contributions to social ceremonies, with the remainder being reinvested in her business activities.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Damira's Group

texts.en:
Damira B., 50, is the leader of this group. She resides in the town of Toktogul, known for having the largest water reservoir in the country. Not many years ago a tragedy hit this family. It was the loss of Damira’s husband. In addition to a moral loss, it also was financial. He was the main breadwinner of the family, while Damira had devoted all her time to their kids. 

Later, as a widow, Damira invested 12 000 soms of family savings into acquiring a herd of livestock, which she feeds, fattens and later resells at a higher price. Currently Damira has nineteen-year-old and sixteen-year-old sons, who depend on her financially and who actively participate in cattle breeding. 

Relying on the assistance of her boys, Damira got involved in trade, too. The source for an initial capital of 12 000 soms was also a salary from teaching in a local high school. According to Damira trade has appealed to her most of all professions she experienced. It gives her chances to have direct communication with customers, study their tastes and preferences, and find things in business that need to be improved. However she wishes to continue running both businesses of cattle reselling and trade together. That allows her to increase the family capital and cover all expenses. The required loan will be spent by Damira on the purchase of four head of young livestock.

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is married and has three children. Her husband is a carpenter.  Aba sells food items, such as smoked fish, garden eggs, salt, tomatoes, red pepper and other food items.  She has done this for 5 years. Her income is used to help support her family.  Aba will use the loan to purchase food items for resale.

loans.use: to purchase food items for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 22-year-old Lebanese single man who lives with his parents and two siblings. He has been working as a women's hairdresser since 2007. He works on a freelance basis serving customers at their homes. Today, he is requesting to borrow $600 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., in order to purchase new hairdressing tools and supplies. In the future, he is planning to take more Kiva loans in order to open his own beauty salon and welcome customers appropriately.

loans.use: to purchase new hairdressing tools and supplies.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 45 years old and married with two children ages 19 and 21. She is a farmer working in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. Clarita grows rice to sell and she also raises pigs in her backyard.

Clarita is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer, seed, and feed. She hopes to be a successful businesswoman someday.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seed, and feed

loans.name: Ma Consuelo

texts.es: Doña Consuelo esta casada con el señor Víctor Manuel el cual es panadero, ellos tuvieron 6 hijos pero nada mas dos viven con ella los cuales no estudian pero le ayudan hacer el pan. Comenta doña Consuelo que ella se dedica a vender pan a diario se levantan desde muy temprana hora a las tres de la mañana para amasar, elaborar los panes y después meterlos al horno para que se cosan. Ella tiene con esta actividad desde hace 6 años elabora pan de rancho y conchas, dice que su esposo fue que le enseño hacerlo ya que la familia de el fue son panaderos de tradición ya que sus antepasados empezaron con ese negocio. Doña Consuelo esta pidiendo un crédito para dar un anticipo de un vehiculo para poder distribuir su producto mas fácilmente ya que ahorita en temporada de lluvias se le dificulta la entrega y a través del vehiculo se le facilitara. Ella entrega pan en las tiendas de su localidad, comenta que cada 15 días compra los insumos para realizar el pan en la ciudad de Toluca estado de México ya que ahí le dan buenos precios. La meta que tiene doña consuelo es poner una panadería en su localidad.
texts.en:
Doña Consuelo is married to Señor Víctor Manuel, who is a baker.  They have 6 children but no more than two live with them.  They are not in school, but they help with baking the bread. 

Doña Consuelo says that she works selling bread on a daily basis.  She gets up at a very early hour, at three o'clock in the morning, to knead and prepare the bread and then puts it in the oven to be baked.  She has been doing this activity for 6 years and makes rolls and biscuits.  She says it was her husband who taught her to do this because he comes from a family with a tradition of being bakers, as their ancestors began in that business. 

Consuelo is requesting a loan to pay an advance on a vehicle to be able to distribute her products more easily.  Right now, in the rainy season, deliveries become difficult and the vehicle will make it easier. She delivers bread to her local stores, and says that every two weeks she buys the ingredients for baking in the city of Toluca, in Mexico state, as they have good prices there.  

Doña Consuelo's goal is to have a bakery store in her area.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to bake bread for sale.

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es: Maria Margarita trabaja en su pulpería desde hace 27 años, sin embargo ha tenido dificultades  como es de salud ya que muchas veces no pude tiene dolores de reumatismo lo que  le impide abrir su pulpería. Ella quiere tener más surtido en su negocio para poder tener más clientes y además poder ofrecerles otros productos. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de granos básicos, cremas, leches, golosinas, jugos, fósforos, sal entre otros. Su sueño es poder tener realizarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria Margarita has worked in her small grocery store for 27 years. However, she has had difficulties such as health problems like rheumatism pain that kept her from opening her store. 

She wants to better supply her business so she can have more customers and be able to offer them other products. The loan she is requesting is to purchase staple grains, creams, milk, sweets, juices, matches and salt among other things. Her dream is to be able to complete some improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase staple grains, creams, milk, sweets, juices, matches and salt among other things.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en: Rahab is 45 years old, married with two children aged 18 and two years old. She operates a boutique in Thika town well known by the name "Rahab's Boutique." She has been in this business for two years and says the major challenge she has is financial constraints. She is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to purchase clothes for sale. Rahab hopes to grow her business and open three more other boutiques in Thika. She describes herself as patient and focussed.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plantains, red peppers and other food stuffs to meet the demands of her customers

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 33 years old, married to a farmer and blessed with three school-aged children. Marilyn always looks after her family's quality of life. Her priority is to prepare for her children's college level of education. She knows that this is the level where most students fail to continue their studies because it is costly.

Marilyn and her husband manage their large crop of rice. Marilyn aims for a better yield per crop to gain more income. To get a better yield, Marilyn needs to improve her farming practices by using the proper farm inputs such as fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides.

Marilyn is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides for rice farming. The loan would be a big help for her to start improving her farming practices to gain a higher income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides for rice farming.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles has practiced farming for the last 16 years. He is 32 years old and married to Nduta. They have two school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan. He paid his previous loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) on time. He has been loaned 35,000 KES. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer and pay for labor.

In the future, Charles hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth has been selling clothes for the past four years in Kangemi town. She is 30 years old and is married to Peter. They have two school-aged children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET client. She has repaid her previous loans well and in good time. She intends to use the loan to buy four bales of ladies' clothes, two bales of children's wear and 20 pieces of men’s jeans.

In future, Ruth hopes to own a building from where she can operate her business.

loans.use: To buy four bales of ladies' clothes, two bales of children's wear and 20 pieces of men’s jeans.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 46 years old and lives in the town of Kisekende in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is single and has 2 children. For the past 10 years, Veronica has been working hard to manage her garments shop, which sells clothing and other merchandise. 

To help expand her business, Veronica has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more materials to make clothes, and will help Veronica to generate greater profits and provide for her family's basic needs. Veronica hopes that in the future she will be able to afford having a house, built for her and her family. 

Veronica is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Veronica who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more materials to make clothes

loans.name: Marling Ivette

texts.es: Marling Ivette tiene 32 años, se dedica a la venta de  cosméticos. Empezó este negocio por la necesidad de sacar adelante a su hijo en sus estudios y forjarles un mejor futuro. Ella necesita este préstamo para la compra de lápiz labial, crema para  el cutis, pintura de uñas, lápiz de ojos, delineadores entre otros cosméticos que le servirán para surtir su negocio y poder obtener buenas ganancias la cual utilizara para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en: Marling Ivette, 32, sells cosmetics.  She started the business needing to provide her son with an education and to forge a better future for themselves.  She needs this loan to buy lipsticks, face cream, nail polish, eyeliner and mascara among other cosmetics that will serve to stock her business and have good profits that she’ll use to get ahead with her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Seucheleufu Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Seucheleufu” lo conforman 20 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran, venta de ropa usada, nueva, venta de provisiones, frutas, huevos, abarrotes, además marroquinería, preparación de productos de repostería y prestación de servicios en movilización de taxis y colectivos. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco.
Patricia integrante del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la primera fila y ocupa el primer lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste un polerón negro y jeans azules, su cabello además lo usa suelto. Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio desde hace 10 años. Comenzó como comerciante ambulante y desde hace 1 año se estableció con un local establecido de abarrotes, ubicado al interior de su casa. 
Su horario laboral es de 9ºº de la mañana, hasta las 10:30 de la noche, comenta que tiene bastante clientela, sin embargo el momento del día que más vende es durante las tardes. 
Su mercadería la compra en supermercados mayoristas y distribuidoras.
Con el crédito comprará mercadería para surtir su negocio.
Las metas en su negocio son ampliar el local que actualmente tiene, para abastecerlo de mercadería y mayor variedad de productos, sus proyecciones son tener un minimarket. 
Patricia vive junto a sus dos hijos de 13 y 7 años de edad, sus sueños a nivel personal son continuar con su negocio, ya que éste le proporciona el sustento económico que su familia necesita, además comprar un vehículo que le permita trasladar su mercadería cada vez que la compra. 
Otro de sus sueños es retomar con sus estudios en prevención de riesgos. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito y los servicios brindados por Fondo, comenta que existe una my buena relación junto al grupo del Banco comunal, ya que hay confianza y compromiso.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Seucheleufu” and it has 20 enterprising members who carry out a variety of occupations.  Among them are found: used clothes sales, new clothes sales, grocery sales, sales of fruit, eggs, groceries, leather working, pastry making and taxi and collective transportation service providing.  All are residents of the city of Temuco.

Patricia is a communal bank member.  In the photo she’s in the front row, first from left to right, wearing a black sweatshirt and blue jeans; she wears her hair loose.  She’s been a merchant for ten years.  She started out as a street vendor but a year ago set up a home-based grocery store.  Her work schedule is 9am to 10:30pm.  She comments that she has quite a few customers though she says that the time of highest sales is evening.  She buys her merchandise in wholesale supermarkets and from suppliers.  The loan is to buy merchandise to stock the store.  Her business goal is to expand the locale she currently has to stock it with merchandise and a greater variety of products; her projection is to have a minimarket.

Patricia lives with her two children who are 13 and 7 years of age.  Her dream on a personal level is to stay in business since this is her means of family support; she’d also like to buy a vehicle to transport her merchandise each time she buys it.  Another of her dreams is to restart her risk prevention studies.  She’s very happy and grateful for the loan and the services provided by Fondo.  She comments that there is a very good relationship in the communal bank because there is trust and commitment.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region.  The city is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago (Capital of Chile).  There is a series of lakeside resorts around it (Pucón, Villarrica) and very showy flora and fauna concentrated in nearby natural parks.  It’s worth mentioning that 50% of the Mapuche indigenous population that exists in our country lives in this region.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Ebadne

texts.en:
Ebadne is 47 years old and lives in Tacloban, Siquijor, Siquijor.  She is married with three children.
Ebadne has a Sari Sari Store to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more stock for her general store.
Ebadne has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for three years. Ebadne hopes to grow her business and improve her family's circumstances.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for a general store

loans.name: Edlene

texts.en:
This is Edlene, 27, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Hadjie, 34, her business partner. She is the mother of four children, two are in in high school and her twins are both in elementary school. She enjoys being a mother a mother and businesswoman. Her husband helps her manage their business.

Edlene has a barbeque stall business. She buys raw pork, chicken and fish.  She prepares and cooks different barbequed dishes and sells them in her neighborhood, to passers-by, tricycle drivers and other people in her local community.  Her store is located near the street. She earns 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) from her business daily.

She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 8,000 that will give her additional capital. She will be using the loan to set up a variety store just next to her barbeque stall business. She believes that the variety store will surely attract her regular customers to buy the commodities they need at home. Selling food and the variety store she believes will let her make more profit that she can save for the future of her children.
  
Edlene hopes that her businesses will grow and she will have more profit that will enable her to send her children to school until they reach college. Her ultimate dream for her children is that they get diplomas.  She hopes and prays that the aspirations and dreams of her children will come true someday.  She never fails to attend the weekly fellowship* that helps her to gain more knowledge about the goodness of God to everyone.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for  products she needed in starting her variety store business

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor, 50 years of age, is married and has two children. The family lives in Cauayan City, Isabela where Nestor generates income by planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has more than 31 years of experience in farming and is able to earn PHP 25,000 with each crop. Nestor's wife has a business raising hogs for their additional income.

The income from their businesses helps Nestor and his wife to cope with the family's needs. Nestor wants to obtain a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers and corn seedlings. He hopes that he can get the amount requested to further the growth of his business.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers and corn seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chairs, tables, tents and fabrics

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Marilou requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her "bibingka" (a type of rice cake) food production business.

Marilou has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Marilou would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her "bibingka" food production business.

loans.name: Norvin Aarón

texts.es:
El joven Norvin Aarón es  casado y se dedica a la actividad de compra y venta de ropa usada, con la que ha desarrollado su familia llevando el sustento a su hogar. Cabe mencionar que es un joven muy entusiasta y con muchos deseos de superación.

Una de las necesidades que atraviesa es la de comprar ropa por pacas de calidad  para satisfacer a su clientela en precios y calidad principalmente para cubrir la demanda en esta temporada de fin de año. 

Por eso acudió a  Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito para la compra de ropa mixta para damas, caballeros, gorras, bolsos y zapatos para satisfacer la demanda y obtener los ingresos para el bienestar de su familia, ya que esta actividad la ejerce desde hace 5 años, teniendo buenos resultados en sus ventas.
texts.en:
Young Norvin Aaron is married and has a business buying and selling used clothing, through which he has been able to raise his family and sustain his home. It is worth mentioning that he is an enthusiastic young man who is eager to excel.

Norvin needs to purchase bundles of quality clothing to meet his customers price and quality expectations, and particularly to meet the high demand during the holiday season at the end of the year. 

Norvin went to CEPRODEL to request a loan to purchase mixed clothes for women and men including hats, bags and shoes to meet customer demand and earn an income to provide for the welfare of his family. He has had this business for 5 years and as achieved good sales results.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes such as hats and purses, bundles of shoes and mixed clothing, for subsequent sale.

loans.name: Aquiles

texts.es: El Sr. Aquiles vive en casa familiar, de los papás de la cónyuge, no tienen hijos todavía, pero en un futuro desea tener hijos, la actividad principal es el Internet, tienen un café internet que ambos atienden, y donde les va muy bien,  el internet es en el mismo domicilio. El crédito lo invertirán en mejorar y refaccionar otro ambiente para su internet ya que por la mucha clientela le quedo chico y desea ampliar su negocio, el se siente feliz ya que gracias al apoyo de la institución crecerá su negocio, y mejora su calidad de vida, ya que esta es su única fuente de ingreso para la familia, el es un joven emprendedor con ganas de superación que con el tiempo desea poder abrir otra sucursal de su negocio.
texts.en:
Aquiles lives in the home of his in-laws. He and his wife don't have children yet, but they wish to have children in the future. His principal activity is the internet; he has an internet cafe that he and his wife attend to, and it is going very well. The internet cafe is located in their domicile.

The loan will be invested in improving and furnishing an additional room for their internet cafe, since given the present number of customers, the space seems too small and Aquiles wants to expand the business. He is happy since, thanks to our institution's help, he can expand the business and improve his family's quality of life. This is their only source of income. Aquiles is an enterprising youth with the desire to get ahead. In time, he wants to open another branch of his business.

loans.use: refurbish and improve an added room for his internet cafe.

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.ru: Фирдавс женат и любящий отец двоих детей. Он с детства приучен к физическому труду. Пять лет назад они с отцом начали  дехканское хозяйство. Трудно было начинать бизнес, были долги . В прошлом году они собрали хороший урожай  хлопка и получили хорошую прибыль, улучшили благосостояние семьи. К сожалению этот год стал неудачным, большая конкуренция, плохое сырье, низкие цены на сельхозпродукции. Он вынужден был искать дополнительные финансовые источники для покупки семян лука и картофеля, потому что он не продал свой урожай и они останутся до того, когда цены поднимутся.
texts.en: Firdavs is married and is a loving father of two children.  He has been used to physical labor since childhood.  He and his father started a dekhan farm five years.  It was difficult to start the business, and they had debts.  Last year, they gathered a good harvest of cotton and made a good profit, and improved their family's welfare.  Unfortunately, this year turned out to be unlucky.  There was a lot of competition, bad raw materials and low prices for agricultural crops.  Firdavs had to find additional financial sources to purchase onion and potato seeds because he did not sell his harvest, which he will keep until the prices increase.

loans.use: to buy onion and potato seeds

loans.name: Nuvia Veronica

texts.en:
My name is Nuvia and I create and sell sweets such as dulce de leche and chocolates. My major buyers are people who own pulperias(cafe/stores) sweets stands, and some restraunts. I have had my business for 5 years, and I have generated earnings enough to continue my studies because my parents do not have many resources and I study at night. Right now I am making baskets for the holiday season so that I can carry my sweets in them.

Loan Use: Purchase milk, cocoa, cinnamon and other items

Me llamo Nuvia y me dedico a la preparacion de dulces de leche y conservas de coco. Mis mayores compradores son personas que tienen pulperias, casetas de dulces, algunos restaurantes. Tengo cinco años de dedicarme a este negocio que me ha generado ingresos para continuar con mis estudios ya que mis padres son de escasos recursos y estudio por la noche. En este momento por epoca navideña las personas que preparan canastas me hacen encargos para colocar mis conservas y dulces en sus canastas.

loans.use: Compra de leche, coco, canela y otros

loans.name: Lipine

texts.en: Lipine M. is a well-known businesswoman.  She works hard in order to satisfy the needs of her family. She has nine children; five are married, and three are not married.  Lipine comes from a family of six people.  She is a hard-working person and strives to earn income one day at a time.  She earns 150 tala (USD 50) a day for selling her products at the market, to small retailers, and at her residence.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, planting materials, fertilizers, and pesticides

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.en:
Rosa Maria is a 40-year-old native of Hualahuises, New Leon. At a young age her parents moved to Monterrrey where the family has lived ever since. Her husband has worked in the United States for several years. Rosa Maria has four children; two are married, and one of the two adolescent children, who are economically dependent on Rosa, is currently studying. She began her business to drive the economy of her home; the food she sells also includes tamales and desserts. She sells these locally and through special orders made by her clients.

At this moment, she seeks a loan of 325 dollars to be used in the purchase of materials and business capital to increase her sales. She intends to pay back this loan within 4-8 months. You can help contribute to the improvement of this family’s way of life; Rosa Maria seeks your support and appreciates any help you can lend.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa Maria tiene 40 años de edad y es originaria de Hualahuises, Nuevo León, desde niña sus papás se mudaron a Monterrey, donde ha vivido toda su vida y ahora con sus hijos, su esposo esta trabajando en Estados Unidos desde hace varios años. Rosa Maria tiene 4 hijos, dos casados y dos adolescentes que aun están estudiando y dependen de ella económicamente. Razón por la cual ella comenzó a trabajar para impulsar la economía de su hogar, iniciando su negocio de venta de comidas, también hace tamales y postres, los cuales vende con sus vecinos y también cuando sus clientes le hacen encargos especiales.

En estos momentos requiere un crédito por la cantidad de $ 325 dólares que empleará en la comprar de materiales y capital de trabajo para poder incrementar sus ventas, ella ofrece devolver este préstamo en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses. Tú puedes contribuir a mejorar la calidad de vida de esta familia, Rosa Maria necesita de tu apoyo y agradece cualquier ayuda que puedas brindarle.

loans.use: To purchase consumables

loans.name: Thet

texts.en:
Thet was married in 1993. She has only one daughter who is studying in a primary school in her village. She currently sells groceries such as fruits, vegetables, meats and other food items from home. Her husband drives a motor taxi in Phnom Penh city. 
 
She is requesting a loan in the amount of $500 in order to buy stone pillars, lattice and zinc for repairing her house and purchasing more grocery items. By doing this, she can expand her business and will have the capacity to repay the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: Purchasing stone pillars, lattice and zinc for repairing her house.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
Mrs. Eliana is 35 years old and dedicates herself to selling groceries, vegetables, candy and sweets in a store she operates from her home in the Bellavista District in the city of San Martín. She decided to open the business to manage her own income and she wanted a business that would allow her to work from home where she could care for her family, especially her young children. She has 3 children, 2 sons and 1 daughter. Two of her children are in grade school and the last one is a baby. She is a woman with a great spirit to overcome adversities. Recently, she began attending computer classes to stay up-to-date with technology. She belongs to the “Virgen de la Puerta” communal bank promoted by Manuela Ramos. She has requested $310.00 with which she plans to purchase basic necessities such as rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil, legumes, a variety of vegetables as well as stationary items such as notebooks, pencils, pens and erasers. This will allow her to increase the items she is able to offer her customers and satisfy them seeing as how hers is the only store of its kind in the neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Christian G., Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Eliana tiene 35 años y se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, verduras, dulces y golosinas en un negocio que puso en su propia casa ubicada en el distrito de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Decidió iniciar su negocio para poder manejar sus propios recursos y porque quería un negocio en el cual no hubiera necesidad de ausentarse de la casa ya que de esa forma podía atender a su familia, principalmente a sus hijos. Tiene 3 hijos, 2 varones y 1 mujer, 2 de los cuales están en la etapa escolar, y el ultimo todavía es un bebe. Ella es una mujer con un espíritu de superación envidiable, hace poco se matriculó en un instituto donde está recibiendo clases de computación, ya que según menciona quiere estar a la par con la nueva era y la tecnología. Pertenece al Banco Comunal "Virgen de la Puerta" promovido por Manuela Ramos, ha solicitado S/. 1,000.00 ($ 310.00) con lo cual adquirirá artículos de primera necesidad como arroz y azúcar en sacos, cajas de leche, aceite, menestras, verduras variadas, y otros artículos de librería como cuadernos, lapiceros, lápices, borradores, esto permitirá aumentar el stock de su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, ya que este negocio es el único existente por la zona en donde ella vive.

loans.use:
Purchase products in bulk. Groceries.

Comprar artículos en general. Abarrotes.

loans.name: Isaura Margarita

texts.es:
Isaura's small business selling fruits and vegetables is located in the outskirts of the market inside the León bus station. The post is along the sidewalk under a black plastic roof, with the products displayed in the baskets they are transported in. She is married and has three kids, all of whom are studying education.

The business has been around 11 years, always located in the same place. Her husband works as a security guard, but his income isn't enough to cover all the household expenses. In spite of their modest means, the family owns a home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El pequeño negocio de venta de frutas y verduras que esta señora posee está ubicado en las afueras del mercado La estación de la ciudad de León. El puesto se encuentra sobre la acera bajo un techo improvisado hecho totalmente de plástico negro y donde el producto se exhibe en canastas en los cuales se transportan los productos. Ella es acompañada y tiene un total de tres hijos todos ellos estudiando el ciclo básico.

El negocio tiene más de 11 años de existir, siempre ubicada en el mismo lugar. Su pareja labora como guarda de seguridad pero sus ingresos no son suficientes para cubrir todos los gastos familiares. Tiene un total de 3 hijos todos ellos están cursando su ciclo básico de educación. A pesar de lo modesto de sus ingresos ella posee su humilde vivienda.

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia is 24 years old and the mother of a 5-year-old daughter. She has been running her business by selling cosmetics on credit. She usually earns $2 per day.

Her husband sells vegetables at the market and earns $20 income per day. She wants to add to her working capital and requests a $50 loan to buy more goods and make it more sustainable. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To add to her working capital

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 28 years old he is married and has two children. His father and mother live with him. He has a small shop selling electrical goods. He applied to get $1200 to purchase new electric goods, install new shelves and renovate the shop, and hire one unemployed person to increase his income and provide a better life for his family.

This entrepreneur is from a volatile region and repayment risk may be higher. Lenders should consider this when making this loan.

To protect his identity, this entrepreneur's name has been modified and his face has been obscured in the photo.

loans.use: Purchase new electric goods

loans.name: Gregoria Argentina

texts.es:
Gregoria M. is a mother of two children in scholastic age, she is an entrepreneur and desires to develop a mill business to be able to support her family. Her biggest dream is to see her children turn out as great professionals

Twenty years ago Mrs. M. started her business with her own savings and got a small mill machine. Over the years her business has been increasing, and she has been able to offer a better service with good mill machines. She grinds all type of products like cacao, corn, different grains, etc.

Mrs. M. has worked with CEPRODEL for several years and she feels very satisfied with their support, this way she has been able to increase her business, satisfy her customers’ needs and provide for her children. She has a record of 17 Loans and hopes to obtain greater amounts of credits to grow her business and get new customers. Her current need is to buy replacement parts for the mills.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva volunteer.

Gregoria M. es madre de dos hijos en edad escolar, es emprendedora y con deseos de desarrollar su negocio de molino para poder apoyar a su familia ofreciéndole una vida estable. Su mayor sueño es ver a sus hijos convertidos en grandes profesionales.

Desde hace veinte años la Sra. M. inició con una pequeña maquina de moler la cual al paso de los años ha ido incrementando, pudiendo ofrecer un mejor servicio con buenas maquinas de moler todo tipo de producto como cacao, maiz, granos, etc. Su capital inicial lo obtuvo por medio de ahorros propios que obtuvo a lo largo de su juventud.

La Sra. M. trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace varios años y se siente muy satisfecha por el apoyo ofrecido, ya que de esta manera ha podido incrementar su negocio, satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela y sacar adelante a sus hijos. Ella tiene un record de 17 créditos y anhela obtener mayores cantidades de créditos para engrandecer su negocio y llamar la atención de nuevos clientes. Su actual necesidad es la compra de repuestos para el molino.

loans.use: To buy partsfor her  mill business

loans.name: Wakaliga E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Shakirah N.. She is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase more cutlery and furniture. Shakirah is 31 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has 3 children and her children go to school. Each week, Shakirah makes approximately UGX 120000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children. Shakirah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in order to expand the business and the loan was paid back on time.

Shakirah is joined in her small group by Mukibi N., Aidah N., Topista N., and Nulu N.. Mukibi N. has a business selling soft drinks and wants to purchase a fridge. Aidah N. is currently operating a business in used clothing sales and wants a loan to expand capital. Topista N. operates a business selling vegetables and wants to add working capital. Nulu N. is currently in the business of new clothing sales and is requesting a loan to increase inventory.

loans.use: To purchase more restaurant equipment and food

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina is an entrepreneurial and persevering woman currently enrolled in the university but lacking financial support from her family. She decided to start a business that would generate income to cover her tuition fees and school supplies, and that is how 2 years ago she began selling beauty products.

She now needs a loan for US $350, which she will repay in 4 months, to purchase merchandise and stock her business. With your support, Carolina will be able to continue with her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Carolina es una mujer emprendedora y perseverante, que actualmente cursa la universidad pero ante la falta de apoyo económico de su familia, decidió emprender una actividad que le generara ingresos para solventar las colegiaturas y material de estudio, fue así como hace 2 años se inicio en la venta de productos de belleza.

Ahora necesita un crédito por US $350 que pagara en 4 meses para surtir su negocio, comprando mercancía, con tu apoyo carolina podrá seguir estudiando.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise (beauty products) to stock her business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce K. is 40 years old. She is a wife and mother of 3 children, who are in school. She sells clothing materials, female slippers, and dressing bags. Joyce is very hard working and a good homemaker too. She wants to use the loan to buy more supplies of clothing materials, dressing bags, and female slippers. She wants to make use of this opportunity to expand her business and increase her family income. She belongs to the community group called Adoration Trust Group. The group members guarantee that each member repays her loans and provide social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of clothing materials, dressing bags, and female slippers

loans.name: Efraín

texts.es:
Efraín is a responsible father who, seeing the strategic location where his home was located, decided to outfit it so he could open a small concession stand. He offers delicious cakes, sodas, hamburgers, juices and yogurts. He prepares his items personally for his regular and demanding customers. Thanks to this business which he started more than four years ago, and the income earned by his dear wife at her restaurant, they maintain their home and provide an education for their child.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Efraín es un padre muy responsable, observando el lugar estratégico en que está ubicado su domicilio decidió aprovechar y adecuarlo para abrir un pequeño snack en donde ofrece deliciosas tortas, gaseosas, hamburguesas, jugos y, yogures. Que personalmente prepara para sus asiduos y exigentes clientes.Gracias a este negocio que emprendió hace más de 4 años y a los ingresos que obtiene su querida esposa en su restaurante mantienen su hogar y le otorgan educación a su pequeño.

loans.use: Increase of capital to make improvements to work area.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan A. is 37 years old and lives in the suburbs of Beirut, where he makes a living cutting and styling men's hair. In the past, Hassan has received two loans from Al Majmoua. The first was to pay expenses associated with opening his business, and the second to develop it. Now he has come to us for a loan of $1,200 to buy more equipment, such as a chair in which to cut and style people's hair.  This loan will allow him to expand his business. Hassan has always succeeded in repaying his loans on time.

loans.use: To buy equipment for a barber shop

loans.name: Rosa Mercedes

texts.es:
Rosa Mercedes is a street vendor that sells food during the breakfast and lunch times outside of a health stand near her home. She is the mother of 7 children; all grown up and with their own families. Presently, she lives only with her husband Hugo, who supports her very much with the business. Rosa Mercedes wants to grow her business. In order to do that, she will need to expand and fix the the surroundings and environment of her business and with some time, Rosa Mercedes wants to be able to establish the restaurant at her home since it is located in a commercial zone. For this purpose, she is asking for a loan to improve her food stand and be able to establish the restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg

Rosa Mercedes vende comida a la hora del desayuno y el almuerzo de manera ambulante, en la afueras de un puesto de salud cerca su casa, es madre de 7 hijos, todos ya con su propia familia, en la actualidad sólo vive con su esposo Hugo, quien la apoya mucho en su negocio.Rosa Mercedes quiere crecer, para eso desea ampliar y arreglar los ambientes de su negocio y con el tiempo poner un restaurante en su casa, ya que se encuentra ubicada en una zona comercial, para lograr este propósito solicita el presente préstamo para la mejora de su puesto de comida y con ello la implementación de un restaurante.

loans.use: Investment capital to start a restaurant and discontinue selling food on the street.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Antonia M. tiene 37 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera pero esta viviendo en pareja desde hace mucho tiempo con el señor Santiago Sanabria, de 43 años de edad. Viven en su propia casa que esta situada en el Barrio San Pedro Vivienda 2da. Etapa.

Ellos tienen 4 hijos que viven con ellos y aun dependen económicamente de los padres porque son menores de edad.

La señora Antonia posee una Despensa y Comedor desde hace unos años en la cual cuenta con buena cantidad de mercaderías y además hace servicios de viandas a los obreros de la zona. El señor Santiago se dedica a realizar extensiones de líneas y montajes de transformadores en distintos lugares de la zona. Mediante este trabajo el también puede ayudar a su señora para poder cubrir los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus hijos.

La señora ha solicitado el crédito para la compra de más mercaderías para su Despensa e insumos para realizar comidas, tales como: harinas, panificados, productos enlatados, bebidas en general, yerbas, fideos, arroz, frutas, verduras, artículos de limpieza, y otros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Antonia M. is 37 years old, single but has lived with her 43 year old partner Mr. Santiago Sanabria for quite some time. They live in their own home located int eh San Pedro Vivienda 2da. Etapa neighborhood.

They have 4 children that live with them and are still dependent on their parents because they are minors (not of adult age).

Antonia has owned a small store and café for a few years and she has a good quantity of merchandise and additionally she provides meal service to workers in the area. Santiago installs extension lines and assembles transformers in various places in the neighborhood. With this work he can also help his wife cover the household expenses and education expenses of their children.

Antonia is asking for a loan to buy merchandise for her store and ingredients to make meals such as: flour, baked goods, canned goods, beverages, herbs, noodles, rice, fruit, cleaning supplies and more.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise such as: flour, baked goods, canned goods, beverages, herbs, noodles, rice, fruit, cleaning supplies and more.

loans.name: Mrs. Loem Sao Group

texts.en:
Loem S. is 38 years old, married, and has five children. Four are enrolled in the local school, while the other is too young to attend. Loem is working hard to provide her children with a quality education and support her family financially.

Loem S. is the group leader of a business located in Ou Kralanh Duol Village in the Takeo Province. Her group consists of six members. She owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice to make a living. Currently, she faces several problems, including infertile ground which is affecting her crop. In order to solve this problem, Loem has decided to ask for a loan in order to purchase fertilizers and enrich her land. Her husband, Mr. Un Moeurn, is a livestock breeder and currently has two cows and two pigs.

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Five members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's developing entrepreneurs. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Hasina's Group

texts.en:
This is a group of three ladies who live in Zanzibar. They are requesting a loan through BRAC Zanzibar. The group leader, Hasina M., is fifty years old and married with three children. She has been selling fish and firewood since 1999, and currently earns about $50 in monthly profits from her businesses. She is now requesting a loan to buy large quantities of fish and firewood in bulk for her business.

Hasina shares this loan with her fellow group members, Fatma and Nunuu. They thank you for your support.

loans.use: To buy fish and firewood in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Lola

texts.en:
Lola is 37 years old. She is married with two children.

Lola has a store where she sells underwear and nightgowns. She has been in this business for the last five years.

Through her business, she assists her husband in feeding the family and also in paying for the children’s education. In most places in Nigeria, sixty percent of family burden is taken care of by the woman. This trend has compelled most women to be industrious and hardworking lest the family remain in abject poverty.

Lola needs a loan of N70,000 so she can purchase more underwear and nightgowns to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more underwear and nightgowns to sell

loans.name: Célestrine

texts.fr: Dame H. Célestrine , âgée de 33 ans.Elle est née à SO-AVA dont elle est originaire .Elle n'a pas eu la chance d'aller à l'école .Dès son jeune âge ,elle aidait sa mère dans la vente d'akassa (boule de pâte faite à base de maïs) ,accompagné de la sauce au poisson frais.Elle l'accompagnait également vendre de poissons fumés à gbadagri non loin de la frontière Benin-Nigeria.Après la naissance de son premier garçon :Roland,13 ans aujourd'hui et  en classe de CE1, elle s'est mise dans la vente de poissons fumés .Et c'est d'ailleurs pour le renforcement de cette activité,qu'elle sollicite ce 3ème prêt d'une durée de 08 mois.Mariée à AGBEKPONOU Luc,menuisier de formation,elle est mère de 04 enfants dont Florent le benjamin est âgé de 07 ans.Elle compte s'approvisionner uniquement en poissons frais.
texts.en:
Mrs. Célestrine H., 33, was born in So-Ava, where she comes from. She did not have the good fortune to attend school. Ever since she was a young girl, she helped her mother sell "akassa" (balls of porridge made of maize) accompanied by a sauce made with fresh fish. She also went with her mother to sell smoked fish in Gbadagri, not far from the border of Benin with Nigeria.

After the birth of her first son, Roland, presently 13 and in second grade, she began to sell smoked fish. And it is in fact with a view to bolstering this business that she is requesting this third loan with a term of 8 months. Married to Luc Agbekponou, a trained carpenter, she is the mother of 4 children, of whom the youngest, Florent, is 7. She intends to stock up only on fresh fish.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 6 cases of fresh fish

loans.name: Nary's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nary C. the leader of a four-person village loan group. The group members live in Au Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. 

Mrs. Nary C. is farmer who grows rice and vegetables. She now faces a problem, because she does not have enough money to buy vegetable seeds. To deal with this problem, Mrs. Nary C. has decided to ask for a loan to buy seeds. 

Her husband, Mr. Sok San, is a construction worker who can make a little income to support the family. Mrs. Nary C. is 29 years old and the mother of three children, ages one, four, and five years old. 

One member is this village bank loan has an end-of-term loan. The rest have monthly payment loans. This client with the end-of-term loan is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les huit (08) membres du groupe Benkadi  de l’association Djiguissèmè sont toutes mariées et vivent dans des grandes familles polygames avec en moyenne 40 ans et 5 enfants. Ils résident dans le village de Zogofina préfecture de Ségou(quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de mariage dans le village.
Dans le souci de développer leur activité, ces femmes ont décidés d’intégrer le programme  crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur 5ème prêt solidaire après avoir correctement remboursé tous les précédents.
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 233 sacs de charbon de bois et 33 chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe. Elles se  ravitaillent en charbon et bois dans les villages de Tièbléna, Zenguena, Songnebougou et Sakebougou ; Parfois les producteurs de charbon viennent les ravitailler sur place au village. En plus de ces deux produits certaines femmes du groupe font aussi la vente des calebasses, du mil et du riz dans  les villages environnants et le marché de Médine Ségou. Quant au charbon de bois et au bois de chauffe, ils sont écoulés  dans les charrettes en ambulant à travers les différents quartiers de Ségou  ou à domicile au village au comptant et à crédit  à  une clientèle composée  d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 51 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt et contribuer aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
The eight members of this Benkadi group, belonging to the association Djiguissèmè, are all married and live in big polygamous families. They have an average age of 40 and on average, 5 children. They live in the village of Zogofina, prefecture of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know each other because they are neighbors in their village or are related.

In the intention of developing their businesses, these women decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom they are presently on their 5th solidarity loan, after having correctly reimbursed all the preceding loans. This loan will be used to buy 233 sacks of charcoal and 33 wagon loads of firewood. They buy the charcoal and the firewood in the villages of Tièbléna, Zenguena, Songnebougou, and Sakebougou. Sometimes the charcoal makers come to deliver directly to them in their village. Besides these two products, some of the women in the group also sell gourds, millet, and rice in the surrounding villages and the market of Médine Ségou. They sell the charcoal and the firewood, transporting it in wagons, going door-to-door in the various neighborhoods of Ségou or they sell right at their homes, for cash and on credit, to a clientele composed of men and women.

They hope to make an average monthly profit of 51,000 F CFA which will be used to make repayments on the loan and to contribute to supporting their families.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy charcoal and firewood for re-sale

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Bancomunal Siempre Juntas
Carmen es conviviente, tiene 56 años, un hijo de 14 años que esta en la escuela particular.
Carmen empezó su negocio de venta de ropa con los prestamos de Finca, empezó vendiendo polos, ahora su sobrina le manda ropa de Italia tres veces al año día de la madre, fiestas patrias, y navidad.  
Necesita un préstamo de 3,400 soles, para comprar ropa importada de Italia.
Desde que esta en finca ha crecido en su negocio, aprendió ahorrar y como administrar su dinero, a sacar su ganancia del capital.  
El sueño de Carmen es poner una tienda bazar en su casa, pero le faltan terminar los acabados.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Bancocomunal Siempre Juntas. She is 56 years old, married, and has a 14-year-old son who is attending a private school. Carmen started her clothing business with loans from Finca. She started by buying polo shirts, and now her niece sends her clothing from Italy three times a year: Mother's Day, Fiestas Patrias and Christmas. Carmen needs a loan of 3,400 Soles to buy more clothes imported from Italy. As her business has grown, she's learned how to save and manage her money, and how to draw capital gains. Carmen's dream is to have a shop in her home, but she doesn't yet have the resources to make that happen.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing imported from Italy

loans.name: Edeliza

texts.en: Mrs. Edeliza L., 19, has 1 child and is married to Roger, a farmer. Her early marriage prompted her to earn a living. She strives hard to help her husband so that they can provide for the immediate needs of their family. She manages a variety store in her village, and once she became aware of the micro-finance institution HSPFI, she immediately joined and received an initial loan of PHP5000. Limited stock and increasing demands from her customers proved that this amount was insufficient. Now, she is in need of additional capital amounting to PHP 11000 which will be used to purchase more grocery items for her variety store.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for her variety store.

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mohammad Nahim

texts.en:
M. Nahim is the son of M. A.. He lives in district 12th, Kabul Afghanistan. He is married and lives in a family of five members. He is a wood seller and all the family members benefit from the income he generates. M. Nahim has six years experience in this business and he is confident that he can work harder.
He would like to expand his business and buy more wood, so he has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 12 months. He hopes to increase his business as soon as possible and bring some new changes to it. He wants to say that Kiva is a really effective process.

loans.use: To purchase more wood and expand his business

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr:
A. Célestine est née vers les années 1970 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Célestine est mariée à AHINAZAN Delphin agent de bureau au port de douane de Cotonou. Célestine est mère de quatre (04) enfants tous scolarisés, excepté Charles, l’aîné, âgé de vingt (20) ans et apprenti soudeur. Célestine et sa famille réside au quartier Cité Ville Nouvelle, une banlieue de Cotonou. Célestine vend des divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, etc.). C'est de ménage en ménage, le plateau de divers sur la tête que Célestine passe vendre ses articles. Pour élever le niveau de son activité et avoir plus de revenu pour mieux satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de sa famille, Célestine sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Célestine A. was born about 1970 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Célestine is married to Delphin Ahinazan, an agent at the port in Cotonou. She is the mother of four (4) children who are all in school, with the exception of Charles, the eldest, aged 20, who is an apprentice welder. Célestine and her family live in Cite Ville Nouvelle, a suburb of Cotonou. She sells various items including candies, biscuits, milk cartons, sardines, tomatoes, sugar, basic meat spreads, washing soaps, dishes, toiletries etc. With a basin of these work items piled on her head, Célestine make the rounds, hawking her goods. She is requesting this loan from ALIDe to increase her business and have more operating revenue to meet her customers needs and those of her family. Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies of candies, biscuits, milk cartons, sardines, tomatoes, sugar, basic meat spreads, washing soaps, dishes, toiletries etc. for resale

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemarie B. is a 36-year-old business woman who is married, has one child and lives in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She started her business selling dried squid several years ago with a small amount of capital, and would like to continue to expand it to meet the needs of her customers. She’s grateful for the help she receives from the Paglaum Cooperative because it has provided training on GMP (Good Manufacturing Practices), including proper handling and packaging. Today, her dried squid is well-labeled and highly regarded for its taste. The increasing demand for her products has led her to apply for this loan, which she will use to buy more squid. She wants her business to grow so she can give her family a better life. She also wants her product to be famous as the most convenient and tasty dried squid on the market.

loans.use: to raise additional capital for a business that prepares and sells dried squid

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is fifty-four years old. She is divorced and has five children who are all currently in school. She lives with her family in Kasoa in the central part of Ghana.

Grace sells palm oil and palm nuts in the local market in Kasoa. Grace buys the palm nuts from farmers in her community and in surrounding villages. She wants a loan to buy palm fruits in bulk so that she can distribute them to more of her customers.

Grace belongs to a trust bank group called God’s Blessings. The group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of palm nut fruits.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La señora Elena, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor de Los Milagros”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Imicati, distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno. Tiene 41 años, es casada y madre de 03 hijos (estudiantes de educación superior),posee estudios de primaria completa, y vive en el centro poblado de Imicati.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 8 años, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, para su aumentar el capital de su negocio de compra y venta de ganado menor. 

Actualmente solicita un préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su actual negocio, que es la compra de abarrotes como: azúcar, arroz, leche, fideos, aceite, galletas, harina y otros para luego venderlos en su tienda.

Su mayor sueño es poder vender ropa de abrigo al por mayor.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y la facilidad en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Elena belongs to the Señor de Los Milagros ("Our Father of Miracles") Village Bank, which is located in the Imicati Community of Yunguyo Distruct, Chucuito Province, Puno Department. She is 41 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in college. Elena finished primary school, and lives in the center of Imicati. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for almost eight years, and used her very first loan of 300 soles to increase working capital for her business buying and selling livestock. She is now requesting a loan of 1500 soles to invest in her current business by buying basic grocery items like sugar, rice, milk, pasta, oil, cookies, flour, etc. She will then sell these items in her store. Elena's greatest dream is to sell warm clothing in bulk. Her favorite parts of participating in a village bank are her savings account and the ease with which she can take out loans.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar, rice, milk, pasta, oil, cookies and flour

loans.name: Frank

texts.en: Frank K. is twenty-nine years old. He is married with three kids who are currently in school. He is a dealer in electronic parts like speakers, transistors, transformers, screwdrivers, wires, television cords, antennas etc. He also provides repairs and servicing work for his customers. He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices from Kumasi and sells to his customers at retail prices. He is requesting this loan to enable him to procure increased stock of electrical and electronic parts. He hopes to increase his savings to expand his shop to include refrigerators and parts.

loans.use: To procure increased stock of electrical and electronic parts.

loans.name: Chim

texts.en: Chim S. is a 34-year-old father of two teenage children who are currently in school. His wife is a garment worker. Since early 1999, he has made a living both planting crops and fishing in and around Tonle Sap Lake. For his fishing business, he wakes up every day early in the morning to prepare his fishing equipment and then after the sun rises he hurries to bring his fish to his regular market retailers.  He sells the fish to them on credit, which means he gets income from his customers after they finish selling. Recently, he hasn't been catching as much fish as before because his tools often break down. Therefore, he would like a loan to buy additional fishing tools for his business. He will use the remainder of loan to grow crops. He and his wife are pictured here.

loans.use: To buy fishing tools.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca es socia del Banco Comunal “30 D. Agosto”, en el distrito D. Ilave, provincia D. El Collao, en el departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 70 años D. edad, es V. y madre D. 02 hijos, ella pudo estudiar educación primaria incompleta.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 9 años, su negocio es la venta D. abarrotes, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para adquirir abarrotes.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma D. S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar azúcar, arroz, leche, fideos, aceite, conservas, sal, etc. Para aumentar a su tienda.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Francisca is a member of the 30 D. Agosto (August 30th) Community Bank in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, department of Puno, Peru. She is a 70-year-old widow and mother of two children who never finished elementary school. She has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for the past nine years. Her first loan for her grocery store was for 500 soles, which she used to purchase more groceries. Currently, she is in need of an additional loan, which is why she has come to request 1,000 soles. She plans to use the loan to purchase sugar, rice, milk, noodles, oil, canned goods, salt and other items to better stock her store. Her dream is to keep working, and she enjoys the savings and meetings she gets from her community bank.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, rice, milk, noodles, oil, canned goods, salt and other grocery items

loans.name: Muhamadali

texts.ru: Мухамадали Махмудов проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 51 год. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Мухамадали имеет высшее образование. Он более 26 лет работает  на своем тракторе, пашет земли односелчан. В данный момент его трактор сломался и он просит кредит для его ремонта, чтобы предоставлять качественные услуги, т.к. трактор является единственным источником  дохода.
texts.en:
Muhamadali M. lives in the Hamadoni region. He is 51 years old and has four children. Muhamadali has high education. He has worked on his tractor for more than nine years, he plows the land of his fellow villagers. At this time his tractor is broken and he is asking for a loan to repair it to resume his quality services as this tractor is the only source of income.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair the tractor

loans.name: Etelvina

texts.es: La señora Etelvina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Tesoro Escondido”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 54 años y es madre de 07 hijos, 03 que aun depende de ella.Etelvina, lleva 02 años dedicándose a la Confección de Vestidos, poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, queriendo así implementar su propio taller de confección de vestidos y teniendo habilidad  para la costura, no dudo en hacerlo. Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus ventas, trabaja con pedidos de sus clientes anticipadamente.En la actualidad continua con sus confecciones de vestidos y tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su casa para realizar sus trabajos y pedidos, es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. Etelvina, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Etelvina belongs to the community bank “Tesoro Escondido” in the district of Juanjui, a province of Mariscal Cáceres in the San Martín department. She is married, 54 years old and the mother of 7 children, 3 of whom are still dependent on her. Etelvina has spent 2 years making clothes, and bit by bit she has been generating her own income and saving her money, which she wants to use to set up her own dressmaking workshop; as she is skillful at sewing no doubt this will happen. She tells us that her sales are doing very well and that she works to advance orders from her clients. She is currently making clothes for an already faithful clientele who she welcomes in her house on a daily basis to take orders and work on pieces and personally attends to them with her characteristic friendliness. With this loan of S/ 1,500.00 she will buy metres of different types of cloth, tools such as scissors, needles for sewing by hand and by machine, pins and buttons. Nowadays, Etelvina feels like a very accomplished woman, with a greater desire to reach for her dreams and make them reality. She gives thanks to the Kiva Field Partner Manuela Ramos for helping her to start her business and for the help they give to many woman who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sewing materials

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda T. is from the village of Z-3, Lumbia Cagayan De Oro City. She is 49 years old. Erlinda is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Erlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 23000 PHP from HSPFI. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 22000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nass' Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nass S. is a group leader of four members who all live in Bang Bat village in Takeo province. She is 40 years old and single with two sisters. She is a weaver and now she is requesting a loan to buy more raw materials for her weaving business. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family living with this loan. 

All the members in this group loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Sokhary

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhary A. lives in Kampong Chrey Village in Takeo province. She is a fish seller in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Sam Sophat, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. He is also a track driver.

Although this couple works hard, they still earn less income than they need to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Sokhary A. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She is 39 years old and the mother of four children who are enrolled in the local school. She and her husband are both presented in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina C., 68 years old, lives with her husband and son in a very remote municipality of Antique province. Despite the inaccessibility of their municipality, being one of the farthest municipalities of the province, Angelina and her family have enjoyed having a very simple life and their bountiful environment.

However, Angelina is aware that life from now on will never be the same. Even in their village, several mining activities had opened and a lot of commercial establishments were built. Because of this industrialization, financial preparation occurred to Angelina. She has to be prepared financially for her 14-year-old son, whom she wants to graduate from college to be able to have a better career and to become competitive. Therefore, Angelina wishes to borrow a larger amount through ASHI to be able to grow her variety store and hog-raising business. Profits from her businesses will augment her husband’s small monthly honorarium as the village councilor. Aside from her son to support, Angelina also wants to support a lot of grandchildren and change their lives from poverty.

loans.use: Purchase softdrinks and other beverages for her variety store; purchase food for her pigs and necessary materials for rice farming.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia MARGARITA pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN SONCCO”. El nombre del banco comunal es de origen del idioma Quechua, “HATUN” significa “Grande” y “SONCCO” significa “Corazón” que traducido al español significa “Corazón grande”. 

La socia tiene 40 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene cuatro hijos; tres varones y una mujer. El hijo mayor estudia en la universidad y los hijos menores estudian en el colegio. Ellos viven en la ciudad Imperial del Cusco. La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de comida. Nuestra socia tiene su propio stand en el mercado central de “San Pedro” del Cusco donde prepara solo almuerzo. Ya son varios años con esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora pues con mucha voluntad se levanta 5 a.m. para preparar la comida. La socia requiere el préstamo para la educación, para la alimentación, mensualidad del colegio de sus hijos y para aumentar la producción de preparación de platos de comida. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Margarita belongs to the Atún Soncco Communal Bank. The name of the communal bank is from the Quechua language. “Hatun” means big, and “Soncco” means heart. Translated into Spanish (and then into English) it means Big Heart. She is 40, in a common law marriage, and has four children; three boys and a girl. Her oldest child attends the university, and the younger children go to school. They live in the Imperial City of Cusco. She alternates her activities between the household and her food sales. She has her own stand in the central market of San Pedro in Cusco. She prepares only lunches. She has been doing this for several years. It has gone very well for her thanks to all of the effort that she puts into her work. She is a hard-working mother, and she is enterprising. She gets up at 5 a.m. to make the food. She needs the loan for education, food, monthly school fees for her children, and to increase food production of her dishes. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it back on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase production of her dishes by purchasing more supplies like sugar, rice, oil, and vegetables

loans.name: Peter Njoroge
