texts.en:
Peter is 25 years old and seeking his first loan from a microfinance institution. He has been running a phone accessories/electronics business for three years. He wants a loan to buy phone accessories and other popular items for his shop so he can keep up with demand. Now, he runs out of inventory. 

Peter's shop is located in Kangemi in a busy market area. He can see up to twenty clients within thirty minutes. Peter's goal is to open another shop and expand his phone/electronics business to other locations.

loans.use: To purchase phone accessories and items for his phone and electronics shop

loans.name: Oyedele

texts.en:
Oyedele is 35 years old and is married without children. He sells clothes at retail prices to his customers.

This is the high season for business and Oyedele hopes to meet the demands of his customers. He hopes for a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more clothes to sell.

Oyedele hopes to own a boutique in the future. He loves this business because of the profits he makes. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Madina

texts.ru: Ахунова Мадина проживает в районе Турсунзеде. Возраст, 22 года. Замужем, детей не имеет. Ахунова Мадина имеет среднее Техническое образование по специальности "Фармацевт". В этой области работает 2 года. Она занимается купле- продажей лекарственных средств. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Madina A. lives in the Tursun-zoda district. She is 22 years old, married and has no children. Madina has a secondary technical education and is a pharmacist by trade. She has been working in this field for 2 years. She is involved in buying and selling medications. Madina is obtaining this loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Nuestro socio MIGUEL, pertenecen al banco comunal “SOL DE ORO”, El socio vive en la ciudad de Cusco, en el barrio de san jerónimo ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad.

Nuestro socio tiene 23 años de edad es soltero y trabaja vendiendo ropas, el socio trabaja de manera ambulatoria, no tiene stand, el trae ropa de Juliaca y de Bolivia y lo lleva a vender a la provincia de Calca y otra parte a la provincia de Urubamba, nuestro socio viaja cada 15 días para abastecerse de ropas según la temporada y trae ropa al por mayor en diversas tallas, y los lleva a vender a estas provincias, ahí lo conocen al Sr. Miguel, el socio solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería y traer a vender a Cusco.

El socio agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member MIGUEL belongs to the communal bank "SOL DE ORO". This member lives in the city of Cuzco, neighborhood of San Jeronimo located 15 minutes from the city. Our member is 23 years old. He is single and works selling clothes. He works as a street vendor; he does not have a stand. He brings clothes from Juliaca and Bolivia and takes it to sell in the province of Calca and a part of it to the province of Urubamba. Our member travels every two weeks to supply himself with clothes according to the season and he brings clothing wholesale in different sizes and takes them to sell in these provinces. They know Mr. Miguel there. He is asking for the loan to purchase merchandise and to bring clothes to sell in Cuzco. He is grateful for and values the opportunity offered through this means. He is also commited to pay his loan within the established time.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member requires the loan to purchase clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal “Dios es Amor” desde que se fundó, vive en el distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 49 años de edad, es casada y tiene 04 hijos. Ella estudió primaria completa, se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes.

Margarita nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo que le sirvió para aumentar su capital y comprar productos para su negocio.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar  azúcar, aceite, arroz, fideos, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es abrir varias sucursales de tiendas. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las facilidades para los préstamos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Margarita is a member of the community bank “Dios es Amor” since the group was founded. She lives in the District of Juliaca, Province of San Román, Department of Puno. She is 49 years old, married and has 4 children. She completed her elementary school; she buys and sells groceries. Margarita tells us that the first loan she requested from Movimiento Manuela Ramos was for S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles (currency of Peru) and she used it to increase her working capital and to buy products for her business. She is now requesting a loan for S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles which she will use to buy sugar, oil, rice, noodles, etc. Her dream for the future is to open several store branches. What she likes the most about her community bank is the ease and support in getting loans.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar, oil, rice, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark C. is from the village of Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occdeinatl. He is 29 years old. Mark is single. To make a living, Mark works in someone else's business venture operating transportation services. The main source of income for the business comes from operating motor transport services. Mark has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mark joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mark has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Mark is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to repair his existing vehicle for better service. This will be the second loan taken out by Mark from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Walliwala Gamage

texts.en:
Walliwala is a 47-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and one child in southern Sri Lanka.

Walliwala and her husband work together in a clothing business that they operate. They started the business ten years ago, so naturally they have developed good experience and become knowledgeable about running their shop. They are located in a prime location as well, which has helped them to operate.

Walliwala is seeking a 40,000 LKR loan from BRAC. She and her husband have successfully managed the business through their hard work, and they hope to expand even further with the help of this loan.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy supplies for her clothing shop

loans.name: Rafail

texts.en:
Rafail N. has been in the auto-repair business for nine years. He was born in 1960. Rafail is married and has two children. Rafail and his family live in Baku city. You can see in this picture he is repairing a car. 

Now this man needs a loan of 2000 Azerbaijan New Manats to buy spare parts to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy the spare parts

loans.name: Manuel Joaquín

texts.es:
El Señor Manuel Joaquín P., es comerciante desde hace treinta años tiene un negocio de venta de revistas y a la vez posee una carpintería en su casa de habitación.
Su negocio de empezo con un capital de C$ 5,000 fue ahorro propio el se ha dedicado a sus hijos su esposa es ama de casa y el es el sustento de su hogar.  Con estos financiamiento el ha podido salir adelante siempre compra mercadería para su negocio su carpintería es otro ingreso pero solo trabaja por encargos. En su vida personal el siente que ha venido mejorando poco a poco ya que su casita la ha reparado al suave con las ganancias que la han quedado.
texts.en:
El Señor Manuel Joaquín P., es comerciante desde hace treinta años tiene un negocio de venta de revistas y a la vez posee una carpintería en su casa de habitación. Su negocio de empezo con un capital de C$ 5,000 fue ahorro propio el se ha dedicado a sus hijos su esposa es ama de casa y el es el sustento de su hogar. Con estos financiamiento el ha podido salir adelante siempre compra mercadería para su negocio su carpintería es otro ingreso pero solo trabaja por encargos. En su vida personal el siente que ha venido mejorando poco a poco ya que su casita la ha reparado al suave con las ganancias que la han quedado.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para comprar revistas para su negocio

loans.name: Anecito

texts.en: Anecito R. is from the town of Banga. He is 60 years old, is a widower, and has seven adult children. Anecito owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over forty years. In 2010, Anecito joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be his first from CEVI. Anecito plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.en:
Rosaline C., 34, is making sure that her family has enough provision for their daily needs. Happily married to Arnel C., a tricycle driver and operator, they are blessed with four children. Rosaline makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing a variety store while operating a tricycle for 16 years.

Rosaline has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for almost six years now. She regularly attends its weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Her good repayment performance with her previous loans means that she has been able to borrow six times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her business. 

To ensure the success of her business, Rosaline would like to apply for a loan of 19,000 PHP. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for the expanding businesses and will buy additional items to be added to her current product inventory.

Rosaline dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional items to add to her current product inventory

loans.name: Jilma Del Socorro

texts.es: Jilma Del Socorro tiene 29 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de cerdo. Hace más de 6 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que anteriormente inicio con otra actividad como es la venta de comida por lo que necesitaba mantener a sus 2 hijos que son menores de edad y están a su cargo,  ella es una mujer humilde y que le gusta su actividad pues se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy popular en su comarca ella es muy responsable con su actividad. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de cerdos y alimentos para engorde. Sueña con construir su propia casa para dejársela a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jilma is 29 years old. She buys and sells pigs. She has been doing this business for the past six years. Before this she sold prepared food. She is the sole support of her two minor children. She is a humble woman and she enjoys her business activities. She is well known in her field of work. She is very responsible. With this loan she will buy pigs and food to make them fat. Her dream is to build her own house so that she can leave it to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Cuando usted visita a Andrea C., se da cuenta D. su gran dinamismo y empuje,  porque así como tiene una miscelánea donD. vendee juguetes, cremas para el cabello pinta uñas, ganchos D. cabeza, cintas papel D. regalo, etc. también se dedica a la venta D. deliciosas frituras y así mismo venD.  carbón y todo esto constituye su ingreso familiar, porque todo lo que se venda con disciplina produce dinero. Andrea vive en la ciudad D. Cartagena y tiene una hija ya D. 43 años, está separada y aun continua haciendo esfuerzos D. trabajo, con mucha alegría y con ganas. Inició su negocio con un crédito que le dio la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y gracias a éste  y a la capacitación recibida, fue organizándose y estructurando mejor su microempresa; ella al principio tenia solo su miscelánea, luego quiso tener mas ingresos y agregó el D. fabricar empanadas, arepas, y otras frituras, el cual trabaja en las mañanas muy temprano, y finalmente como es una persona conciente D. las oportunidades, se dio cuenta que vender carbón era otro buen negocio y lo adicionó también, aprovechando que alrededor D. su vivienda, se encuentran muchos negocios D. comidas rápidas y asaderos  que necesitan D. este producto para poder funcionar.
Andrea tiene 11 años D. estar vinculada a la Fundación, y con sus créditos ha podido salir adelante al lado D. su hija, a quien proporcionó estudios y ahora mismo la apoya en su negocio. Su meta siempre es trabajar, no solo para ser exitosa en su negocio, sino también  para quedar bien con los créditos y tener siempre las puertas abiertas y continuar atendiendo bien a su mamá que depenD. económicamente D. ella. En la actualidad aplica a un crédito por valor D. $1.000.000 COP con el cual comprará carbón en buena cantidad porque en épocas D. lluvia se vuelve escaso, surtirá también su vitrina con mercancías cosméticas y D. miscelánea y “espera hacer rendir este dinerito
texts.en:
When you meet Andrea C., you realize that she has a great dynamism and drive. She has a business selling consumer products such as toys, hair creams, nail polish, hair adornments, tape, wrapping paper, etc. She also sells delicious fried foods and also coal. All of these activities proviD. her family with an income, because she sells everything in a disciplined manner with the objective of gaining income. Andrea lives in the city of Cartagena and has a 43 year-old daughter. She is separated and still makes an effort to work with joy and enthusiasm. She started her business with a loan that she was given from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and thanks to this and the training she received she was able to organize and restructure her small business. At first, she sold only miscellaneous goods. Later, since she wanted to have more income, she also began to make empanadas, arepa (a kind of corn griddle cake), and other fried foods, which she makes very early in the mornings. Finally, as she is a person who is aware of opportunities, she realized that selling coal was another good business, and she added that on as well, taking advantage of the fact that in the area around her home there are many fast food businesses and roasted meat sellers that need this product in order to operate. Andrea has been involved with the Fundación for 11 years. With her loans, she has been able to get ahead along with her daughter, who she was able to proviD. with an education and who now supports her in her business. Her goal is to always work, not only to be successful with the business, but also so that she can pay off the loans and always have her doors open. She also wants to continue to care for her mother who depends on her economically. She is currently applying for a loan in the amount of $1,000,000 Colombian pesos, with which she will buy coal in bulk, because in the rainy seasons it becomes scarce. She will also restock her glass display case with cosmetics and miscellaneous products, and she hopes to make this money go far.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as cosmetics and hair adornments and also to invest in buying coal at wholesale

loans.name: Yean's Group

texts.en:
These four members, who live in Boeng Kandal village in Kandal province, make up this group loan. They will each use their portion of the loan in varied ways to increase their income this current year.

Mrs. Yean C. is 61 years old and is the group leader who has been selected by the other members. She is a farmer who owns a 1.3-hectare (3.25-acre) plot of land that she uses to grow a crop to sell to support her family; she is also a farm laborer.

Mrs. Yean C.’s problem is that her field has infertile soil and also has a lot of insects. So, to improve production, she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

Mrs. Yean C. is a widow with a child who is seventeen years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farm

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: La Sra. Rosmery quien desde hace quince años se dedica a la actividad de la venta de comida es ya muy conocida en la zona, tiene ya mucha  clientela que acude a ella por el buen sazón que le pone a sus platos,  es casad y su  esposo trabaja en la empresa Pil, tiene cuatro hijos, necesitan el capital ya que se aproxima una fiesta local y hay que comprar mas mercadería de la que regularmente necesita con el dinero del credito comprara refrescos, azucar aceite, arroz y fideo para la elaboracion de sus platillos, anteriormente tenia un crédito en grupo razón por la que ahora quiere sacar el crédito  individual ya que según ella el crédito en grupo es muy problemático ya que en muchos casos tienen que pagar deudas de sus compañeras,esta muy agradecida con la institucion por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosmery has been selling food for fifteen years and is well-known in the area. She has many customers who come to her seeking the wonderful flavor of her dishes. Rosmery is married and her husband works for Pil, a Bolivian dairy company. They have four children.

Rosmery needs capital to acquire more products that she uses regularly because of an upcoming local festival. She will use the money to buy soft drinks, sugar, oil, rice, and noodles for making her dishes. Rosmery previously participated in a group loan, but she now wants to obtain an individual loan because she encountered problems with having to pay for other members who were not able to meet their obligations. She is extremely grateful to Emprender for providing this opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks & ingredients used in preparing her dishes

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita I. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Matapat, Brgy. San Jose, Puerto Princesa City, Palawan. She earns her living by operating 5 business ventures: a car shop, a general store, an eatery, a tailoring business and a frozen products business. Perlita's shop specializes in making motorcycle sidecars, repainting trucks and cars, and assembly of any type of vehicle. 

Her husband Neofito I., who is 56 years old, works as a Technician/Driver/Mechanic to earn a living. They have 2 children who are 26 and 27 years old. 

Perlita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Perlita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 28,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 25,000, thus elevating the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing PHP 50,000. She intends to use the loan to purchase a passenger bus so that she can continue to save  for future investments and for her family. Perlita I. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase a passenger bus

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José tiene 46 años de edad reside en el municipio de El Transito, departamento de Usulután, es casado, vive con la esposa tiene dos hijos de las edades de 4 y 13 años, la esposa dedica a la elaboración de tortillas y el tiene un vehículo para transportar gente.
El inicio el negocio con ayuda de un amigo quien le enseño el trabajo su horario de 6:00am-6:00pm una dificultad que enfrenta es el no contar con el dinero para darle mantenimiento al vehículo, cambiar la pintura y compra de repuestos, por cual está solicitando un préstamo que le permita tener en buenas condiciones el vehículo, satisfacer la demanda de los clientes y dar un buen servicio de transporte.
Las aspiraciones son que el negocio crezca para poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de la famililla.
texts.en:
Jose is 46 years old and he lives in the El Transito municipality in the region of Usulután. He is married and he lives with his wife and their two children, aged 4 and 13 years of age. His wife makes tortillas and he has a car that he uses as a taxi. He started out his business with the help of a friend who taught him the line of work. He works from 6am to 6pm. The challenge he faces is not having enough funds to maintain his car in good condition, neither to repair the body nor to purchase spare parts, for which reason he requests a loan. This will permit him to have his vehicle in good condition and be able to meet his clients' demands and provide them with good service. His aspirations are to have a larger business and improve his way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and provide maintenance to his vehicle.

loans.name: Richard Emilio

texts.es: Richar vive en casa de sus padres cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la zona Las Lomas de ciudad de La Paz. Richard trabaja en la empresa maderera concepción como asalariado y está es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. El préstamo lo destinara para pagar sus mensualidades de la universidad. El estudia contaduría pública.Es su primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Richard lives with his parents in the Las Lomas neighborhood of the city of La Paz. Richard works as a salaried employee of the Concepción lumber company; this is his primary source of income. He will use this loan to cover his university tuition, which is paid on a monthly basis. He is studying Public Accounting. This is his first loan from IMPRO.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Staff

loans.use: Pay monthly university tuition

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn L. is from the town of Aurora. She is 36 years old and married. To make a living, Jocelyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jocelyn also put up a sari-sari store where she sells soy sauce, soap and other kinds of products. Her income from the store helps in their daily needs. 

Jocelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Rutchelyn

texts.en:
Rutchelyn L. is from the village of Binakalan, Gingoog City. She is 33 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Rutchelyn owns and operates a retail business venture running a sari-sari (variety) shop. The main source of income from the business comes primarily from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Rutchelyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Rutchelyn joined Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc. (HSPFI) in 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rutchelyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rutchelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vital Rafael

texts.es:
Vital de 63 años, tiene un restaurante que su especialidad son los cangrejos. Vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil). 

Después que se jubilo decidió tener su propio restaurante para mantenerse económicamente estable. En la actualidad el trabaja con su esposa en el restaurante que le pusieron por nombre “Cangrejal” ya que sus mayores ventas son cangrejos y mariscos el trabaja con ayuda de su esposa desde las 08h00am hasta las 23h00pm. Los platos con cangrejos los adiciona con arroz, ensaladas y especies. 

Para seguir con el negocio y tener mas volumen de ventas el quiere comprar con el préstamo cangrejos. En el futuro quiere mejorar su casa y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Vital is 63 years old and has a restaurant that specializes in crab. He lives in Primavera de Druan (an area in the outskirts of Guayaquil).

After he retired, he decided to start his own restaurant to maintain his financial well-being. At present, he works with his wife in the restaurant, which they called “Cangrejal” (a place where crabs gather), since most of their sales are crabs and seafood. He and his wife work from 8 in the morning until 11 at night. They add rice, vegetables, and spices to their crab dishes.

To continue with the business and have more sales, Vital wants to buy crabs with this loan. In the future, he wants to improve his house and grow his business.

loans.use: Crabs

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en:
Bolormaa L. is 41 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in an apartment in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. Her youngest son attends a local secondary school while her husband operates a taxi service in their town. Bolormaa manages a meat retail business in the local market in her town. She began her business in 2005 with working capital of 150,000 MNT. 

After several years of hard work and having grown a loyal customer base, her working capital now exceeds 1,200,000 MNT. She has built a stable operation with many permanent customers. She would like to expand her business in the future. Bolormaa is an honest and hard-working woman. She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more meat to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more meat

loans.name: Nuriddin

texts.en:
G. Nuriddin is married. His family lives in Shahrituz, Southern Tajikistan. Nuriddin sells household chemicals and perfumes in his shop. Small ventures like Nuriddin’s become the only source of income for families in remote parts of Tajikistan. Nuriddin has been in the trade for 6 years. His business is characterized by stability and positive performance. Inventory he sells is always in demand as people need dishwasher and laundry soap, shampoos, and perfumes and other household chemicals. Nuriddin wants to see his business grow in the future, which is why he is requesting a loan of $3000 USD to increase his turnover capital. He is hoping to boost further development of his business with this additional assistance. 

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase turnover capital related to household chemicals and perfumes sold.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa B. is a married woman who lives in Purok Bangkal, Brgy Bulanon, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: dried fish vending and fishing businesses.  Her husband Jose B., who is 51 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have eight children who are 7 to 29 years old. 

 Narcisa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Narcisa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 24,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 12th loan, she is borrowing PHP 27,000 which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future and sustain their daily needs. 

Narcisa B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Aliyma

texts.en:
Aliyma T. is 52, widowed and has four children. Aliyma has a higher pedagogical education, and during last 20 years, she has been working as a teacher in a local school. She is characterized by her colleagues as a responsible, precise and sociable person.

Unfortunately, salaries of the teachers in rural areas are very low. That’s why Aliyma, with her husband, decided to start their business in cattle breeding and land cultivating. They worked hard and made every effort to develop their farm. After her husband’s death, Aliyma became the only bread-winner for her children, but in spite of many difficulties on her way, she was able to give a good education to all of them.

Aliyma plans to use this loan of 50,000 Kyrgyz Soms to buy more cattle. With the revenues from the loan, she plans to broaden her farm by means of livestock breeding.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Julia Narcisa De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora. Julia C. es socia del banco comunal Caritas Alegres, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca que es reconocida por la belleza colonial de su centro histórico, esta ciudad es cuna de grandes deportistas, artistas y poetas.
 
La Señora Julia tiene 51 años, es divorciada y tiene 3 hijos de 27 y dos hijos gemelos de 26 años, todos sus hijos estudian en la Universidad y también trabajan. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres.
 
Doña Julia es chofer profesional y se dedica al transporte escolar, esta actividad la realiza hace 15 años, trabaja todo el día ya que transporta a niños de escuela y jóvenes de colegio.
 
Se encuentra dos años en el banco comunal y le gusta ya que tiene muy buenas amigas, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir para comprar repuestos para su vehiculo. Su sueño es  seguir conservando su salud.
texts.en:
Mrs. Julia C. is a member of the Caritas Alegres (Cheerful Little Faces) communal bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca which is renowned for the colonial beauty of its historic city center.  This city is the birthplace of great athletes, artists and poets.

Julia is 51 years old, divorced and has 3 children, one who is 27 and twins who are 26.  All of her children are in the university and also work.  She does not own a house of her own; she lives in her parents’ house.

Julia is a professional school bus driver.  She’s been in this line of work for 15 years.  She works all day because she transports children to school and teenagers to high school

She has been in the communal bank for two years and she likes it because she has good friends there.  She will use the money from her loan to buy vehicle replacement parts.  Her dream is to stay healthy.

loans.use: To buy vehicle replacement parts.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees and rent bills.

For the past ten years, he has been operating a fresh water selling business.  His potential customers are people in the neighbouring community. Ali faces a major challenge in the seasonality demands in his business. During dry summer season, the availabilty of water for sale is low compared to the high demand. He hopes to expand and establish a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, he wants to open a retail shop and purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and rice. He decided to join Yehu because of its efficient loan process.

loans.use: To start a retail shop and purchase wheat flour, maize flour, and rice.

loans.name: Solange

texts.en:
Solange is 28 years old, married, and has one child.  She works as a secretary but also has a well-organized shop where she performs secretarial services. Three years ago, she opened this business due to her interest in it. Her shop is open from 7AM until 8PM daily except for Sunday, and employs two other persons. 

With this loan, Solange intends to purchase an additional computer and printer. She will save any additional profits she earns after the loan is paid off.

loans.use: To purchase an additional computer and printer.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This borrower is 41 years old, married and has two children. He graduated from primary school, and he owns a garage for repair and painting of cars. The borrower will use this loan to develop his business and purchase paints and new equipment for painting. He has a great deal of experience in his field of work. He has a good personality and has great motivation and ambition to develop his business.

loans.use: purchasing paint and other materials

loans.name: Monique

texts.fr: Monique N. est enseignante, et client d’ACB depuis 2007.  Elle a 24 ans, elle est célibataire, et elle est née à Rwanda.  Ce prêt est son 4eme cycle avec ACB, et elle a bien remboursée ses prêts.  Elle a fini ses études jusqu’au niveau A2, et elle va utiliser son prêt pour payer les frais d’études universitaire.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de terminer ses études universitaires.  Elle voudrait avoir le niveau de licence pour son activité d’enseignante, et construire une belle maison.
texts.en:
Monique N. is a teacher. She joined ACB in 2007. She is 24 years old, single, and was born in Rwanda. 


This is her 4th loan cycle with ACB, and previous loans were repaid without incident. She completed A2 level studies, and plans to use her loan to pay for her university tuition fees. 


Her strategy is to finish her university studies. She wants to get her teaching license, and build a beautiful house.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition fees

loans.name: Puth

texts.en:
Puth S., 29, resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for its palm products. S. sells traditional cakes, earning an income of about 2.5 USD per day. Her husband is a barber, earning an income of 3 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend 50 USD on food and 28 USD on other necessary expenses.

S. is requesting a loan of 600 USD to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Jazgul's Group

texts.en:
Jazgul C. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Tashkomur, a small mining town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 28 and married to a constructor. Together with her husband, she is bringing up a daughter and two sons. The first son is at school and the other children are not yet, because they are preschool age (under seven). 

Four years ago, with the initial investment of 1,500 KGS, Jazgul started to breed goats. Reselling goats after being fattened, she makes about an additional $85 per month. With money received from the loan, she will purchase more goats for breeding. In the future, Jazgul dreams to build a big house for the family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more goats

loans.name: Sobia's Group

texts.en: Sobia has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband who is a milk seller and wants to buy another buffalo to expand his dairy business further. The loan will help him increase the production of milk and sell to more customers. Sobia is a talented lady involved in making pranday (an ornament used to tie back hair). She sells her product to different cosmetics shops in the market and generates income for the family. She is an active young lady who performs her household activities very well. She is the mother of two daughters. Both of them are very young and have not started school yet. Sobia is hopeful that an investment will be a profitable one for her husband, and he will be able to take his business to a more profitable position. Sobia is a resident of Pakpattan which is a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture. She has been living with her family in the area of Bari Rakh in a two-room brick house for the past 15 years.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo for a dairy business.

loans.name: Jean

texts.fr: Jean M. est commerçant de boutique il client d’ACB  depuis 2010.il a 31ans, marie et il a 3 enfants entre 2 ans et 11ans.  Deux de ces enfants vont à l’école. Jean est ne a Nyanza au RWANDA  et il a le niveau d’étude de ‘école primaire .il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter de ciment, sable, toles, pierre pour ravitailler sa maison.il n ya pas des difficultés attendu  de non –remboursement du credit.sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire  est de rembourser le prêt en augmentant ses ventes d’habits dans sa boutique, profiter d’avantage, et augmenter la clientèle de sa boutique.ses ambitions pour les affaires sont d’acheter un taxi minibus pour faire le transport des personnes en taxi. Pour la famille il voudrait éduquer ses enfants et construire la maison selon le plan de la ville de Kigali.
texts.en: Jean M. is a shopkeeper.  He has been a client of ACB since 2010.  He is 31 years old, married, and has three children from 2 to 11 years in age.  Two of his children attend school.  Jean was born in Nyanza, in Rwanda, and has a primary school education.  He is going to use his loan to buy cement, sand, sheet metal, and stones to make improvements to his house.   He is not expected to have any difficulties in repaying his loan.  His strategy for growing his business is to repay the loan while increasing his clothing sales at his retail shop, making larger profits, and attracting more customers to his shop.  His business goal is to buy a minibus taxi for transporting passengers.  As for his family, he would like to have his children educated and to build a house according to the city plan of Kigali.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, sheet metal, and stones to make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Maame Araba

texts.en: Maame is a single parent taking care of two children. Maame sells slippers and cloth at Elmina near Nkontrodo in Cape Coast. Maame uses her income to pay school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase more slippers and cloths for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame Araba plans to save towards acquiring a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers and cloths for resale.

loans.name: Salem Plus Group

texts.en:
Paulin, aged 47 and married, is the chairman of the Community Bank named “Salem Plus” which consists of 12 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 
Paulin sells fertilizer and seeds to the west of Kinshasa. He started his business in 1993. Paulin is happy right now as, with the loan, he will be able to buy fertilizer and seeds, have a greater range of stock and be able to meet customer demand. Paulin makes a profit of US$100 per week. With the money he earns, he hopes to provide financial support for his family. His dream is to, someday, own a farm. Paulin has six children aged between 2 and 35. Three of them go to school. He also takes care of his two nephews.

loans.use: to increase his stock by buying sacks of fertilizer and seeds for resale

loans.name: Mekdad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married, and has one child.

Mekdad has owned a barber shop since 2008. He has five years' experience and has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to make a sliding door and install a ceiling for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To make a sliding door and install a ceiling for his shop.

loans.name: Loise

texts.en:
Loise is a 34 year old hard working business lady. She is married and blessed with three children aged; 14, 11, and 3. 

Loise sells utensils and plastic goods. Previously, she worked at a music studio. She wants 45,000 Kenyan shillings to buy buckets, basins and utensils.
She hopes to have a big shop and to be a prosperous business-lady. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for improving her business skills and teaching her the art of saving.

loans.use: to buy buckets, basins and utensils.

loans.name: Dora Lorena

texts.es:
Dora es una madre de familia de 21 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, contando con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

La actividad que desarrolla Dora, desde hace 3 años es a la venta de productos de primera necesidad (venta de arroz, leche, aceite, azúcar, etc), al encontrarse su negocio en su casa puede atender a cualquier hora, lo que le permite diferenciarse de otras tiendas y así pueda obtener más ingresos para solventar sus obligaciones familiares.  También cría y vende aves de corral (pavos),es otro ingreso con el que cuenta.

El crédito solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 2000 nuevos soles, el cual lo destinará para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería y adquirir alimentos balanceados para sus aves, para poder ampliar su negocio con otros productos una vez que sus ventas aumenten.  El sueño de Dora es tener más adelante una tienda más grande que le genere mayores ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Dora is a 21-year-old mother who lives in her own home with her husband and children. The only service they receive is electricity. Dora resides in the District of Tambogrande, which is part of the Department of Piura. This area has businesses that involve agriculture, livestock breeding, and handicrafts.

For the past three years, Dora has managed a business selling basic necessities such as rice, milk, oil, sugar, and other items. Her business is located in her home so that she can attend to it at any hour. This differentiates her business from other stores and allows her to generate more income to meet her family obligations. In addition, she raises and sells turkeys so that she can earn additional money.

She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN, which will be used to buy a large quantity of merchandise and acquire balanced feed for her birds. Dora wants to expand her business with other products so that she can increase her sales. Her dream is to expand her store and generate more income so that she can improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store and to acquire poultry feed.

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en: Khodor is a 37-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two school-aged children. He has been working in the agriculture field for the past 15 years. In 1999, he purchased a plot of land where he started to cultivate all types of vegetables according to the season. He has one part-time employee helping him with the farming work. Today, he is asking to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase needed supplies such as fertilizers and seeds. This is his second Kiva loan and he has been very reliable with his repayments. He estimates that with the coming harvest, his profits will increase.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Aida Del Carmen

texts.es: Aida del Carmen D. veinticinco años D. edad, resiD. con su esposo e hijo en casa familiar. DesD. hace mucho tiempo ella  y su esposo  poseen una panadería en la cual trabajan D. la mano para salir adelante. Aida se encarga D. la fabricación del pan dulce mientras que su esposo se encarga D. venderlo. Esta panadería es su principal fuente D. ingresos por lo tanto necesitan seguir manteniéndola activa por mucho más tiempo. Aida es muy conocida en la zona donD. resiD. y cuenta con mucha clientela  ya que siempre ofrece buenos precios, calidad y sobre todo variedad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora  la cual no pierD. oportunidad para hacer negocio. Con el fin D. ver florecer a un  mas su negocio ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra D. los insumos necesarios en la fabricación del pan, como: harina, levadura, azúcar, leche, bandejas, etc. D. esta manera espera lograr atraer a más clientes que le permitan aumentar su nivel D. ventas y D. ingresos para tener acceso a una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Aida del Carmen is twenty-five years old.  She lives with her husband and son in the family home. For a long time, she and her husband have owned a bakery where they work hand in hand to move forward in life.  Aida is responsible for making sweet breads while her husband is in charge of selling.  This bakery is their main source of income so they need to continue to keep it active for a long time.  

Aida is well known in the neighborhood where she lives, and can count on many clients as she always offers good prices, quality and above all variety.  She is an enterprising woman which misses no opportunity to do business.  With a view to seeing her business flourish further, she has decided to apply for this loan through INTEGRAL to invest in purchasing necessary supplies for the manufacture of bread such as flour, yeast, sugar, milk, trays, etc.   In this way she hopes to attract more customers, which will allow her to increase her level of sales and income to have access to a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, sugar, milk, trays, etc.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 37 years old. He is married and has one child, aged three, whom he and his wife hope to educate to the university level. 

Charles sells clothes to the local people. His business is located in a residential area known as Kiembeni in Mombasa. He has been running this business for five years now. He says that the business is profitable and the major challenge he has is that there are other people in the area doing the same kind of business, so customers are not loyal as they have many choices. He however works hard from early morning to late evening to ensure his business is doing well. 

Charles is using his loan of KES 20,000 to buy more clothes to grow his business to wholesale and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to open another clothes sales business in the future. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
For the last ten years Pius has been buying and selling. He is 55 years old and married to Esther--together they have three school-aged children.

He was introduced to KADET by a friend who is a KADET client. He has been loaned KES. 50,000 which he will use to buy two cows. He will later sell them at a profit.

In the future, Pius hopes to practice large-scale farming, which will increase his income.

loans.use: To buy two cows which he will later sell at a profit.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a 46-year-old woman and a mother of three children. She works in the direct sale of cosmetics. She sells perfumes, lipstick and lotion. Myrna’s husband works abroad and is her partner in paying her children's school fees.
Myrna has been in business for five years. She experiences obstacles, which might be seen as reasons for not continuing the business, but she just takes them as a challenge. Myrna wants to help her husband even in a simple way, that’s why she keeps on selling even when her customers do not pay on time. She believes that patience leads to success. 
Myrna is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to pay for the products that she purchases and then sells to her customers. She hopes to purchase more products to sell, which will increase her profits.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products for resale.

loans.name: Laila

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme qui exerce dans le commerce de produits cosmétiques. Elle achète en gros du lait de beauté et des parfums qu'elle revend en détail et à crédit à ses clients.Elle arrive à générer des bénéfices qui lui permettent de prendre en charge sa famille et de satisfaire ses propres bénéfices.Elle sollicite un pret de 300000F pour acheter des caisses de lait de beauté et de parfum. Son ambition est de devenir grossiste.
texts.en: The borrower is a woman who trades in cosmetics. She buys beauty lotions and perfumes on a wholesale basis and then sells them on a retail basis and on credit to her customers. She manages to generate sufficient profits to take care of her family and to satisfy her own needs. She is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs to buy crates of beauty lotions and perfume. Her ambition is to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy crates of beauty lotion and perfume

loans.name: Fritz Francisco

texts.es:
Fritz tiene 44 años de edad y tiene dos hijos, él nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y actualmente vive en la ciudad de Cusco, Perú.  Fritz trabaja en la Escuela de Bellas Artes “Diego Quispe Tito” de la ciudad del Cusco como administrador personal y también tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes. Fritz y su esposa Roció tienen un pequeño negocio familiar de venta de comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, menestras y otras cosas más. Ya son 10 años que tiene el negocio y le va muy bien,  él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y muchas cosas más. 

Fritz pertenece al banco comunal “Unión, Fuerza y Amistad” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Fritz is 44 years old and has two children. He was born in the town of Paucartambo and he currently lives in the city of Cusco, Peru. Fritz works in the "Diego Quispe Tito" School of Fine Arts in the city of Cusco as a personnel administrator. He also owns a small grocery store.
Fritz and his wife Rocio run a small family business; they sell comestibles such as rice, sugar, noodles, soup and other things. He has owned the business for ten years already and it is going very well. On this occasion, he requests the loan in order to purchase goods such as rice, sugar, noodles and many other things.
Fritz is a member of the "Unión, Fuerza y Amistad" ("Union, Strength and Friendship") communal bank of Asociación Arariwa. He is thankful for the opportunity provided by this means and, at the same time, he promises to make the repayments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to purchase goods such as rice, sugar, noodles and many other things.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
Yanet sigue participando en el banco comunal “San Isidro de Compone” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Yanet sigue con el negocio de venta de maíz y sigue dedicándose a la crianza de animales menores coomo por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas, pollos y chanchos. Yanet con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho en el capital del negocio. 

En esta oportunidad Yanet requiere el préstamo para comprar maíz y para comprar animales como cuyes y chanchos. 

Yanet se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yanet continues participating with Asociación Arariwa’s micro finance unit’s “San Isidro de Compone” communal bank in the city of Cusco.  Yanet still sells corn and raises small farm animals like guinea pigs, hens, chicks and pigs.  Yanet did very well with the previous loan and was able to obtain good benefits and this is why she wants another one because it helps her very much with her business’ capital.

On this occasion Yanet needs the loan to buy corn and to buy animals like pigs and guinea pigs.  Yanet is grateful for the opportunity provided through this means and commits to make her payments according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy corn and to buy animals like guinea pigs and pigs.

loans.name: Mayramkul

texts.ru: Майрамкул 44 года, замужем и имеет троих детей. Майрамкул работает поваром в местной школе и известна как жизнерадостный и оптимистичный человек.  В поисках дополнительного дохода для своей семьи,  Майрамкул начала свой бизнес в откорме и реализации скота, использовав для этого стартовую сумму в 5,000 сом (KGS).  На сегодняшний день, хозяйство Майрамкул приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме около 10,000 сом , что позволяет покрывать расходы семьи и траты на корм для скота. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Майрамкул обратилась в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительного скота. Это позволит ей увеличить своей хозяйство, а часть доходов она планирует направить на  подготовку к свадьбе сына.
texts.en: Mayramkul is 44 years old, married and has three children. Mayramkul works as a cook at a local school and is known for being an optimistic and joyous person. As a way to provide additional income to her family, Mayramkul started her own business, raising and selling animals, initially investing 5,000 KGS. Today, Mayramkul's farm makes a profit of about 10,000 KGS per month, which covers the expenses of her family and the cost of feed for the animals. With the goal of increasing the number of animals, Mayramkul has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 KGS, to purchase additional animals. This will allow her to expand her farm, and she plans to use a part of her income on preparations for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
This is Felix who is 47 and a resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Agitina, a frozen food dealer, and father to their three children. One of is children is already working; one is in college, and the other is in elementary grade. By the grace of God, Felix has managed to support his older children's schooling up to college level. At this time, he is working hard to send his two youngest children to college. 

Felix operates a processed meat store. It is where one can buy processed and frozen meat like hotdogs, ham, and the like, near your home. Felix earns an income by buying processed meat at wholesale prices and selling them by the kilo. Aside from this he also manage their farm. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of Php 206 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 17, 000 loans. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more frozen foods like, hotdogs and ham. He will also buy fertilizers for his farm. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands the business.  

Felix dreams to be able to give all his children a good and high quality education through all his hard work on his business. He also hopes to have his family and community with him as he continues to serve the Lord Almighty through his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of products needed in his business.

loans.name: Zikir

texts.ru: Более 16 лет Зикир занимается купле- продажей продуктов питания. Он продает сахар, макароны, рис, разные виды сладостей и овощей. Ему в бизнесе помогает сын. Зикир хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль. Зикир запрашивает займ для покупки продуктов питания с целью увлечения ассортимент продуктов. Он надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарен вам.
texts.en: Zikir has been in the business of buying and selling of food for more than sixteen years. He sells sugar, pasta, rice, different kinds of sweets and vegetables. His son helps him in the business. Zikir wants to expand his business and make a good profit. He is requesting a loan to buy food to expand the variety of products. He looks forward to your help and thanking you in advance.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en: Narine is engaged in agriculture. She cultivates land. Narine has applied for a loan to purchase  tomato and potato seeds and fertilizer. Successful cultivation of the land will help Narine to develop her farm and get additional income. This is vital for Narine's family, as it will allow her to meet the ends and insure prosperous future. Narine lives together with her husband and children.

loans.use: to pay for tomato and potato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Adhiambo

texts.en:
Adhiambo is a 58-year-old woman from western Kenya who is married to Cyprian Otieno. They have nine children and six grandchildren. 

Adhiambo is a food seller specializing in yams, and she has been in this business for the last 13 years. She makes a monthly profit of KES 10,000, with which she is able to provide for her family’s needs. 

This is her third loan with KADET LTD. She will use the loan to add more yams to her stock, and part of the money to pay school fees for her grandchildren. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees and also to build a good house  

Her dreams is to build a good house and to pay the fees for her orphan grandchildren.

loans.use: to add more food stuff stock and pay school fees, as well as to build a house

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de leche,ella vende leche en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m y tambien la socia se dedica al negocio de venta y crianza de chanchos,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a los hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local para vender la leche y tambien ampliar el negocio de crianza de chanchos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar leche y tambien comprar chanchos

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Bernardina continues to dedicate herself to the milk business. She sells milk on an itinerant basis from 8:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m. She is also engaged in selling and raising pigs. By means of these businesses she is helping her children progress.

Bernardina’s dream is to have a shop for selling milk and also to enlarge her business of raising pigs. She is applying for the loan in order to purchase milk and also to buy pigs. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase milk and pigs.

loans.name: Uniendo Fuerzas Group

texts.es: Marcela es socia de la Alcancía Comunal “Uniendo Fuerzas” grupo que está conformado por 07 socios responsables y trabajadores, siendo Marcela la que preside al grupo. Ella tiene 42 años de edad es separada con 02 hijos que aún sigue apoyando. Con los deseos de superarse inicio su propio negocio, la cual realiza manualidades como bordado en cinta, repujado de aluminio, pintado en vidrio, entre otros la cual trabaja sobre pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, este negocio le ha beneficiado, pues nos cuenta que con los conocimientos adquiridos,  también brinda clases de manualidades, de donde obtiene un ingreso extra para su hogar. Gracias a este negocio a podido mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. A fin de seguir mejorando solicito el crédito para la compra de cintas, telas, pinturas, aluminios y pinceles y así poder elaborar sus manualidades. El deseo de Marcela es habilitar un espacio en su domicilio donde pueda exhibir sus trabajos manuales. La Alcancía Comunal “Uniendo Fuerzas” agradecen el crédito brindado y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Marcela es la que  está ubicada al medio de su grupo, ella viste una bruza blanca con flores estampadas. En la foto grupal adjuntamos la fotografía de Yemima.
texts.en:
Marcela’s a member of the “Uniendo Fuerzas” (Uniting Strength) communal bank which has 7 responsible, hardworking members; Marcela is group President.  She’s 42 years old, separated and has two children that she still supports.  With the wish to improve she started her own business making crafts like ribbon embroidery, aluminum embossing, painting on glass, among others.  She works based on prior customer orders.  The business has benefitted her because she tells us that with the skills learned she also teaches crafts classes thus earning extra household income.  Thanks to this business she’s been able to improve her family’s quality of life.

In order to continue improving, she’s asked for a loan to buy ribbon, fabric, paint, aluminum and brushes to make her crafts.  Marcela’s wish is to equip a space at home where she can display her manual arts.

The “Uniendo Fuerzas” communal bank is grateful for the loan granted and commits to continue working well.  Marcela appears in the center of the group wearing a white blouse printed with flowers.  We have inserted Yemima’s photo in the group photo.

loans.use: to buy ribbon, fabric, paint, aluminum and brushes.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is 56 years old and married, residing at Tabuan, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines.

Manuel is operating a gardening business venture to earn a living and has been 15 years in this business. Each month, he earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of business.

He requested a loan of 18,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2010, Manuel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. In the future, Manuel wants to save a reserve for future emergencies and to purchase more farmland.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is married and lives with his wife. They live in their own house in Tiribe, Kenya. Juma is a very self-sacrificing person, and tells us that he has farmed for years, growing all kinds of vegetables for sale.

At the same time, he raises livestock and buys animals to slaughter and sell, as this proves much more profitable for him.

Thanks to his years of work and effort, nowadays he can offer his family a comfortable home with the necessary conveniences.

He is applying for the loan to buy animals for slaughter. He is very happy about the opportunity he is receiving through the Yehu Microfinance Trust and from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy animals for slaughter.

loans.name: Adelaide

texts.pt:
Adelaide de 29 anos de idade é solteira, comerciante ambulante  ha 10 anos 
Com o valor do crédito ira comprar cimento, pedra, areia, para a construção de um estabelecimento comercial na sua casa.
Tem como sonhos crescer no negócio e gostaria de voltar a estudar.
O seu principal dasafio é terminar a sua obra de estabelecimento comercial para melhor responder as exigências de  de seus clientes.
texts.en:
Adelaide is 29 years old and single. She has been a street vendor for the past 10 years.
With the amount of the loan she'll purchase cement, rocks and sand in order to build a store in her house.
Her dream is to make her business grow. She'd also like to go back to school.
Her main challenge is to finish building her store so that she can better accommodate her customers' demands.

loans.use: to purchase cement, rocks and sand.

loans.name: Raul Enrique

texts.en:
My clients call me Quique. I am the owner of a print shop that makes notebooks, postcards, calendars and other goods. I have been doing this for several years and have various contracts with schools. My clients prefer me because of the high quality of my goods and the low prices I offer. Now is the end of the year and there is increased demand for notebooks, calendars and stickers. Also there is greater demand for the coupon books used by schools and high schools. For this reason, I need to buy the supplies needed to attend to my clients. I am the father of three children. I am teaching them about the business so that they can continue with it.

This loan will be used to buy paper, ink, cardboard, stickers and other supplies

Entre mis clientes me llaman Quique, y soy dueño de una imprenta en la que hago libretas, postales, calendarios, calcomanias. Tengo varios años de tener mi negocio y tengo varios contratos con escuelas, colegios y otros negocios ambulantes. Mis clientes me prefieren por la calidad de producto que les brindo y los buenos precios que les ofrezco. Ahorita que es fin de año, la demanda crece en la elaboracion de calendarios, libretas y stickers, asi como los talonarios de pago de escuelas y colegios es por eso que necesito realizar una buena inversion en la compra de los materiales necesarios para atender a todos mis clientes. Soy padre de tres hijos a quienes les enseñe el negocio para que ellos continuen con este.

loans.use: Compra de papel, tinta, cartulinas, sticker y otros

loans.name: Kereta

texts.en: Kereta L. has a small fruit and vegetable farm for her business. Kereta is a hard-working person from the village of Nofoalii.  Kereta's project is well-developed in different ways because of the support of her family and friends. She has done a great job by selling her goods at the market.  She earns a hundred tala (USD 30) a day from her selling.  Kereta is a woman with the guts to get the job done. She goes to her plantation everyday to check on it, as well as to weed and to plant more taro, banana and other fruits and vegetables.  Kereta and her family survive on the profits from this farm.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, planting materials, fertilizers, and pesticides

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is a married woman and the mother of four children. Her husband is retired and the pension they receive is not enough to cover all of their family expenses and so she decided to open a small store. As she didn't have the capital to start her store with, she asked the help of Coca Cola who loaned her a small lot where she began to sell small items, however, her business has grown with time. Today, the whole family works in the store and Carolina wishes to expand even more as she is very much an entrepeneur.

She is asking for a loan of $250.00 in order to buy stationary and to expand her store by offering this new product which, from her experience, she will see high demands for from her customers since they themselves have asked her for it. She proposes to pay the loan in 3-6 months and she awaits your colaboration in order to see her dreams realized and to see her family and business grow at the same time.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Carolina es una mujer casada y tiene cuatro hijos, su esposo es una persona pensionada, y la pensión que recibe no era suficiente para poder cubrir los gastos del hogar por lo que ella decidió abrir una pequeña tienda, al no tener el capital para empezar, recurrió a la ayuda de la Coca Cola que en ese entonces le presto un pequeño puestito en el cual ella empezó vendiendo muy pocas cosas, pero con el tiempo fue mejorando su negocio y lo amplió, actualmente toda la familia atiende en el negocio y Carolina quiere ampliarlo aún más, es una mujer muy emprendedora.

Ella esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 250 para poder comprar papelería y ampliar su tienda ofreciendo estos productos que según su experiencia va a tener mucha demanda de sus clientes ya que ellos mismos se lo han solicitado, ofrece pagar este préstamo en un período de 3 a 6 meses y espera tu colaboración en sus deseos de superarse y crecer junto con su familia y negocio.

loans.use: To supply the store.

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.en: U. Ibrohim is 33 years old. He has a wife and 2 children. He has worked with his brothers for many years. One brother sells sport clothes and shoes. Another sells spare parts of cars. They all help each other in their businesses. Ibrohim also has his own business – he sells electro meters and spare parts of electro meters. He specializes in electrical appliances and demand for his products is good. He also repairs electrical appliances.  In order to increase his sales, he decided a year ago to take out a loan, which helped to increase his sales many times. Now he is going to open a new business – selling clothes. He has rented a small shop for this purpose, and he now needs $1200 to start his business.

loans.use: to open new business – selling clothes

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong has proven to be a very reliable business partner. She has borrowed from Mekong Plus three times already; her last loan was funded by Kiva. She has repaid all of her loans on time.

Phuong would like another loan to help her continue to increase her sales. The loans from Mekong Plus and Kiva have helped Phuong increase her daily profits to 10-20,000 VND ($0.62-1.25). Without the loans from Mekong Plus and Kiva, Phuong would have to seek a loan from another source that has high interest rates. The high interest rates would prevent Phuong from ever escaping poverty. Since switching over to Mekong Plus, she has been able to save enough to buy a television.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: María Flor

texts.es:
Maria belongs to the Flower Communal Coffee Bank . It is designated for the sale of grocery products and spices such as coriander, chili, special liquified garlic, seasonings such as cumin, oregano, etc. Also sold in her post are any chopped vegetables you may have in the local market, which is the district Soritor Province of Moyobamba, San Martín region.

Maria decided to start her business to support the financial responsibilities of her home, to move ahead with her family, generate her own income and grow as a person. With the being requested by Manuela Ramos (which comes to approx. $ 225.00 USD., and which will be paid in four months), Maria will buy rice, sugar sacks, oil, milk, tuna and boxes of condiments like cumin, pepper, sillao, vinegar, ajinomoto, etc. She hopes to grow her business so she can meet the needs of her customers and the local market.

Maria is 53 years old and has 4 children, is happy with what she does and pleased with the results so far. Now that she has increased her customer base, her goal is to expand and implement more business, and rent another post which will be larger and safer.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal Flor del café. Se dedica la venta de abarrotes y especies como culantro, ají especial, ajos licuados, condimentos como cominos, orégano, guisador, etc., molidos, también verduras picadas en su puesto que tiene en el mercado de su localidad que es el distrito de Soritor, Provincia de Moyobamba, Región San Martín. Decidió iniciar su negocio para apoyar en la economía de su casa, sacar adelante a su familia, generar sus propios ingresos y crecer como persona. Con el reciente crédito otorgado por Manuela ramos de S/. 700.00 soles ($ 233.00 aprox.) el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar en sacos, aceite, leche, y atún en cajas , condimentos como cominos, pimienta, sillao, vinagre, ajinomoto, etc. y demás abarrotes para surtir su negocio y así poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y del mercado local. Tiene 53 años y 4 hijos, está contenta con lo que hace y satisfecha por los resultados obtenidos hasta la fecha, su clientela aumentó, su meta es ampliar e implementar mas su negocio, alquilar otro puesto con mayor espacio y mas seguro.

loans.use: To buy necessary products to grow her sales (rice, sugar, oil, milk, tuna, condiments, spices, etc.)

loans.name: Mavdjuda

texts.ru:
Mavdjuda has started her business together with her husband. After the divorce she took the business in her hands. She has been working on the market for the past 15 years. Seasonal fruits have been brining in a good profit. With time, her now ex-husband has stopped helping her out with the business.
