She has decided to obtain a credit that will allow her to increase the selection of goods she has for sale, which is currently impossible due to low turnover.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Мавджуда начинала свой бизнес с мужем, после развода она взяла бизнес по продажи фруктов в свои руки. На рынке 15 лет. Сезонные фрукты приносили ей не плохой доход. Со временем, когда муж перестал помогать решила взять кредит, для улучшения ассортимента и из-за нехватки оборотного капитала.

loans.use: Fruit sale

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Mrs. Petrona A. is a 54 year old single mother of 3 teenage girls. The 3 girls are studying and help their mother with the family busines and with the house chores.

She creates home cooked meals that are delivered to her clients own homes in the town of Coronel Oviedo. On the menu are a variety of hot meals, salads, desserts and drinks. Mrs. Petrona has over 30 years experience in the catering business and decided to open her own venture as she found herself unemployed when her previous employers decided to close down their restaurant and retire.

The money requested will be used to purchase a freezer to add ice cream to her menu.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Freezer purchase

loans.name: Rosa Alicia

texts.es:
When Alicia married she thought it was going to be for her whole life. However, due to difficulties in her marraige, it ended. After the separation Alicio entered into a depression, but she still needed to move forward and find a way to support her children. That was the motivation for her to begin her small business. Fortunately, she has great strength, which animated her to start selling meals from her house. Little by little, and with the help of her friends, she began to gain the knowledge to build her business.

Now she counts on various customers, but she's not been able to increase her production because the costs of running her home and supporting her children take most of the profit. So Alicia is requesting a credit a loan of $475 which she will repay in 6 months. With the money she will be able to buy merchandise, increase her food production and grow her profits. With your help, Alicia will be able to provide a better quality of life for her children.

Alicia se casó pensando que este paso sería para toda la vida. Sin embargo por desacuerdos en su matrimonio, este se terminó. Después de la separación Alicia entró en una depresión. Sin embargo tenía que salir adelante para poder mantener a sus hijos. Fue así como se decidió poner un pequeño negocio. Afortunadamente Alicia cuenta con una sazón muy rica, lo cual la hizo animarse a poner su venta de comidas en la casa. Poco a poco y con la ayuda de sus amigos, Alicia se fue haciendo conocida.

Actualmente ya cuenta con varios clientes, sin embargo Alicia no a podido incrementar su producción puesto que los gastos de sus hijos absorben mucho dinero. Es por eso que Alicia está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Alicia podrá comprar mercancía para incrementar su producción de comida y así poder tener mayores ingresos. Con tu ayuda Alicia podrá sacar a sus hijos adelante.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO BUY MORE INGREDIENTS FOR HER SMALL BUSINESS PREPARING AND SELLING MEALS FROM HER HOUSE, GROW HER PROFITS AND PROVIDE A BETTER LIFE FOR HER CHILDREN.

loans.name: Moshi's Kamano 1 Group

texts.en:
Moshi , 45 years old, is married with 3 children, ages 25, 15 and 6. Moshi sells soft drinks, a business she started in 1990. She works from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. everyday and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

In the past, Moshi has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan of $775 to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses in food vending and clothes selling.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Francisca's Group

texts.es:
Este comité esta conformado por dieciocho mujeres emprendedoras que dedican sus vidas al trabajo y a la unión familiar. Todas poseen actividades distintas que realizan a la par de ser esposas, amas de casa y madres. Con mucho amor, ellas deciden trabajar además de realizar sus actividades en la casa, pues deben aportar con los ingresos de la familia ya que todas ellas provienen de familias muy humildes.

Entre las actividades que realizan citamos: venta de comestibles, frutas, verduras, ropas, joyas de plata, venta de comidas rápidas y reciclaje. Ellas se encuentra actualmente en el quinto ciclo del programa “comité de mujeres emprendedoras” que tiene como objetivo principal fomentar el emprendedurismo capacitándolas en las ventas de sus productos, en la buena inversión de sus capitales y en el ahorro. El reracionamiento de las integrantes es bastante bueno, todas se ayudan entre si y son muy puntuales en sus aportes y cuotas.

El crédito que solicitan desean destinarlo en la compra de mercaderías para la venta, ingredientes para sus comidas y insumos para reciclar.

loans.use: Compra de joyas de plata, remeras, pantalones, calzados, frutas, verduras, carne, azúcar, fideos, plásticos y papeles para reciclar.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena is an examplary woman, and very dedicated to her family. She’s known the value of hard work since childhood, as she comes from a humble home and was required to earn her keep at a very young age. Now she is a caring mother and hard-working spouse, putting her all into each activity. She sells clothing and beautiful weavings and accessories. With these jobs she earns essential income for her beloved family. Elena would like more than anything to provide security, stability, and education for her children. She is sure that expanding her handicrafts business would considerably improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Elena, es una dama ejemplar y consagrada a su familia, desde niña sabe el verdadero valor del trabajo, ya que proviene de un humilde hogar y la necesidad la obligó a ganarse el sustento diario desde muy pequeña.Actualmente es una madre cariñosa y una laboriosa esposa, que trata de poner su mayor esfuerzo y voluntad a cada una de las actividades que realiza como: la venta de ropa americana y hermosos tejidos de prendas de vestir, con estos trabajos genera indispensables ingresos económicos para su querida familia.El deseo de esta valiosa dama es brindarle seguridad, estabilidad y educación a sus queridos hijos, esta segura que ampliando su negocio de artesanía mejorará considerablemente sus ingresos económicos.

loans.use: Increased capital to purchase a wider variety of products

loans.name: Veng

texts.en: Veng C. is 26 years old and lives with her family in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. She sells soft drinks by the roadside from a large cooler earning US$5 a day. Her husband works as a motorbike mechanic and gets a lot of business each day. His income averages about US$8 a day. The young couple has two children who are still too young to attend school. Veng has several business plans for the future. She needs a loan to be able to purchase mechanic tools to help her husband in his business, as well as a plot of land to sell later once prices go up. Veng expects a rise in land prices, since the volume of tourism in the province is growing at an exponential rate.

loans.use: Purchase of mechanic tools and land

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda is a 30-year-old young merchant. She married Benjamin 11 years ago. Her husband is 35 years old. She has a 10-year-old son who is still in school. She has a booth where she sells all kinds of clothes in the municipal market of Itá. She tells us that that previously she used to do door to door sales until one day she decided to set up her own steady business seven years ago. She tells us that she is doing well and that she already has a good clientele. She sells all kinds of clothing like: T-shirts , shoes, jeans, shirts, etc. that she buys at the capital city. Her husband works as painter in Argentina and he comes every three months. Also he usually brings some goods to her, therefore she has exclusive clothing that you cannot easily buy in the area. This time she need a loan to buy of goods like: blouses, T-shirts, jeans and all kinds of seasonal clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Hilda es una joven comerciante de 30 años de edad. Está casada con Benjamin hace 11 años. Su esposo ha cumplido los 35 años de edad. Tiene un hijo de 10 años que aún va a la primaria y es la adoración de la pareja. Tiene un puesto de venta de ropas de todo tipo que funciona en el mercado municipal de Itá. Comenta que anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta ambulante, hasta que un día decidió montar su negocio estable. De ese momento ya han transcurrido 7 años. Cuenta que le va muy bien y que ya tiene una clientela muy bien formada. Vende todo tipo de prendas de vestir como: remeras, calzas, jeans, camisas, etc. que compra de la ciudad capital. Su esposo trabaja como pintor en la Argentina y viene cada tres meses. También suele traerle mercaderías de dicho país por lo que tiene prendas exclusivas que no se consiguen con facilidad en la zona. En esta ocasión necesita de un préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como ser: blusas, remeras, jeans y todo tipo de ropas de estación.

loans.use: Buy blouses, T-shirts, jeans and all kinds of seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidos (United Women) Group 6

texts.en:
Cloreta Y. lives in a very poor Haitian community outside of El Seybo with her husband, her youngest child (18 years old) and two grandchildren. Her three other children (ages 22, 26 and 29) live in the city of Higuey. Cloreta has a small collection of food products, a “paletera,” that she stores in her house and sells to her neighbors. She says the most difficult thing about her business is having enough money to buy rice, because it is in high demand but also very expensive. Cloreta has successfully paid back four loans to Esperanza and is now requesting her fourth. With this loan of $900, she plans to buy even more products to sell so that she can increase her profits and improve her way of life. She and the other four members of her group are pictured here, meeting with their loan officer to prepare to receive the next loan. This group is part of the larger Bank of Hope called “Mujeres Unidas,” or United Women.

Note: This is a group loan for five people. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of food and grow her business

loans.name: Elkhan

texts.en: Elkhan was born in 1956. This man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Agdam region, settled in the Absheron region. He is married and has 4 children. 10 years ago he started this business. Now he needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy spare parts for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Ravshanoy

texts.en: Ravshanoy Bekmurotova  is a 30 year old widow with 2 children. For the past 12 years, Ravshanoy has dedicated herself to selling eggs in Istaravshan's central market. She has led a difficult life, particularly when she became a widow and was unable to find work to replace her husband's income. As a result, she decided to invest the small amount of savings that her and her husband were able to collect over many years and started her business. She has been acquiring greater amounts of eggs which has slowly helped increase her earnings. Her plans are to invest more in her business through the purchase of additional product to sell. Ravshanoy has worked with IMON for loans over the past two years and, despite the competition, she is starting to see better results from her endeavors. She proposes to continue with the loans which have benefited her business greatly.

loans.use: To purchase additional eggs to sell

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou S., 49 ans, veuve, 06 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Mbousnack depuis 6 ans. Elle veut renforcer son activité de vente de niébé, arachide, piment, poivre et cube maggi. Ses revenus lui permettent d’assurer la prise en charge de sa famille.<b> Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Fatou S., age 49 , is a widow with six children in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group of Mbousnack for six years. She want to bolster her business selling black-eye peas, peanuts, chili peppers, black pepper, and Maggi bouillon cubes. Her income allows her to ensure her family's expenses are covered. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in food items

loans.name: Gabriela Soledad

texts.en:
Gabriela is a member of the Alelí Village Bank.

Gabriela is 40 years old, married, and has four children who are 19, 16, 9 and 3 years old. She sells hamburgers from a vending cart, but would like to open up a restaurant. Her hamburgers are homemade and sell very well, so she expects to have a lot of customers.

Gabriela is requesting a loan of 1750 soles to buy tables and chairs for the restaurant. She has already found a space to use in a high-traffic area on Manco Capac Street in the center of the city of Ayacucho.

This is Gabriela’s third loan cycle with the Alelí Village Bank. She says that FINCA has helped her by providing her with easily accessible investment capital. She finds the training/education sessions provided by her loan officer to be very helpful, and says that her work with FINCA has taught her to be punctual. She has almost 1000 soles in her FINCA savings account, and says she never would have saved this much were it not for the help of the institution. 

Gabriela’s dream is to eventually open up a soda fountain-style restaurant that would be open all day and sell cakes, pastries, and coffee in addition to meals.

loans.use: Buy tables and chairs for restaurant

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Ernest B. is 30 years old. He is single with one kid who is currently in school. Ernest is a dealer in mobile phones and accessories. He also provides repairs and servicing works for his customers. He says the sale of mobile phone has become a very lucrative business in Ghana because almost every Ghanaian desires to possess a mobile phone for easy and fast communication.

He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices and sells to his customers at retail prices. He requests the loan to enable him procure a stock of mobile phone and accessories. He hopes the loan would enable him to increase savings to expand his shop to include the sale of iPods and digital cameras. He belongs to the community group called Vibrant Trust Group. In this group, members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. He does not sell on group meeting days and his picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To procure increased stock of mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Moussa Koné est  un célibataire de 28 ans qui vit chez son oncle dans le quartier Hérémakono de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali) .
Il abandonna l’école dès son jeune âge au profit de la photographie qu’il a appris  auprès d’un de ses cousin. Avec une expérience de 7 ans, Monsieur Moussa Koné maîtrise son activité et est très apprécié avec une réputation et une notoriété exemplaire. En plus de sa traditionnelle activité qu’est la photographie il fait de l’animation musicale lors de différentes cérémonies(baptèmes, mariages, aniversaires...) 
Dans le souci de faire prospérer ses affaires il décida d’intégrer le programme  crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son deuxième prêt individuel. Le premier prêt a été correctement remboursé.
Avec ce prêt il compte acheter un appareil photo et un appareil de sonorisation. Il s’approvisionnera en ces différents articles cités ci-dessus à Bamako(capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des commerçants spécialisés du domaine. Ses clients sont généralement les jeunes qui affluent beaucoup plus pendant les jours feriés, les congés et vacances scolaires. C’est pendant ces périodes  que ses activités sont très élévés.
Moussa  Koné compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 65 000 FCFA.
Avec ce bénéfice il envisage ouvrir un autre studio, subvenir à ses besoins et enfin fonder une famille.
texts.en:
Moussa Koné is a 28-year-old single man who lives with his uncle in the Hérémakono neighbourhood of Bougouni, Mali. He left school at a very young age in order to do photography which he learned from one of his cousins. He has seven years' experience and has mastered photography. He is very popular and enjoys an excellent reputation. In addition to photography, he plays music at various ceremonies (baptisms, weddings, birthdays...) He decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program in order to bolster his business. This is his second individual loan; the first loan has been properly repaid. He will use the loan to buy a new camera and sound system. He will travel to Bamako, Mali's capital, to make his purchases, buying from specialized stores. His customers are usually young people who come most often during school holidays and school breaks: sales are highest at those times. Moussa Koné expects to make 65,000 FCFA monthly. With this income, he plans to open another studio, support himself and finally be able to start a family.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a camera and a sound system.

loans.name: Met

texts.en: Met H. is 45 years old, and lives with his wife in Battambang, Cambodia. He works as a moto-taxi driver and earns around $28 each day. His wife, pictured here, earns $5 by selling charcoal in the community. This couple lives with seven children, four of whom are students and one is a construction worker. Met H. is asking for a loan for his wife to purchase rice and charcoal for resale.

loans.use: To purchase rice and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Lazaro

texts.en: Lazaro J. Jr. manages a variety store  as his main source of income to raise his family. He is maried with seven children,  five of whom are in school. Lazaro has also a skills in cooking. He wants to engage in a food vending business which will be situated beside his variety store. Being an excellent cook, Lazaro is confident that he could gain patronage from their neighbors and even in their neighboring villages. He aspires to improve the building structure of his variety store and put up a food vending stall as well. Lazaro believes that this is the best thing he could do so he can send his cildren to school.  He is requesting an additional loan of PHP11000 to finance his plan.

loans.use: To improve the structure of his variety store and an extension stall for his food vending business.

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị H. 34 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ Tình thương từ năm 2008.Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là từ sản xuất kinh doanh đồ gỗ và lương lái xe của chồng với thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn cho công việc kinh doanh của gia
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H., 34 years old, has participated in TYM Fund since 2008. Currently, the business that brings the main source of income for her family is making and trading furniture. Together with the salary of her husband who is a driver, the total income of the family is VND 4,000,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND 9,000,000 to invest more in the business of the family.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for furniture making and trading

loans.name: Rafig

texts.en: Rafig is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, now settled in the Fuzuli region in Horadiz settlement. This man was born in 1965. He has been in a dairy business for 7 years. Now, he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 3 cows for improving his dairy business. Rafig is married and has 5 children.

loans.use: To buy 3 cows

loans.name: Tujumuike Group

texts.en:
Amosi M., 27, is married with three children ages, 12, 10 and 4. He has a clothes business where they print and make different fashions to sell. He started this business about ten years ago. He works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily. He is able to earn a monthly profit of around $177.

This will be Amosi’s fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase his businesses and also bought a zigzag machine and has paid back his loans successfully. He wants to use the new loan to increase his capital and to buy more material.

Amosi will share this loan with his group Tujumwike, which totals 16 members. The members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Amosi is the only man.

loans.use: To increase his capital and to buy more material

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura is 28 years old and she is married.

She has been a juice and bread seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for a year. She belongs to Tujisaidie group loan (Group code 2102). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $25. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.

Zuhura is looking for loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more juice and bread to sell. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

loans.use: To buy more juice and bread to sell

loans.name: Maria Eulogia

texts.es:
La señora María Eulogia tiene 23años.  Está casada con el Señor Cristhian Román y ellos tienen un hijo menor de edad. Ellos tienen una despensa en su domicilio desde el año 2006. Venden todo tipo de productos comestibles, bebidas, alimentos a granel, entre otros. El Señor Cristhian posee un pequeño equipamiento de discoteca, el cual alquila los fines de semana a pequeños eventos del barrio, también se dedica a la poda de arboles para la ANDE (Administración Nacional de Electricidad).

Este crédito será de mucha utilidad para aumentar el stock de mercaderías en la despensa, así como también para la adquisición de una consola para el equipamiento de discoteca,, con lo cual podrán generar mejores ingresos para su familia y podrán cumplir lentamente su anhelo de terminar la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Ms. María Eulogia is a 23-year-old woman who is married to Mr. Cristhian Román, with whom she has a young son. She and her husband have run a general store in their home since 2006. They sell all types of edible products, drinks, and food in bulk, among other goods. Mr. R. has his own D.J. equipment, which he rents on weekends for neighborhood events. He also provides tree trimming services for the ANDE (National Electricity Administration).

This loan will be useful in increasing inventory for his general store, as well as purchasing a mixer for his D.J. equipment, with which he will be able to generate better profits for his family so that they can slowly realize their dream of finishing construction of their house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods for general store

loans.name: Zahra Group

texts.en: Zahra is the leader of Zahra group. There are four members in this group and they live in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. The total requested amount is 40,000 AFN. Each of them would like to receive a loan for her own business. Zahra and Torpekay want to receive a loan for their tailoring business. Salaha wants a loan for her son’s business of selling gasoline. Nasema wants a loan for her son’s general store. They appreciate this loan process and want to thank Kiva.

loans.use: To sustain their businesses

loans.name: Nervith

texts.es: La señora Nervith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Siempre Unidas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 37 años y 01 hijo, que aun dependen de ella.Nervith, con el apoyo de su pareja y de Manuela Ramos y teniendo  la habilidad para la costura, decidió implementar su propio negocio ubicado en su misma casa. Nos cuenta que le va muy bien en sus ventas, trabaja con pedidos y confecciones, hechas por ellas mismas.En la actualidad continua con sus confecciones de vestidos y tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden a su casa para realizar sus trabajos y pedidos, es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad que le caracteriza. Con el préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando telas en metros, de diferentes especies, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. Nervith, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada e Independiente, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Nervith belongs to the Siempre Unidas Community Bank in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 37, in a common law marriage, and has one dependent son. With help from her significant other and Manuela Ramos, and having the ability to sew, Nervith decided to set up her own business in her own house. Sales are going well for her. She works on orders and clothes that she has made by herself. She currently continues making clothes, and she has loyal customers who come to her house every day to buy her work and their orders. She waits on them with her characteristic kindness. With the loan for 3,000 PEN she wants to buy meters of different types of fabric; instruments that she uses like scissors, sewing needles and machine needles, pins; and buttons. Nervith now feels very fulfilled and independent with the desire to make the rest of her dreams come true. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and for helping so many women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric, thread, and work instruments

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa T. C. is 48 years old and is a native of Guija in Gaza province. She moved from Guija to Boane with her parents when she was a child.

Teresa works in the Boane central market mainly selling produce, her best selling products being onions and potatoes. She is able to buy a sack of potatoes for MT 70 and sell them for MT 110 and buy a sack of onions for MT 80 and sell them for MT 140. She has been working in the market for the past twenty years and originally learned her trade in Swaziland.

Teresa is requesting this loan to help further diversify her products to satisfy customer demand. This will be her second loan with Hluvuku. Her first loan was for MT 10,000. Teresa earns around MT 10,000 a month and is able to set aside money each month in a savings account at the BIM bank.

Teresa studied through the ninth grade but was forced to stop due to pregnancy and the necessity to properly raise her child. She is married to a mechanic and is the mother of four children aged 18, 22, 24 and 26. She also supports two nieces and her mother, to whom she sends remittance payments.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Aleida Antonia

texts.es:
En el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Aleida V. se dedica a laborar en la venta de electrodomésticos y de juguetes que ella misma posee en su establecimiento que es muy visitado por los clientes para adquirir sus productos.

Es de mucha importancia hacer el señalamiento que ella se ha destacado como excelente comerciante en su negocio logrando satisfacer a sus clientes y hoy en día acudió a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los juguetes y los electrodomésticos para así continuar adquiriendo ganancias en el negocio.
texts.en:
Aleida V. sells household appliances and toys in the Mayoreo market in the city of Managua. She carries these products in her establishment, which is well frequented by customers buying these products. It is very important to note that she has excelled as a business woman. She has achieved customer satisfaction. She now comes to Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy toys and household appliances to continue to get earnings from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy household appliances and toys

loans.name: Iftikhor

texts.en:
N. Iftikhor is 22 years old. He is not married yet. Iftikhor has very large family. So that, to support his parents Iftikhor has been running his own business for 2 years. He is selling the perfumery like perfume for women and men, air fresheners, tooth pastes and brushes. Today Iftikhor requests 7500 Somoni as he is planning to expand his business and increase the capital and after receiving of large income He would like to thank all supporting him and promises to pay the loan in 12 months. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of new goods for increasing the range of goods

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es: La señora Modesta, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mi Sueño”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 64 años, 04 hijos todos ellos ya independientes y formando sus propias  familias.Modesta, se dedica a la venta de bebidas gasificadas. Manifiesta que con el negocio que ejerce se siente muy tranquila y contenta, vive sola y es ella quien administra su negocio. También se dedica al alquiler de cuartos, se siente muy capaz y responsable con las cuotas que debe pagar mensualmente al Banco Comunal.Actualmente continúa con el mismo negocio, y nos cuenta que le va muy bien ya que los vende bien heladitas y al gusto del cliente.Con este préstamo de S/ 1,700.00, comprará paquetes de gaseoas, en  diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas. Así como agua mineral con gas y sin gas. Modesta, se siente orgullosa por haber logrado implementar su negocio, y asegurarse una vejez tranquila. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por haberla ayudado a superarse y a otras mujeres que quieren salir adelante y a defenderse como mujeres.
texts.en:
Sra. Modesta is a member of the Communal Bank “Mi Sueño” (My Dream), which is located in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 64 years old, married, and the mother of 4 adult children who have their own families.

She sells carbonated beverages, a business that keeps her very calm and happy. Modesta lives alone and manages the business by herself. She also rents out rooms, so she is capable and responsible in making her monthly loan payments to her Communal Bank. She continues with her business and tells us that she is doing well because cold drinks have good sales and customers like the taste.

With this loan of 1700 soles, she will buy packages of soft drinks in different flavor, sizes, and brands. She will also buy mineral water, carbonated and non-carbonated.

Modesta is very proud that she was able to start a business and can assure herself of a peaceful retirement. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her and being an advocate for other women who want to succeed and provide for themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas & mineral water

loans.name: Sindy

texts.es:
Sindy tiene 20 años, es una joven alegre y sencilla, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida. El puesto de artesanías de Sindy está ubicado en el Parque Bolognesi (parque importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), su puesto es uno de los más llamativos debido a las artesanías tan bonitas que elabora y vende, además se puede encontrar de todo; desde llaveros, hasta prendas tejidas a mano. Lo que más le gusta a Sindy de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta. Para el futuro espera tener una tienda más grande donde pueda brindar a sus clientes una mayor comodidad.
Este es el tercer préstamo de Sindy con MFP y está muy feliz de la nueva oportunidad de crédito. En su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil doscientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más material para elaborar sus artesanías y así implementar mejor su stock.
texts.en:
Sindy is a lively and easygoing 20-year-old who lives at home with her parents. What she wants most is to excel in life. Sindy's crafts booth is located in Bolognesi Park (a major park in the city of Juliaca) and is one of the most eye-catching due to the beautiful crafts that she makes and sells. One can find a bit of everything at the booth, from keychains to garments woven by hand.

What Sindy likes the most about her job is talking with customers. She has been in this line of work for 3 years and considers the most difficult thing to be having to stay all day in her sales booth. In the future Sindy hopes to have a bigger store where she can bring her customers greater comfort and convenience.

This is Sindy's third loan with MFP (Microfinanzas Prisma, a Kiva Field partner), and she is very happy to have this new opportunity for a loan. In her communal bank she is a very supportive member with the rest of her business partners. With the 1200 Peruvivan soles (US$425), she will buy more materials to make her crafts so she can increase her stock.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy materials to make crafts

loans.name: Pat

texts.en: Pat is 42 years old and married with 4 children. She sells cooked foods and drinks to earn income to satisfy the needs of her children and husband. She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Aopheasang Village Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sam Oeurn M. is the leader of a group with four members who all live in Aopheasang village in Takeo province. She is a vegetable seller in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more assorted vegetables to resell to earn more income. Mrs. Sam Oeurn M. is 48 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom use the motorbike with a cart to transport goods and passengers, while the other is a seller who helps with the mother’s business.

loans.use: To buy more assorted vegetables to resell to earn more income

loans.name: Malou

texts.en:
Malou R. is from the village of Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 26 years old. Malou is single and has 3 infant-aged children. To make a living, Malou owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Malou has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Malou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Malou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Malou is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Malou from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product range.

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en: Kassem is a 41-year-old married man living with his wife and five young children. In 1989, he started working in construction and tiling. Today, Kassem is hoping to further expand his business buy taking a US$ 1,000 loan to purchase scaffolding.

loans.use: to purchase scaffolding

loans.name: Adenike

texts.en: Adenike is 39 years old and a single mother of two children. She is a member of LAPO Microfinance. Adenike is a hair dresser, and she has a salon where she styles hair and sells hair extensions and hair cream. For over 14 years now she has been running the business. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 70,000 to improve her business and purchase more hair extensions and hairdressing accessories to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and hairdressing accessories to sell.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es:
El señor Valentín M. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Munaypata, área periférica de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos.
El señor Valentín y su esposa trabajan en construcciones de viviendas particulares como albañil y ayudante respectivamente, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de una losa (es una base de cemento y arena que una vez vaciada se convierte en un piso duro) para luego construir habitaciones en planta alta de su vivienda, ya que las habitaciones que tiene no brindan espacio suficiente para su familia.
Esta es la octava vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Valentín M. lives in his own home in the Munaypata zone, an outlying district of the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife and their four children. Mr. Valentín and his wife work in housing construction as a bricklayer and assistant, respectively. Their incomes support their family. The loan that he is soliciting is to build a “losa” (which is a cement and sand base that once set becomes a hard floor) in order to later build bedrooms on the top floor of their home. The bedrooms that they currently have do not provide sufficient space for their family. This is the eighth time they have requested a loan and the socioeconomical analysis qualifies them favorably and they are able to access a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cost of construction of a cement top floor in order to add on bedrooms to their home

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 28-year-old man who lives in Saida in southern Lebanon. Ahmad has owned and operated a coffee shop since 1999. He also offers narguileh (also known as shisha in Egypt), which is an ancient tradition enjoyed by the people of the Middle East. This tall (or short) water pipe is used to smoke fruit-flavored tobacco. Ahmad requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop, like a billiard to attract younger customers and make his coffee shop a nice place to hang out and have a good time. This is his fourth loan cycle, and he has always paid on time.

Ahmad's previous loans helped him start a new business selling scrap metal. This second business is a way to improve his income. Ahmad is an active man who does his best to improve his family's financial situation, and he even said that if he had more time, he would consider starting a third job.

Ahmad is special in his work, because his clients feel comfortable coming to his shop and enjoying a nice coffee or drink with their narguileh. His clients are his friends, neighbors, passersby, and people from his region. When he first started his business, he had difficulty purchasing all the necessary merchandise for his shop. He decided on doing his business, because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans to continue improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase beans, groundnuts, millet, etc.

loans.name: Lizeth Nora

texts.es:
La señorita Lizeth es socia del Banco Comunal “Cristo Blanco”, es socia nueva, vive en el distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Ella estudió superior incompleto, se dedica a la compra y venta de cosméticos.

Este es su primer crédito, ella requiere S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, piensa invertirlo en la compra de labiales, cremas, perfumes, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es terminar la carrera y graduarse, además que su negocio crezca. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones con las socias
texts.en:
Sra. Lizeth is a new member of the Communal Bank “Cristo Blanco” (White Christ). She lives in the District of Juliaca, Province of San Román, Department of Puno. Lizeth is 20 years old, single, and does not have any children. She did not finish her college education, so she earns her living buying and selling cosmetics.

This is her first loan. She is requesting 300 PEN to buy lipsticks, creams, perfumes, and other products. Her dreams for the future are to finish her degree and graduate, as well as grow her business. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the meetings with the other members.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lipsticks, creams, perfumes, and other products

loans.name: Kasmiro

texts.en:
Kasmiro R. is currently in the business of selling clothes and bedsheets and is requesting a loan to open up a food stall.  Kasmiro is 22 years old and is married to a husband who is a teacher. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land and build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: open up a food stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of grocery items

loans.name: Maximina

texts.es:
En el municipio El Sauce en León, la señora Maximina Z. se dedica a su actividad agropecuaria dando lugar a la crianza de ganado y actividades agricolas que ella misma lleva que es el fruto de sus manos.

Es necesario destacar que ella tiene 26 largos años de dedicarse a esta actividad y se ha convertido en una profesional trabajadora porque ha logrado llevar el sustento a su familia que habita en el municipio. El crédito será invertido para suplir sus necesidades y de esta manera continuar mejorando las condiciones agropecuarias para beneficio propio y de su familia que tanto ama.
texts.en:
Z. A. has been working with CEPRODEL for three years as a co-debtor. On this occasion, she got a loan assuming the debt of Mr. Aler José Ramos. Z. lives in El Chote, in the El Sauce municipality. She works in agriculture and has her own farm and cattle. It is necessary to mention that she has 26 years of experience in this field.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inversión en la actividad agropecuaria

loans.name: Daniel Humberto

texts.es: Daniel Humberto D. G. de 25 años de edad reside en el municipio de Osicala, ubicado en el departamento de Morazán. Vive junto a su esposa la cual se dedica a ayudarle a Daniel en el negocio. Él posee su propio negocio en el cual comercializa ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, ropa interior y zapatos deportivos. La venta esta ubicada frente a al parque de Osicala, un lugar de mucho comercio ya que a sus alrededores se encuentra el mercado y el supermercado, así como también otras comerciales, esto es de mucho beneficio para Daniel ya que muchas personas transitan el lugar lo que lo hace más visible. Él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de ropa y calzado, de manera que sus ventas aumenten, ya que es esta la única forma en que se gana la vida. Tanto Daniel como su esposa son muy admirados en el lugar ya que ha pesar de su corta edad se esfuerzan en gran manera por obtener una vida estable.
texts.en:
Daniel Humberto D. G. is 25 and lives in the municipality of Osicala, in the province of Morazán. He lives with his wife, who assists him with his business. Daniel sells assorted clothing for men, women and children, including underwear and sports shoes. He sells from a location in front of the park in Osicala, where many people gather for shopping, as there is a market and supermarket nearby along with other stores, which helps Daniel and makes his business more visible to passerby. He seeks a loan in order to buy additional inventory of clothing and footwear so as to increase his sales, as this is his family's sole livelihood. Both Daniel and his wife are well-regarded in his town as they are hard-working young people who have attained a stable living through their own efforts.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Cassetta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory of clothing and footwear

loans.name: Omolara

texts.en:
Omolara is 40 years old, married and has a child. She and her family live in Lagos. She is hardworking and has been borrowing from LAPO for some years. She make clothes in different styles and has three apprentices with her at the shop. She also sells tailoring materials, sarongs and other accessories and has been in this business for over fifteen years. She makes sure customers demands are met while indirectly improving herself financially.
Omolara is requesting for a loan of NGN100, 000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She thank lenders for their good work.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell.

loans.name: Richel's Group

texts.en:
Richel E. is from Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old and the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Richel is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she plants and harvests mango to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $455 a month from this activity.

In 2004, Richel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. Richel is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her 26th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of fruits and products for their businesses.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Gladis es una madre de familia de 49 años de edad que vive junto a su hija en el caserío Huaca Blanca del distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito dedicado principalmente al cultivo de frutas, pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra en la región del mismo nombre, a màs de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ella ofrece a sus vecinos todo tipo de productos de uso diario por los cuales tendrían que viajar hasta el pueblo central para adquirirlos. Por ello su negocio es bastante frecuentado y ella, consciente de la necesidad de sus clientes, trata de brindarles productos de calidad.

Adicionalmente tiene un terreno donde ha sembrado limones, los cuales cosecha con bastante regularidad y los vende a las fábricas procesadoras de la zona. Con estos ingresos ella solventa sus gastos familiares, por lo que da lo mejor de si para mantener sus actividades de la mejor manera.

Gladis desea adquirir más mercadería para aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias, por este motivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Epyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante conocida y estimada por sus vecinos, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gladis is a 49 year old mother who lives with her daughter in the village of Huaca Blanca in the district of Tambogrande, where the main business activity is fruit production. This district lies in the province and region of Piura and is located more than three hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

For more than five years, Gladis has been selling basic necessities and groceries from a store located in her home. From there she offers her neighbors all types of everyday products. Otherwise they would have to travel into town to buy them. Her business is very busy, so Gladis is aware of the needs of her customers and tries to provide them quality products.

In addition, Gladis has land where she produces limes that are harvested regularly and sold to local processing factories. With this income, she is able to cover her family’s expenses and provide them the best so that they can maintain their activities.

Gladis wants to acquire more merchandise to increase her sales and generate better earnings. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 800 PEN to help meet her goal.

Gladis is a woman who is well-known and respected by her neighbors. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman so that she can provide her family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en: In Lekh Muoy village in Kandal province, all four members have selected Mrs. Touch C. as the group leader of their group loan. Each member will use their portion of their loan in various ways. Mrs. Touch C. is a housewife who makes delicious food for her family, while her husband, Mr. Thy Noun, is a construction worker who earns some money to support his family. Now they have a problem because their house is broken and they do not have money to repair it. So Mrs. Touch C. is asking for a loan to repair her own house. She is a mother of seven children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, one is a construction worker, two are studying in the local public school, and the others are too small to work or study.

loans.use: To repair her own house

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Teresa de Jesús C., tiene 38 años de edad vive en San Ignacio, acompañada de sus hijos y su esposo. Él señor labora como soldador tienen 4 hijos mayores de edad que apoyan a los gastos del hogar con sus ingresos mensuales, ellos son agricultores desde hace mas de 22 años.xzx

Uno de los principales problemas que afectan al negocio es la escases de agua potable que no abastece a su zona, ellos esperan a futuro próximo comprar un tanque de agua con el fin de almacenar para los días en donde no les suministren el vital liquido y convivan sin problema, por ahora solicita un préstamo que les permita la compra de fertilizantes, pesticidas y abonos orgánicos que favorezcan a  la siembra y se produzca una mejor cosecha, esta inversión a futuro favorecerá la economía de la familia y les permitirá incursionar a nuevas fuentes de trabajo.
texts.en:
Mrs Teresa de Jesús C., age 38, lives in San Ignacio with her children and husband. Her husband works as a welder. They have 4 grown children who help with the household costs with their monthly earnings. They have been farmers for over 22 years. One of the main problems that affect the business is shortages of potable water which is not supplied to her zone. They hope in the near future to purchase a tank of water to store up for the days when this vital liquid is not supplied. For now they are requesting a loan which will allow them to purchase fertilizers, pesticides and organic fertilizers which are better for planting and produce a better harvest. This investment in the future will improve their family's economic condition and permit them to explore new sources of income.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of fertilizers, pesticides and organic fertlizers which are better for planting

loans.name: Dul

texts.en:
Mrs. Dul D. has been in the farming business for years. She plants various crops to earn a living and typically generates an income of $3 per day. Her husband works in the farm fields with her.

The coming rainfall season is the time when it is easy to plant crops. However, Dul D. doesn’t have any supplies to use on her field. She now requests a $200 loan to be used to purchase fertilizer and seed to plant.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seed to plant

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline B. is from the village of Dban Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old. Evangeline is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector selling home products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling home furniture to tourists and local community members. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Evangeline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Evangeline from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
el grupo El Triunfo es integrado por dos mujeres y un hombre, tienen varios años de conocerse y son personas humildes y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:

doña Aura Leticia V. es una mujer trabajadora y dedicada a su  negocio el cual es la venta de golosinas  en la escuela de su comunidad, Aura es madre de 5 hijos, los mas grandes le ayudan a la venta de golosinas. 
Aura y su esposo trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante su familia.
Aura se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para preparar  las ricas golosinas y sus tiempos libres lo dedica la familia. 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de los materiales para la fabricacion de las golosinas.

Virginia de jesus A. es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a la venta de dulces en su casa de habitacion, tiene 15 años de realizar este tipo de actividad. Virginia es madre de 2 hijos los cuales ya son profesionales.  Virginia y su esposo trabajan duro para sacar adelante el hogar.
doña Virginia vende sus dulces a los alumnos que pasan por su casa. su tiempo libre lo dedica para asistir a la iglesia.

don Jose M. es una persona trabajadora  que se dedica a la venta de semillas de marañon desde hace 7
años en su comunidad.
don Jose y su esposa trabajan duro para sacar adelante su familia, tienen 4 hijos los cuales los tiene en la escuela.
Jose se levanta a las 6 de la mañana para despulpar la semilla y asi venderla.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de semillas de marañon.
texts.en:
The “El Triunfo” (The Triumph) group is composed of two women and one man. They have known each other for several years and are humble folk with a strong wish to get ahead. Following are details on the different activities they carry out: Aura Leticia V. is a hard working woman who is dedicated to her business of selling snacks in her local school. She has five children. The oldest ones help out in the snack shop. Aura and her husband work hard to help the family succeed. Aura rises at 5am to prepare the delicious snacks and she spends her free time with her family. The loan will be used to buy ingredients to make the snacks. Virginia de Jesús A. is an enterprising woman who sells candy in her home. She has been in this business for 15 years. She has two children who are now professionals. She and her husband work hard for their home’s success. Virginia sells candy to students that pass by her house. In her free time she goes to church. José Martínez is a hard working person who has sold cashews for the last 7 years in his community. He and his wife work hard together to have their family succeed. They have 4 children who are in school. José rises daily at 6am to dehusk the seeds for sale. He will use the loan to buy cashew nuts.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tortillas, lard, cooking oil, salt, condiments, beef, pork, chicken, vegetables, cheese, sugar, artificial flavorings and cashews.

loans.name: Khon

texts.en:
Mrs. Khon S., 51, and her husband, Mr. Sam-oeun Some, 55, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They were married in 1978 and have four children: one son and three daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home; one is a tailor; another one weaves silk at home, and another attends school.

Mrs. Khon S. has been a silk weaver for 20 years, selling her finished products to a middleman who then resells them in Phnom Penh market. Her husband drives for a company in Phnom Penh. Khon is now requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To buy silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les 4 femmes du groupe Benkadi sont toutes mariées, avec une moyenne d’âge  qui  tourne autour de 39 ans, elles ont en moyenne 8 enfants et vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles dans la ville de San (région de Ségou, république du Mali).
Elles sont à leur 1er prêt solidaire avec l’institution et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. 
Elles exercent presque la même activité d’achat et de vente de condiments et produits alimentaires. 
Fanta S., la présidente du groupe détient un kiosque au bord du goudron uniquement pour la vente de pâte d’arachide. 
Elle s’approvisionne en gros auprès des sœurs catholiques pour revendre en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle essentiellement constituée de femmes. 
Elle compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 13500FCFA par mois qui la permettra de rembourser le prêt, venir en aide à son époux et réinvestir dans l’entreprise. 
Dans l’avenir Fanta S. compte venir au prêt individuel  pour être elle-même productrice de pâte d’arachide.
texts.en:
The four women in the Benkadi group are all married and are on average 39 years old. They all have about 8 children and live in large traditional families in the town of San (in the Ségou region, republic of Mali).
This is  their first solidarity loan with the organisation and they became acquainted through family ties and living in the same neighbourhood.
They all practice almost the same activity of buying and selling condiments and foodstuffs.
Fanta S., the president of the group owns a stall on the side of the road solely for the sale of peanut paste.
She buys her supplies wholesale from some catholic nuns, to sell retail for cash or on credit to a clientele that is essentially made up of women.
She is counting on a monthly profit of 13500FCFA  which will enable her to repay the loan, help her husband, and reinvest in the business.
In the future Fanta S. plans to request an individual loan in order to become a producer of peanut paste herself.

loans.use: Purchase of peanut paste

loans.name: Nelly Victoria

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

La señora Nelly es socia del Banco Comunal desde sus inicios y está muy contenta por eso ya que gracias a los créditos que recibe de la Fundación ha podido mejorar su situación a través de su negocio. Tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y tiene 6 hijos ya todos mayores de edad, solo su hija menor vive con ella en su casa. Su marido trabaja en un taxi que es de su propiedad en Manta.

Es un ama de casa que para tener sus propios ingresos y ayudar con los gastos familiares decidió hace ya 5 años dedicarse a la venta de sabanas y edredones. Trabaja tres días a la semana  recorriendo con su mercadería, la misma que ofrece a sus conocidos o clientes nuevos que tengan referencia de los clientes que ya tiene, hace esto porque ella  deja a crédito y no quiere inconvenientes con los cobros, los mismos que realiza cada quince días. La mercadería la compra en Picoaza.

Este crédito es para comprar más mercadería ya que la que tiene es muy poca y necesita para los pedidos que tiene. Su sueño es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora communal bank meets in La Sequita parish, part of Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manta, filled with hard working people dedicated to and proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parish whose residents are honest people who only know how to work and be dedicated to their families.

Nelly has been a member of the communal bank since its inception and she is very happy because of that for it's thanks to the loans she gets from the Foundation that she’s been able to improve her situation through her business.  She is 53 years old, married and has 6 children who are all now adults. Only her youngest daughter still lives with her in her house.  Her husband drives a taxi that he owns in Manta.

She is a housewife who decided five years ago, in order to have her own source of income and help with family expenses, to start selling bed sheets and comforters.  She works three days a week taking her merchandise to her acquaintances or new customers that are recommended by current customers.  She does this because she sells on credit and she doesn’t want to have any problems at collection time which occur every two weeks. She buys her merchandise in Picoaza.

This loan is to buy more merchandise because she has very little left and needs it for the pending orders she has.  Her dream is to finish building her house.

loans.use: To buy bed sheets and comforters.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella B. is 39 years old, married, and supports her family by operating a fishing business. She lives in Purok Pasayan, Brgy. Tomongtong, EB. Magalona, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF, and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 9,000 PHP. Bella is currently borrowing 13,000 PHP so that she can purchase a new engine and crab nets. This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 14,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Bella aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon--a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a community member who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase new engine and crab net

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en:
Tahir B. is a 56-year-old farmer who raises seasonal fruits and vegetables in the small village of Sabirabad. He has raised crops since 2005 and all the members of his large family help him. Tahir has three children. 

Tahir usually sells crops in the central bazaar or to local traders. He would like to produce a new type of apple for next season and he needs good seeds and fertilizer. That is what he is going to buy with his loan.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for crops

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Mrs. Ny S. and her husband, Mr. Samnang Pouk, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2007 and have one son. Ny is a weaver, a skill she learned after her marriage and Samnang is a farmer. Ny is asking for a loan of $250 to provide capital for her husband’s farm and for her weaving business.

loans.use: To provide capital for her husband’s farm.

loans.name: Felizaida

texts.en:
Felizaida R. is from the town of Banga. She is 52 years old. Felizaida is married and has 10 children. To make a living, Felizaida owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Felizaida does everything to be a good mother to her children and a good wife to her husband. 

Felizaida joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felizaida has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Felizaida is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP (Philippine pesos) which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm necessities. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Davaamunh

texts.en:
Davaamunh is 27 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, in his parents' enclosure. His wife works as a salesperson in the Merkuri market in the city.

Davaamunh started his business in 2007 with the help of his friend. He makes a variety of wooden items and furniture according to his customers' orders to support his family. Since 2010, he has operated this business on his own. After years of hard work, he was able to build a workplace in his enclosure. For the future, he plans to decorate his own workplace. Davaamunh is a modest man and is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to make repairs and decoration in his workplace.

loans.use: to make repairs and decoration in his workplace

loans.name: Samila

texts.fr: Samila M. est commerçante, et client d’ACB depuis 2010.  Elle est mariée, née a Rwanda, et son niveau d’éducation est A2.  Elle a 4 enfants entre 4 et 13 ans, et 3 de ses enfants vont à l’école.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 15 basins, 20 pantalons et 2 couvre-lits.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’accroitre son capital a fin d’avoir plus de rentabilité.  Elle voudrait être grossiste, éduquer ses enfants et avoir le bien-être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Samila M. is a merchant and has been a client of ACB since 2010. She is married, was born in Rwanda, and has an A2 level of education.  She has four children, ages 4 to 13, and three of them go to school.  

Samila is going to use her loan to buy 15 basins, 20 pairs of pants, and 2 bed covers.  Her strategy for growing her business is to increase her capital in order to be more profitable.  She would like to be a wholesale merchant, to educate her children, and to have a happy and healthy family.

loans.use: Buying clothing, basins, pants, and bed covers

loans.name: Federico

texts.es:
Federico es un padre de familia de 57 años de edad, que reside junto a su esposa y a su hijo en el sector Baldera, una zona rural agrícola y ganadera del distrito de San José, el cual se encuentra ubicado a más de 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace más de veinte años a la ganadería, él  cría su ganado en el Sector Gallito ubicado en el distrito de  San José asimismo cuenta con algunas vacas de las cuales comercializa a diario la leche que producen entre los vecinos de la zona, y el resto de ganado vacuno lo alimenta para que alcancen un buen nivel desarrollo y comercializarlo entre los negociantes de la zona. Con estos negocios él se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia y de solventar su economía diaria.

Federico desea adquirir alimento balanceado para su ganado y mantenimiento de alfalfa que servirá en un futuro de alimento de ganado. Con una buena alimentación sus animales podrá rendir más leche y esto le permitirá percibir mayores ganancias. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

El es un padre que siempre vela por el bienestar y desarrollo de su familia. Su mayor anhelo es su establo propio.
texts.en:
Federico is a 57 year-old father who lives together with his wife and son in Baldera, a rural, agricultural and livestock-raising area of San José district, more than 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Federico has been raising livestock for more than twenty years.  He raises his livestock in Gallito, in San José district.  He has some cows whose milk he sells every day to his neighbors.  He feeds the rest of his cattle until they reach a good level of development and then sells them to traders in the area.  Through these businesses, Federico gets his family ahead in life and covers his daily expenses.

Federico would like to acquire balanced animal feed for his cattle and maintain his alfalfa crop that will serve as future feed for his cattle.  With good feed, his animals will be able to produce more milk and this will allow him to make more profit.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Federico is a father who is always looking out for his family's well-being and development.  His biggest wish is to own his own cow shed.

loans.use: To acquire balanced animal feed for his cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to have his car refitted

loans.name: Wilberforce

texts.en:
S. is 31 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  He is married and has two children.  Both of his children are currently in school.  Wilberforce has a business selling spare parts, which he has had for eight years.         

To help expand his business, Wilberforce has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more spare parts for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Wilberforce hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, Wilberforce hopes to build a house of his own.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Chourb

texts.en: Chourb R. is married and resides with his wife in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Chourb is a farmer, earning an income of USD 5 per day. His wife is employed at the facotry, earning an income of USD 3 per day.  Each month, the family has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 50 on the other necessary expenses. Chourb is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase rice to stock for sale. In the future, he would like to use the additional income to repair his house. This will be his second loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy rice to stock for sale

loans.name: Chynar's Group

texts.en:
Chynar S., 40, leads this group. She resides in Tokmok and works as a cook, while her husband is an assistant machine operator in a local plant. After work, Chynar finds the time and enthusiasm to cope with the household chores, including taking care of livestock that the family has owned for three years. Since then, the livestock number has grown rapidly and Chynar plans to add more by using the loan from Kiva. The monthly income of 2000 soms and future profits will help her repay the loan in a timely fashion.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Evaristo

texts.es:
El señor Evaristo N. vive en union libre y tiene tres hijos que dependen de el, viven en el barrio Mongollano de la ciudad de San Lorenzo. 
Evaristo tiene un negocio de venta de repuestos y accesorios para bicicletas, tambien propietario de un negocio de venta de golosinas que es atendido por su esposa.
En dicho negocio tiene un taller en donde tambien repara las bicicletas a las personas que necesitan de dicho servicio, tiene un empleado que repara y Evaristo se encarga de atender la venta de los repuestos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de repuestos para surtir su negocio.
Su mayor sueño es que su taller sea el mejor de la zona y llegar a vender bicicletas de buena calidad.
texts.en: Mr. Evaristo N. lives with his partner and their three dependent sons.  They live in the Mongollano neighborhood in the city of San Lorenzo.  Evaristo has a business selling bicycle parts and accessories.  He also owns a business selling sweets that is run by his wife.  In his business he has a repair shop for bicycles.  He has an employee who repairs bicycles and he works selling the parts.  He will use the loan to buy parts to stock his business.   His greatest dream is that his shop be the best in the area and that he will start selling high-quality bicycles.

loans.use: buy bicycle parts, tires, pumps, rims, brakes, brake cables, seats, handle bars, patches, glue, pedals, clamps

loans.name: Leh We Pray Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very please to present to you members of the “Leh We Pray” group. They are small scale businesswomen, based in Makeni city.
