They are requesting for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each, to enable them to further improve upon the size and quality of their respective businesses.

Pictured, on the right, is Zainab K.. She is the leader of this group. Zainab was born in Makeni. She is married to a carpenter and the couple has 3 children – 2 in secondary school and the other is not yet of school going age.

Zainab sells rice, oil, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), etc. She has been doing this business for 18 years now. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy the above mentioned items in large quantities, to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, margi, etc. in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu is 31 years old and lives in West Point. She’s a school dropout, of only grade 6. She has 2 children, one of whom attends school.


Musu has been selling used clothes for the past 4 years and she enjoys it a lot. She’s requesting a loan to buy 2 cartons of use clothes for her business. She plans and hopes to be a successful business woman in the near future.

loans.use: to buy 2 cartons of use clothes for her business.

loans.name: Yermandé Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité a été créé  le 31 mai 2010.IL est composé de 25 femmes membres issus du même quartier.
Elles ont pour activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Adia Christine est responsable du groupement, elle est âgée de 35 ans et s'occupe de ses trois enfants.
Elle a pour activité principale le petit commerce de tissus et des effets de toilettes.En plus elle travaille comme femme de ménage pour accroitre ses revenus.

La couture constituait son activité antérieure,domaine dans lequel elle possédait une courte expérience.

Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter des tissus et des articles de toilettes en quantité suffisante pour majorer son chiffre d'affaire.

Son objectif est d'acquérir une maison et soutenir ses enfants dans leurs études.
texts.en:
The Yermandé solidarity group was created 31 May 2010. It consists of 25 members from the same neighborhood.
Their main activity is small retail business.

Mrs. Christine A... is responsible for the group. She is 35 years old and takes cares of her three children.
Her main activity is small trade of clothing fabrics and toiletries, in addition to which she works as a housekeeper to increase her income.

Sewing was her previous activity, an area where she gained some experience.

Her loan will allow her to buy fabrics and toiletries in sufficient quantities to increase her turnover.

Her objective is to acquire a home and to support her children in their studies.

loans.use: to buy toiletries

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. For the past five years, Richard has owned a meat shop where he sells pork and beef. 

Richard is a new member of HSPFI.  He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy pigs to butcher and sell. In the future, Richard hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy pigs to butcher and sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel, a 27-year-old single man, has operated a motorbike transport business for the past three years to earn a living. He also farms to supplement his income. Daniel's dream is to own a van for his transport business in the future.

Grateful to Faulu Kenya for empowering him financially, he is now requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to open a retail shop.

loans.name: Andrea Priscila

texts.es:
La Señorita. Andrea es socia del banco comunal Divino Niño Jesús, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió pero su gente tiene un corazón muy cálido, fue nombrada como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad en 1999 por su belleza arquitectónica.
 
La Señorita Andrea tiene 22 años de edad, vive con sus padres quienes se dedican al comercio.

Nuestra socia siguiendo el ejemplo de sus padres también es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa, labora en esto 2 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.
 
Se encuentra en su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de pantalones, blusas, camisas y ropa de niños para surtir más su negocio.

Su meta es crecer en el negocio.
texts.en:
Srta. Andrea is a member of the Communal Bank “Divino Niño Jesús”. She lives in the city of Cuenca, which is known for its cold climate and the warm hearts of its people. Cuenca was named a World Heritage Site in 1999 because of its architectural beauty.

Srta. Andrea is 22 years old. She lives with her parents who are merchants. Andrea followed in the example of her parents and also works as a merchant. She has been selling all types of clothes for two years. Andrea works Sunday through Sunday, but not on an established schedule.

She is taking out her fourth loan with the Communal Bank. Andrea will invest in the purchase of trousers, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing so that she can restock her business with more merchandise. Her goal is to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase trousers, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Brenda Patricia

texts.es:
Brenda, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 8 y 6 años de edad, ella tiene un negocio en el que vende cinchos, lámparas, bolsas plásticas, calzado entre otra mercadería, este negocio lo inicio hace muchos años y su madre fue quien le enseño el comercio, su horario de venta es de 7:00am a 3:00pm.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería, para surtir el negocio, comprara calzado, cinchos, controles de televisores, lámparas de mano y más artículos que le hacen falta, esta compra contribuirá para que su negocio cuente con todo lo necesario para atender  a la clientela.
Su objetivo con el préstamo es surtir el negocio, esperando ganar mejores ingresos por sus ventas, además de estar con su familia.
texts.en:
Brenda lives with her husband and 2 children, aged 8 and 6 respectively. She has a business selling belts, lamps, plastic bags, and shoes, among other merchandise. She initiated the business many years ago after her mother taught her commerce. Her daily hours of sale are from 7:00 am until 3:00 pm.

Brenda is soliciting a loan to buy merchandise to resupply her business. She will buy shoes, belts, TV controls, flashlights, and other articles she currently lacks. This purchase will help provide her business with everything she needs to attend to her customers.

Brenda's objectives are to restock her business, hoping to earn better income from sales, in addition to being with her family more.

loans.use: to buy shoes, belts, TV controls, flashlights, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Ana Daysi

texts.es: Ana Daysi D. treinta y cuatro años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y sus hijos, en una zona D. mucho trafico D. personas. Ella tiene una venta D. comida rápida, tortas, tacos, hamburguesas, emparedados, entre otros. Todos con un sabor inigualable, su comedor  es muy conocido en la zona pues es higiénico con comida D. calidad y a precios accesibles; Ana está llena D. ilusiones, para ella trabajar por sus sueños es lo que hace su vida más interesante, quiere ver crecer su negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, carnes, verduras, bebidas, embutidos entre otros. Ana Daysi tiene fe que con su esfuerzo podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Ana Daysi is thirty four years old. She lives with her life's companion and their children in a highly trafficked area. She sells fast food such as sandwiches, tacos, hamburgers, cakes and more. All of them are unsurpassed and her restaurant is well known in the area for being clean and having accessible prices. Ana has a lot of dreams. For her, working for her dreams is what makes life interesting. She wants to see her business grow and that is why she asked INTEGRAL for a loan. This will allow her to buy basic grains, meat, vegetables, beverages and cold cuts, among others. Ana Daysi has faith that with hard work she will be able to give her family a full life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meats, vegetables, beverages and cold cuts.

loans.name: Zilola

texts.ru: Зилола жительница города Турсунзаде. Ей 34 года. Она замужем. Ее муж занимается торговлей на рынке. Он в основном продает мужскую одежду. Сама Зилола занимается посевом злаковых культур. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже шесть лет. Кредит берет для покупки минеральных удобрений, чтобы получить хороший урожай.
texts.en: Zilola lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.  She is 34 years old, married.  Her husband is involved in sales at a market.  He primarily sells men's clothing.  Zilola is involved in sowing cereal crops.  She has been in this business for six years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers in order to get a good harvest.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Furaha Group

texts.en:
Joyce is the facilitator for Furaha Group in Chwele. Joyce lives with her husband Mourice and four children. Joyce joined One Acre Fund in 2010 in order to make more profits from her maize harvests.  

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important farming inputs to distribute to Joyce and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

In 2011, Joyce harvested 8 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land, a very good harvest by her measure.  Before joining One Acre Fund, Joyce was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1/2 acre.

With the proceeds from her maize harvest, Joyce will pay for school fees, home improvements, save for the future, invest in livestock, and possibly invest in other business ventures.

In 2012, Furaha Group will plant 8.5 acres of land, with each farmer planting between .5 and 1.5 acres.

In the picture above, Joyce and her co-group members are holding young livestock (goats and one rabbit), while also showing off cobs from the recent harvest. The Furaha field officer is on the far left.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 28 years old and lives in the Kakata town. She is single and has three children aged 1 to12, all of whom live at home and are presently in school. 

For the past three years Cecelia has been involved in the sales of ladies clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase more blouses and skirts for her business. The problem she’s faced is the rainy season. 

She started this business by helping her mother to sell. She makes a lot of profit, and she has more customers every day. It makes her proud to have money in her home every day. Cecelia hopes to build her own shop,

loans.use: to purchase more blouses and skirts for her business.

loans.name: Senanmi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SENANMI est composé de trois personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier au Bénin. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Senan Léa  est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Senan Léa  est âgée de 24 ans et vit au Bénin. Senan Léa est marié à  un conducteur du nom de Etienne. Le couple a un  enfant scolarisé et à leur charge. Les différentes charges de la maison sont assurées par Senan Léa  et son mari. Senan Léa a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de son enfant, Senan Léa  a appris le métier de coiffure. Senan Léa  exerce cette activité passionnément depuis quatre ans environs. A côté de cette activité qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Senan Léa  vend des produits cosmétiques et des mêches. Senan Léa s’approvisionne en produits cosmétiques et en mêches dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu Senan Léa sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SENANMI, un premier crédit.
texts.en:
The group SENANMI is composed of three persons who lives in the same district in Benin. This is the first time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé in order to boost their business. The group's representative, by the name of Senan Léa, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 24 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a driver by the name of Etienne. They have one child in school and in their care. The different household expenses are covered by Senan Léa and her husband. 

To provide for herself and her child, Senan Léa learned the trade of hairdressing. She has been operating her business with passion for about four years. Aside from this business, which enables her to support herself and her family, she sells cosmetics and hair extensions at a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Senan Léa and the other members of the group SENANMI are requesting an initial loan.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and cosmetics

loans.name: Paris Group

texts.es:
El grupo París lo conformaran tres personas trabajadoras  y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora María José de 22 años quien se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 4 años. Ella está casada, su esposo tiene una pequeña panadería familiar y tiene un niño de 3 años y espera su segundo hijo.
Ella invertirá el crédito en ropa.
Las otras integrantes son Vilgensa de 37 años quien tiene una comideria e Ileana Patricia tiene una pulpería hace un año.
texts.en:
The "Paris" group is made up of three hard-working and enterprising people. One of them is María José, who is 22, and has been selling clothing for four years. She is married, has a three year-old son, and is expecting her second child. Her husband has a small family bakery. She will use the loan to buy clothing. 

The other members are Vilgensa who is 37, and has an eatery, and Ileana Patricia who has had a small general store for a year.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for merchandise

loans.name: Duo Guiados Por Dios Group

texts.es: Duo Guiado por Dio. Este duo esta integrado por doña Brenda de 20 años,ella se dedica a la venta de ropa variada para dama,caballero y niño.desde hace 1 años ella nos cuenta que en tan poco tiempo ella a visto un crecimiento en su negocio, y se siente muy contenta, y por eso se dirije a fape y Kiva solicitando apoyo para compra de ropa nueva variada, y nuevos diceños, al igual que la siguiente socia tambien se dedica al negocio de venta de productos de concumo diariom,y por la misma razon esta solicitando este credito,el sueño de ellas es tener un local mas grande y tener variedades como estilo en ropa para la venta.
texts.en:
One member of Duo Guiado por Dio is Brenda, 20, who sells clothing for men, women and children. She has been doing this for one year and tells us that in such a short time she has seen growth in her business and is very happy. For that reason she came to Kiva asking for support to buy new assorted clothing and new designs. 

Her loan partner sells basic goods and is asking for a loan to buy new merchandise. Their dreams are to have a larger store and to have greater varieties of clothing styles to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra has five children. All of them are enrolled in local school and getting their education except the eldest one who is 15 years old.

Her husband is a driver by profession and is the only breadwinner in family. He also runs a business of selling animals. He buys goats and sheep in their early age, raises them and sells to butchers for profit.

Bushra is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She also provides full support to her husband in operating his animal selling business. In his absence she takes care of the animals and gives them food.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s animal selling business. With the loan investment he will purchase goats and sheep to sell for profits after raising them.

He has been operating his business for the past two years and Bushra is very confident that an investment will be productive for him and will increase his income.

She is a new loan applicant of Asasah.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep to raise.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El Comité D. Mujeres D. nombre Mujeres Unidas forma parte D. la fundación desD. el año 2007, está integrado por  20  mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 6º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa D. mujeres emprendedoras D. la fundación. Es un grupo que se destaca por trabajo en conjunto y solidario que realizan. 
Una D. las señoras es Olga, quien se dedica a la venta D. bebidas, negocio gracias al cual pueD. sacar adelante a su familia y ayudar en los gastos D. la casa. Ella comenta que tiene buena venta, en especial los fines D. semana, que es cuando la mayoría D. las personas no trabaja y está libre. 
Debido a que le va muy bien, ella quiere seguir invirtiendo en du negocio, y es por eso que piD. el crédito para la compra D. cervezas, vinos, licores y demás bebidas con lo cual podrá cumplir con la demanda D. sus clientes, además ya se acercan las fiestas D. fin D. año y quiere estar preparada.
texts.en:
The committee of women, called Mujeres Unidas, or “United Women” has been part of the foundation since 2007. The committee is composed of 20 women who are working very happily. They are already in their 6th loan cycle. They work together and in solidarity within the foundation’s program for women entrepreneurs. The group stands out for working together and cooperatively. 
 
One of the women is Olga, who sells drinks. Her business allows her to help her family get ahead and contribute to the household expenses. She says that she has good sales, especially on the weekends, which is when most people don’t work and are free. 

Since it’s going really well, she wants to continue investing in the business, which is why she is requesting the loan to purchase beers, wines, liquors, and other drinks, which she will use to meet the demands of her customers. Additionally, the end of the year parties are coming up and she wants to be ready.

loans.use: purchase beer, wine, liquor, and other drinks

loans.name: Mankanay

texts.ru: Манканай 54 года, замужем, воспитала двоих детей.  Манканай  во время Союза работала дояркой в колхозе,  а ее муж – комбайнером. После развала советской системы колхозов, Манканай с мужем решили заняться откормом и перепродажей скота.  Начатое еще в 1995 году с суммы в 20,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство сегодня приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных  и мясных продуктов. Также, на собственной земельной доле Манканай выращивает кормовые сельхозкультуры для животных, что позволяет ей экономить на  закупе корма для скота. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Манканай обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 125,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительного скота. Доходы от кредита Манканай планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Mankanay is 54 years old, married, and has raised two children. During the Soviet times, Mankanay milked cows at a collective farm, while her husband operated a combine harvester. After collective farms ceased to exist, Mankanay and her husband decided to start their own farm, raising and selling animals. They started out in 1995, with 20,000 KGS, and today their farm brings in 10,000 KGS per month from sales of dairy and meat. Also, Mankanay grows various crops for the animals on her own land, allowing her to save money on feed. With the goal of increasing the number of heads of cattle on her farm, Mankanay has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 125,000 KGS, to purchase additional animals. Income from the loan will be used to expand her farm.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Leon

texts.en:
Leon is a man with patience for and dedication to his work. He is 43 years old and is married with four industrious children. He is engaged in a farming business, where he plants rice as a source of income. He earned 10,000 pesos last crop and wishes to gain higher-than-usual income.

With the intent of improving his income, Leon is asking for a loan of 18,000 pesos to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm. He hopes that he can produce an abundant harvest to provide for the needs of his family, and in the future he could see all his children finishing their studies.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Renato

texts.es: Renato, de 26 años es un hijo ejemplar. Vive en compañía de sus 3 hermanos, quienes estudian. Ellos viven en casa de su padre ubicada en la localidad de Pampas. Gracias a su esfuerzo, pudo comprar su propio motocarro, con lo que realiza trasporte público a diferentes lugares de la ciudad. Desde hace 20 años viene trabajando en la empresa de trasportes “turismo Tayacaja”. Cuenta que en obtiene de ganancias mínimas semanales un promedio de 200 nuevos soles, a la semana. Pero días festivos y de celebraciones del pueblo, obtiene mejores ganancias. Asimismo los fines de semana, viaja a su pueblo a cuidar de sus cultivos de maíz y papa, los cuales siembra en terrenos que le heredaron sus padres. En época de cosecha, viaja ala ciudad de Huancayo a comercializar sus alimentos y así obtener mejores ganancias. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “santa rosa del estanque” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anterior crédito. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Renato, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales y guano de islas; para esparcir entre sus cultivos de maíz.
texts.en: Renato, 26 is an exemplary son. He lives with his 3 brothers, who are studying. They live in their father's house located in the town of Pampas. Thanks to his efforts, he was able to buy his own trickshaw with which he transports people to different parts of the city. For the last 20 years he has been working for the transport company "Turismo Tayacaja". He says that he makes a small weekly profit of about 200 nuevos soles (PEN). However, on public holidays and when there is a festival in town he makes more profit. Similarly, at the weekends. he goes back to his town to take care of his corn and potato crop, which he plants on land his parents left him. During harvest time, he goes to the city of Huancayo to sell his products to get a better return. He belongs to the communal bank "Santa Rosa del Estanque" and this is his 3rd loan with MFP and he hopes that with your help he will be able to reach his goals. On the other hand he promises to make his repayments as with his previous loan. In addition, he likes being a part of his communal bank as all the members are responsible people and very supportive. Renato, on receiving your support, will invest the requested money in the purchase of natural fertilizers and guano from the islands to spread among his corn crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: La señora Betty tiene un hijo y vive con su esposo el cual trabaja como chofer propietario El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento de su movilidad, pues es la única actividad  de la cual obtienen ingresos  para mantener a su familia.  Betty vive en anticretico en la zona  Obispo Bosque de la ciudad de La Paz.  Es la décima segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la quinta vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Betty has a son and lives with her husband.  He works as a driver, and he has his own vehicle.

She needs the loan for maintenance of the vehicle.  It is the only business activity they have to get income to support their family.

Betty lives in “anticredtico” (Anticretico is a transaction not available in the U.S. whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you) in the Obispo Bosque zone of the city of La Paz.

This is the 12th time she has worked with IMPRO, and the fifth time she has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of the vehicle her husband drives in order to get more income to support the family.

loans.name: Humberto Gabriel

texts.en:
Humberto is 36 years old and has a shoes repair business, in this business he repair all kind of shoes from his clients and additionally has video games machines in his work place. He learned this activity from his father and he get this business approximately 10 years. Humberto needs a loan of US$ 925 to purchase raw materials that he uses in his place and also purchase an additional video game machine because a lot of child came to his place to play. He offer to pay in 6 months.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Humberto es un hombre de 36 años de edad que tiene un negocio de renovación de zapatos, es decir, ahí se hacen composturas a los zapatos de sus clientes, y adicionalmente tiene maquinas de videojuegos en su local. Él aprendió el oficio de su padre que también era zapatero y tiene con su negocio ya independiente cerca de 10 años. Humberto necesita un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 925 USD para comprar materiales que usa en su taller y adquirir una maquina adicional de videojuegos, dado que ha tenido mucha aceptación en esa zona. El plazo para pagar que solicita es de 6-12 meses.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and a video game machine to his business

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua joined the family of Kaban Support Foundation (KSF) 3 years ago and has benefited from many of its programs, including learning how best to operate her business. She sells "wakye", a special rice and beans dish that is a favorite meal for locals. A loan of $750.00 will enable her to make and sell more food and grow her business.

loans.use: Buy more ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business by renting a more spacious premise to accommodate all her clients and to purchase inventory

loans.name: Rita Maria

texts.en:
Rita is 42 years old and is married. She has 5 sons; three of them are studying and two are married. Her husband works as a waiter in a restaurant. She started her business 5 years ago because she wants to help to her husband with the family expenses. Also her husband got sick and he did not have medical insurance so his medical costs were expensive and they did not have enough money to cover it. Rita does not have any employees at her business and her sons help her in their free time. She wants to see her sons with professional studies and for this reason she works very hard.

Rita is requesting a loan of US $ 250 to purchase merchandise for her business and offers to repay this loan in 3 months. She thanks you a lot for your support to continue her business growth.

This description was translated by Admic volunteer Joanna Lindoro

Rita tiene 42 años, esta casada y tiene 5 hijos, su esposos trabaja como mesero en un restaurante y 3 de sus hijos estudian y los otros 2 están casados. Ella inicio en el negocio desde hace 5 años con el propósito de ayudar a su esposo con el pago de las colegiaturas, y las cuentas del hogar, aparte de que su esposo no tenia seguro y los gastos médicos eran muchos ya que el se enfermo en ese tiempo. Rita no tiene empleados en su negocio y sus hijos le ayudan en sus ratos libres. Ella espera algún día ver a todos sus hijos profesionales y es por ello que se esfuerza para sacarlos adelante.

Rita está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 250 para invertir en mercadería para su negocio y ofrece pagar el préstamo en 3 meses. Ella te agradece mucho el apoyo que le das para poder continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
T. Jennifer is 47 years of age, married with four children. Two of her children have completed University, one is in her second year and the last born is in senior three. She has been engaged in business for over ten years. Her first loan was USD 100 which she paid very well in four months. Her second loan was USD 225; she worked very hard and paid it in time.

She sells cosmetics in her shop and rears chicken which she sells to Makerere University and Hotel Equatoria. Jennifer’s shop is located in the heart of Kamwokya, a low-cost housing settlement area. She has a ready market for her products and this has helped her to repay her loans on time. On average, her cosmetics sales range between USD 30-40 per week. Meanwhile, she has ordered 2000 chicks from Ugachick breeders. Through her small businesses, she has managed to educate her children and looks forward to big savings after the two children finish school.

loans.use: Buy one carton of hair treatment oils, body lotions and 15 sacks of chicken feed.

loans.name: Ni Wayan Candri

texts.id:
Buy & sell cocoa seeds around is Ni Wayan Candri main profession, besides a mother of 3 children. After preparing household duties, especially needs of her 2 children to go to school, Ni Wayan Candri hurrily use her bicycle to buy chocolate seeds from citizens homes. With help and loan from Dinari, Wayan Candri could expand her business. Every day Wayan Candri could buy about 100 kg of cocoa, at a price of Rp11,500 (about US$13)/kg. After enough collected, Ni Wayan Candri would sell to a distributor at Rp12,000-13,000 (about US$13.20-14.50) depending on dryness level. daily nett profit could reach Rp50,000 (about $5.50). Ni Wayan Candri's hope is that her business could expand, so that she could fulfill family needs, and replace her bicycle to a motor cycle, since distances dhe has to cover is now farther away.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Membeli dan menjual biji Coklat ( cacao ) keliling bagi Ni Wayan Candri adalah pekerjaan utama selain sebagai ibu rumah tangga dengan 3 orang anak. Setelah selesai mempersiapkan keperluan rumah tangga terutama keperluan kedua anaknya untuk berangkat sekolah, Ni Wayan Candri bergegas mengambil sepeda gayung untuk berangkat mencari dagangan yaitu biji coklat di rumah para penduduk. Dengan pembinaan dan bantuan dana dari Yayaan DINARI Wayan Candri dapat mengembangkan usahanya menjadi lebih besar lagi. Dalam satu hari Wayan Candri dapat membeli coklat sekitar 100 kilogram dengan harga Rp.11.500,- per kilogramnya. Setelah terkumpul cukup banyak, Ni Wayan Candri akan menjualnya kembali ke pengepul dengan harga Rp.12.000,- s/d Rp. 13.000.- tergantung dari tingkat kekeringannya. Keuntungan bersih setiap harinya dapat mencapai Rp.50.000,-. Dengan pekerjaan yang ditekuni saat ini harapan Ni Wayan Candri usaha dapat berkembang sehingga dapat memenuhi kehidupan keluarganya dan dapat menganti sepeda gayungnya menjadi sepeda motor karena jarak yang ditempuhnya kini semakin jauh.

loans.use:
To increase capital

Menambah modal usaha

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en: Matluba is married and has two children. For more than two years, she has sold women's clothes from her shop in Spitamen's main market. Her husband has a car and helps her by bringing goods from their home to the shop. He also acquires new inventory from nearby wholesale markets. Matluba has done very well as a businesswoman, with quick turnover of her inventory and many regular customers. She has applied for a Kiva loan to purchase winter clothes, which she knows will be very popular and sell very quickly during the busy holiday season.

loans.use: Purchase of winter clothes to sell in busy holiday season

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: “I live in Lahore with my husband Muhammad Aslam Raza and five sons and one daughter. My son runs his own tyre shop where he fixes punctures and rents out motorcycles and bicycles. With a loan he will purchase some equipment for his store. With profits, he can purchase a bigger shop later.”

loans.use: Purchase equipment for our son's tyre shop

loans.name: Gusti Ayu Putu Merta

texts.id:
Gusti Ayu Putu Mertha and her husband, Gusti Putu Ngurah Sutawan has been married for almost 25 years, but they don't have any children until now. To spend her spare time, Gusti Ayu started her business in pig farming. All the capital of Rp 3,000,000 that she got from Dinari is used to purchase 1 female pig that cost Rp 1,000,000 and the rest is used for purchasing the pig food and raising the piglets. Now Gusti Ayu Putu Mertha has 9 piglets. She spends Rp 10,000 daily for the pig food. The pig food mixtures consist of rice and wheat chaff. When the piglets reach the age of 2 months, they can be sold for about Rp 200,000 each as the pigs that she raises are local pigs that are cheaper than the superior type of pigs. Gusti Ayu Putu Mertha really enjoys running this business because it has become her hobby and also she can earn additional income for her family.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Gusti Ayu Putu Mertha dan suaminya, Gusti Putu Ngurah Sutawan, sudah berkeluarga hampir 25 tahun. Tetapi sampai saat ini belum juga dikaruniai anak. Untuk mengisi waktu yang terluang Gusti Ayu menyibukkan diri dengan usahanya yaitu beternak induk babi. Semua modal yang dipakai didapat dari Dinari sebesar Rp. 3.000.000,-. Modal ini dipakai untuk membeli 1 induk babi yang harganya Rp. 1.000.000,- sisanya untuk pakan dan pemeliharaan anaknya. Saat ini induk Gusti Ayu Putu Mertha memiliki anak 9 ekor. Untuk biaya pakan setiap hari menghabiskan modal Rp.10.000.- Adapun campuran pakannya yaitu dedak padi dan dedak gandum. Setelah berumur kurang lebih 2 bulan, 9 ekor anak babi ini baru bisa dijual dengan perkiraan harga perekor mencapai Rp. 200.000.- karena babi yang dipelihara adalah jenis lokal jadi harganya lebih murah dari babi jenis unggul. Gusti Ayu Putu Mertha sangat senang selain sebagai saluran hobinya, juga bisa menghasilkan pendapatan bagi keluarganya.

loans.use: To purchase female pig and pig food

loans.name: Farrukh

texts.ru:
Farrukh is married and has one child. There is a lack of job opportunities where he lives. His father used to raise cattle, and now Farrukh raises cattle as well. This year, the winter was very harsh and it was difficult to take care of animals in such freezing weather. Farrukh's classmate recommended to go to MicroInvest for credit, and Farrukh bought several calves. He buys calves, takes care of them for a few months and then sells grown animals for a larger price. With his profit, Farrukh then buys more calves and the cycle is repeated. A MicroInvest loan would be very helpful to Farrukh.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Фаррух женат имеет одного ребенка. В его местности недостаточно рабочих мест. Его отец разводил скот, сейчас он занялся разведение скота. В этом году зима была очень суровая и для скотоводов в морзных условиях было очень трудно ухаживать за скотом. По совету одноклассников он обратился в Микроинвест, приобрел несколько голов скота. Он приобретает скот ухаживает за ним пару месяцев и продает по дороже, от имевшего дохода опять приобретает скот и этот цикл повторяется. Для этой поддержки ему помогла определенная сумма от Микроинвест.

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
While dreaming of seeing her house finally completed, Marisol works every day in her cosmetics store as well as in her telephone call centre. She began work as a representative selling one brand of cosmetics, but then gradually bought stock so that she always had items available. At that point she decided to move from the small general store she ran to a shop specializing in cosmetics. She worked in the general store for one year but it wasn’t profitable, and it was also a worry to have her two small children so far away from her place of work. This was the reason she changed her business. Also, six months ago, she set up a telephone centre in her shop. She plans to invest some of her earnings, and the rest she will save for any emergencies that may arise.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

Con el sueño de ver su casa construida en su totalidad Marisol trabaja a diario en su tienda de cosméticos y también en su locutorio. Ella empezó primero como consultora de una sola marca de cosméticos, poco a poco fue comprando cosméticos para tenerlos en stock, hasta que decidió cambiar la bodega que tenia por una tienda de cosméticos. Estuvo trabajando en su bodega durante un año pero no le era rentable, pues le costaba tener a sus dos hijos pequeños alejados de la mercadería. Así fue como se animó a cambiar de negocio. Por otro lado, hace medio año que implementó su tienda con el servicio de locutorio. Una parte de sus ganancias la vuelve a invertir y la otra las ahorra para cualquier emergencia que pueda surgir.

loans.use: Finish building her house and improve her store

loans.name: Yola

texts.es:
Yola is a decisive and diligent woman who with a great deal of effort has been able to implement her small but well-stocked grocery store. Thanks to her excellent service, her varied and well-priced products manage to capture more patrons each day. Yola’s wish is to make improvements to her store, with the aim of providing more comfort for her customers and better safeguarding her merchandise since she is located in a busy commercial sector in the city of Juliaca. With this project in mind, she comes seeking your assistance.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Yola, es una mujer muy decidida y diligente, con mucho empeño ha logrado implementar su pequeña pero surtida tiendita de abarrotes, que gracias a su excelente servicio, variados y económicos productos logra captar a diario un número muy grande de compradores.El deseo de Yola es ampliar su local, con el fin de brindarles comodidad a sus clientes y seguridad a sus productos, debido a que su tiendita está ubicada en un lugar de mucho movimiento comercial de la ciudad de Juliaca, con ese proyecto en mente recurre en búsqueda de vuestra ayuda.

loans.use: Increased capital to be able to offer a greater number of products.

loans.name: Gulbon

texts.ru:
Gulbon O. is a private businesswoman. She works at a local market in Tursun-Zoda selling women's shoes. She has been doing these types of things for 3 years. She plans on increasing her cash flow by investing more money. That is the reason she came to us for a loan. This will increase her combined family income, and at the same time, increase the range of items she sells at the market. She plans on repaying the loan within 12 months. Gulbon lives with her husband and 3 children.

Translated from Russian by Dan Ostrovsky, Kiva volunteer.

Орипова Гулбон частный предприниматель. Работает на рынке города Турсун-Заде. Торгует женской обувью.Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 3 года. Планирует увеличить товарооборот путем вливания новых средств. А деньги хочет получить в кредит , поэтому обратилась к нам. Это поможет улучшить семейный бюджет, а так же поможет увеличить выбор в ассортименте товара для населения. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев. Гулбон живет со свое семьей. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей

loans.use: Increase cash-flow

loans.name: Maria De Jesús

texts.es:
Maria O. lives in the Villanueva municipality in the city of Chinandega. She works very hard to be able to make improvements to her home, which has been in disrepair for a long time.

She is the mother of two children and she wishes to provide appropriate living conditions for their development. This is the reason she has come to Ceprodel to request a loan. She will use it to purchase construction materials to continue remodeling her home.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

En el municipio de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Maria O. se dedica a trabajar fuertemente con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda que por mucho tiempo se ha encontrado en mal estado en su localidad.

Ella es madre de dos hijos y con la necesidad de brindarle las condiciones de vida necesarias para su desarrollo. Por ello se apoya de Ceprodel por medio de la solicitud de un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción y así continuar con la remodelación de su casa de habitación que tanto necesita de inversión.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena A. is from Santani and is married with children. She works selling pork. She comments that she has worked in this field for 20 years. She has a small truck in which she does her buying and selling. She is very responsible with her clients. Her current desire is to fit out a store in part of her home and tend to it with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Elena A. es de Santani, tiene 69 años, es casada con hijos. Se dedica a la venta de carnes de cerdos. Comenta que desde hace 20 años trabaja en esta actividad, tiene una camioneta en que realiza su trabajo de compra y venta. Es una señora muy responsable con sus clientes, su anhelo es habilitar una despesa en su domicilio y atender ella con sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock (pigs)

loans.name: Theddy

texts.en: Theddy P. M. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur woman She is a married with five children. She has run a shop for five years now at the airport area in Dar-es Salaam. She sells a variety of items, including wheat flour, maize flour, beans and rice. Income from the business is used to feed the family and for paying school fees for her children. She requests a loan of $750 to help the business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam J. is 27 years old. She is a widow with two children, aged 7 and 4. She has been selling clothes and shoes since 2006. Every day, she works from 8 am to 6 pm at her business, and she can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Maryam is now seeking a loan to buy more clothes and shoes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and clothes for resale in order to improve her business

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with two grown daughters. She lives in Melitopol and owns a small business in the central city market. A skilled entrepreneur and married mother, Tatyana is dedicated to the growth and the success of her business. For the past six years, she has sold sportswear and footwear in the central market of Melitopol, Ukraine. The blend of an ideal location and skillful product presentation make Tatyana's vending kiosk a point of attraction in the Melitopol market. Her kindness, skill, and outgoing personality have helped her to develop a strong client base. With a strong character and desire to see business growth, Tatyana has maintained a perfect credit history with Nadiya Ukraine for the last 5 years. 

Currently, Tatyana has $2,000 in inventory. Her turnover capital is about $800. Her monthly net profit is about $400. Today Tatyana is requesting a loan of 3,000 Grivnas to increase her inventory. With the additional income from profits, Tatyana hopes to continue improving her family's standard of living. Moreover, profit generated by her business will give Tatyana a chance to pay for her youngest daughter's education at one of the local colleges.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Xiomara Del Carmen

texts.es: La Señora Xiomara  está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 5to crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda, para la construcción de una habitación, trabaja en el INSS como analista de prestaciones desde hace 14 años, tiene 2 hijos: el mayor de 9 años estudia su 2do grado de Educación primaria y el menor de 2 añitos de edad; Xiomara es madre soltera y asume el rol de madre y padre para sus hijos, es una profesional muy responsable, honesta, con alto espiritud de superación personal y laboral,  que ama su trabajo, ademas es muy trabajadora y lucha para que a sus hijos no le falte lo basico en el hogar.  Vive en la zona urbana de Nueva Guinea en la zona # 8, este barrio recientemente se poblo y cada día se va aumentando su población, el mayor sueño de Xiomara  es estudiar el proximo año una maestría,  tener estabilidad, salud  y una vivienda  bonita para así pasarse a vivir en su nueva casa,  se siente agradecida con AFODENIC, ya que con los créditos anteriores logro construir poco a poco su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Xiomara is seeking refinancing of a 5th loan so she can invest in improvements to her home by adding a room. She has worked for INSS as a benefits analyst for 14 years. She has two children: the oldest is 9 and in the 2nd grade of elementary school; the youngest is 2-years-old. Xiomara is a single mother and assumes the role of mother and father to her children. She is a very responsible and honest professional, and has a strong desire for self-improvement, both personally and professionally. She loves her work, is very hard-working and strives to see that her children lack for none of the essentials in their home. She lives in the urban area of New Guinea, in Zone #8, a new neighborhood whose population grows daily. Xiomara’s greatest dream is to study next year for her master’s degree, have stability, health, a nice home, and to begin living in her new house. She feels very appreciative of AFODENIC, since with prior loans she has succeeded in building her home little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of 1 home

loans.name: Nancy Adelaida

texts.es:
Nancy es soltera, tiene 27 años de edad, estudió el quinto año de secundaria y vive en el Jr. Lima s/n, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno.

Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Progreso de Juli”. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 compró bayetas y lana. Desde muy pequeña aprendió a bordar, lo cual le ayudó a tener un capital y así poder vender su artesanía en Puno. 

Con este préstamo de S/.500, el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, comprará 2kg. de lana y 20 metros de bayeta.

Su sueño es tener más mercadería y un puesto seguro donde vender su artesanía.
texts.en:
Nancy is single and she is 27 years old. She studied until the fifth year of secondary school and she lives in Lima, district of Juli, of the province of Chuchito, in the department Puno. She is a founder partner of Communal Bank " Mujeres al Progreso de Juli ". With the first loan of $100, she bought baize and wool. She learned to embroider from a very early age, which helped her to have a small capital and be able to sell her crafts in Puno. With this loan of $175, which will be repaid over a period of 4 months, she will buy 2 kg of wool and 20 meters of baize. Her dream is to have more merchandise and a stable place where to sell her crafts.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 2 kg. of wool and 20 mts of baize.

loans.name: Yvette

texts.fr: Dame B. Yvette, est née le 13 Janvier 1977 à Cotonou. Originaire de Porto-Novo, capitle politique du BENIN. Elle fréquenta jusqu'en classe de de CM2 avant d'abandonner. Elle alla ensuite en apprentissage de couture pour 5 ans. Elle reçût son diplôme de fin de formation et exerce son métier jusqu'à ce jour. Parrallèlement, elle vend de divers articles: les conserves, farine de manioc, cuire dent artisanal. Elle sollicite ce 3ème prêt pour renforcer son activité. Elle compte s'approvisionner en farine de manioc, cuire dent artisanal, galettes. Mariée à LOKOSSOU Janvier, elle a 4 enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yvette B. was born January 13, 1977, in Cotonou. She is originally from Porto-Novo, the political capital of Benin. She went to school until the 5th grade, when she left school. She then went to train in dressmaking for 5 years. She received her certificate of completion and has been practicing this occupation until now. At the same time, she sells miscellaneous items: canned foods, cassava root flour, traditional toothpicks. She seeks this third loan to grow her business. She plans to stock up on cassava root flour, traditional toothpicks, cakes. She is married to Janvier Lokossou and has 4 children.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy 1 bag of cassava root flour, traditional toothpicks, 100 cakes

loans.name: Mankaa Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is married to Jonathan and they have six children. She is a very hard-working woman as far as maintaining and bringing up the family is concerned. She and her husband are committed in working together for the upkeep of the family. She has also proved her efforts in helping her husband pay the school fees for the children. She has also been able to toil and till the soil to feed the family though with some difficulties as invaders come in at times and destroy her farm produce which now makes her to work extra hard selling food and in her provision store.

Cecilia has taken loan from GHAPE four times already. This is the fifth time she wants a loan from GHAPE. She knows this business will succeed because it is a business she has been doing for a long time and so she has a lot of customers. We do eat to survive and serving the community with cooked food more souls and lives will live to survive which will help the clan to grow from strength to strength.

The profit from her loan will be used to further her children's education and also improve the living standards of her family.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community in its clients and staff and a strong bond of trust has developed between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: buying beans, corn, and transportation

loans.name: Esra

texts.en: Esra A., a widow, raised her eight children by herself,  with the help of her variety store and food vending business at school canteen. For her, it wasn't easy to survive without someone who will share her burden. Her husband died 8 years ago leaving her the great responsibility for raising the children. This served as a challenge for her to work harder. HSPFI loans greatly helped her finance and sustain her business. As of now, she needs an amount of PhP11,000 as additional capital for her variety store and her food vending business at the school canteen.

loans.use: to purchase stocks for her variety store and  food vending business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nargis M. Latif Group

texts.en:
Nargis baji is a 39-year-old married lady. She has been a citizen of a city named Lahore in Pakistan for the past 11 years. Nargis baji is married to M. L., who has driven a local, 32-seat bus for the past six years. Nargis baji is the mother of two kids: one son and one daughter. Her children do not go to school. Nargis baji has a wish to admit her kids to a school so that they are able to secure their future.

Nargis baji is a very determined lady who is working hard to achieve her wish. She sells thread by going to different shops on foot and earns some income. She successfully repaid her two loans from Kiva's partner Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy more thread to sell.

Nargis baji is the group leader of another four women from her neighborhood. Shamim akhtar baji wants a loan to buy an electric sewing machine for sewing clothes. Hina baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Abida baji wants a loan to buy vehicle spare parts to sell. Rubina kosar baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy thread to sell

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann R. is a 30-year-old mother of five. Her husband Jerry makes buko (coconut) juice which he sells in the nearby school. Mary Ann does laundry for her neighbors just to help her husband. When she heard about ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) entering their village to provide loans to mothers with dreams of putting up a business, she did not think twice before joining the organization to get capital. 

Mary Ann wants to venture into selling rice, dried fish, kerosene, and chicken. She applied for this loan to purchase the mentioned items to increase their income. She hopes to establish a successful grocery store in future and to stop doing laundry in order to take care of her children and business at home. She is positive that with her initial capital accessed through ASHI and KIVA, her dreams of sending her children to a university will be achieved.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of rice, five kilos dried fish, 2 liters kerosene, and 2 pieces of chicken

loans.name: Shavkatjon

texts.ru: Шавкатчон, молодой человек 29 лет. Женат и отец 3-х детей. Занимается откормом и продажей крупно-рогатого и мелко рогатого скота. С раннего утра до поздней ночи пасет стадо на пастбище. Жена нигде не работает. Помогает по хозяйству своей свекрови. Шавкатчон пока живет с родителями. В этом году его младший брат женится, и потом Шавкатчон отделит свое домохозяйство от отца. Но уже Шавкатчон старается прикупить для себя скот, чтоб когда его отделит отец у него было на что жить.
texts.en:
Shavkatjon, 29, is married and has 3 children. Shavkatjon is a cattle farmer. From dawn till dusk, Shavkatjon is herding cattle. His wife is a house maker. She helps he mother-in-law with household chores, as Shavkatjon and his family lives with his parents. This year, Shavkatjon's younger brother will get married. Then, Shavkatjon will separate his household from that of his father. To prepare for the separation, Shavkatjon is looking to purchase cattle for himself.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle farming and sales

loans.name: Wanu

texts.en:
Wanu has been a clothes and shoe seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 2 years. She belongs to the Kumekucha loan group (group code 2012). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $90. Each day she works at her business for 8 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes and shoes for resale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Wanu is 36 years old, married, and cares for one dependent.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes for resale

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Miss Nelly Vázquez was born in the city of Valenzuela.  She has four older brothers and sisters, one brother who is in the military and three sisters who are nurses.  She now lives in the city of Capiatá with her older sister, Raquel.  She is a businesswoman, and two years ago started a business selling clothes and accessories for women.  She does business out of her house, but also makes her sales in the interior of the country, where she has a large number of clients.  Thanks to the loan given through the Foundation, Nelly hopes to grow her business and consequently her family income.

loans.use: To purchase clothes, accessories, and other goods to sell

loans.name: Bulgantamir

texts.en: Bulgantamir B. is a single father who lives with his four children whose ages range from 9 to 18. He currently resides in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His oldest daughter is a college student and the other three children are all in high school. He drives a cab in the town. He has been doing the taxi business since 2003. His daily income has increased from 3,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT) to 8,000 MNT. He says that he is working very hard to be financially able to support all his children's education. Since all his four children go to school, the expenses for their education can be very high. Bulgantamir requests a loan to purchase new tires for his car.

loans.use: To buy new tires for his car

loans.name: Leobardo

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Leobardo C. le está haciendo falta los acabados del exterior pero en esté momento no cuanta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material que se requiere, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo y así realizar tener su casa terminada.
Don Leobardo es empleado de una maquiladora en el departamento de técnico en mantenimiento, está es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia y con el cual una parte se para pagar el crédito.
Cuando se realizo la visita al domicilio del señor Leobardo el estaba en horario de trabaja y quien nos atendió fue su esposa el señora Rosa Elva Quiroga quien es la persona de la foto.
texts.en:
Leobardo C.' house is missing the exterior finishing, but right now he doesn't have the money necessary to buy the material needed. This is the reason he seeks a loan, with which he will be able to have a finished home.

Leobardo is an employee at a "maquiladora" (an assembly plant) in the technical maintenance department. This is the source of income that he has for his family and with which he will be able to pay back the loan.

When we made this visit to the home of Leobardo, it was during the work day, so his wife, Rosa Elva Quiroga, let us in. She is the person in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finishing the exterior of his home

loans.name: Sek

texts.en:
Sek P., 25, has been raising pigs for sale in her village in Siem Reap Province since 2003. She earns a typical income of $3 USD per day. P. is married and lives with her husband, who also raises pigs. With his other jobs, he is able to generate $5 USD per day typically. They are blessed with two young children who do not yet attend school.

Traditional Cambodian agricultural methods require hard work and a long time investment to produce the best output and a competitive price at market. P. wants to take a loan of $200 USD for the first time from Kiva partner, CREDIT, to purchase more pigs to raise for sale. She wants to save her income for her children’s education and expanding her current business.

loans.use: To buy more pigs

loans.name: Maria Clariza

texts.es:
La socia se llama Clariza, ella es natural de Cusco y vive actualmente en la av. Ucchullo grande Q-18, a 15 minutos de la misma ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 38 años de edad y tiene 2 hijos ella no es casada pero convive con su pareja actual, la socia es docente en la comunidad de Pucyura en el distrito de Anta.  Nuestra socia desea invertir su dinerito en la compra de algunos electrodomésticos en su hogar, ella cubrirá su s cuotas con el pago mensual de su trabajo como docente.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido
texts.en:
Clariza is a native of Cusco, and currently lives 15 minutes outside of that city. Clariza is 38 years old and has 2 children. She is not married but lives with her current partner. She is a teacher in the Pucyura community in the Anta district. She wishes to invest her small loan in the purchase of appliances for her home.She will make her loan payments with the monthly salary she earns in her work as a teacher. Clariza appreciates and values the loan made to her and she commits to make her repayments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in small home appliances

loans.name: Salohidin

texts.en:
B. Salohidin lives in the town of Panj with his wife and 5 children. He has worked in agriculture for 11 years, and in that time has gained much experience and a love for the land. He began cultivating his land through his own efforts and has gradually gotten ahead in life. Salohidin’s wife is a vendor and helps support the family. Salohidin would like to use this loan to buy supplies for the harvest and for improving production, and thus increase the quality of his yield along with his earnings at the time of sale.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela tiene 54 años, es soltera, tiene 4 hijos; los 3 mayores ya trabajan y sólo tiene bajo su responsabilidad a su hija menor de 10 años. Todos habitan juntos en su casa propia. Desde hace 23 años se dedica a la venta de frutas y chupetes de fruta en su domicilio. Las frutas que generalmente ofrece son: sandias, naranjas y plátanos, además vende cerca de 250 chupetes de fruta y hielo diarios. Anteriormente, Graciela vendía estos productos en un mercado, pero a causa de una enfermedad tuvo que dejar su puesto, pero una vez repuesta inició su negocio en su casa, de lo que no se arrepiente, pues también obtiene buenas ganancias, debido a que su casa se encuentra ubicada en una zona muy transitada de su ciudad y cuando le sobran algunos productos los acomoda en una bandeja y los vende de forma ambulante. Graciela quiere para el futuro tener una tienda de comestibles donde pueda vender más cómodamente.
Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, a ella le agrada mucho su banco comunal porque sus compañeros son personas buenas y trabajan en unión para el progreso de todo el grupo. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más frutas y también materiales de construcción para seguir mejorando la estructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Graciela is 54 and single. She has four children. The three oldest now work. Her ten year old daughter is the only one she is still responsible for. They all live together in their own house. For 23 years she has been selling fruits and fruit popsicles in her house. The fruits that she generally sells are watermelon, oranges, and bananas. Also, she sells close to 250 fruit popsicles a day. Previously, Graciela sold these products in a market. Due to an illness, she had to leave her stall. Once she was better, she started her business in her house. She does not regret it. She gets good earnings due to the fact that her house is located in a very busy part of the city. When there are left over products, she puts them on a tray and sells them on the street. In the future Graciela would like to have a grocery store where she could sell more comfortably. This is her second loan with MFP. She really likes her communal bank because her colleagues are good people, and they work together for progress for the whole group. She will use the money she is asking for to buy more fruit. She will also buy construction materials to keep improving the structure of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en:
Inocencia M. is from the village of Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years-old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, she runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Inocencia has run her business for almost two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Inocencia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Inocencia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product range. Inocencia is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP to expand her range further. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Inocencia from HSPFI.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product range

loans.name: Mrs. Srey Mom Koy Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eight people who are all living in Kdei Tnaot village in Takeo province make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Srey Mom K. is a village bank loan group president who has been selected by the members. They will all use the loan for different purposes. Srey is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Mom Thearen, is an electrician. Mrs. Srey Mom K. is requesting this loan to buy 150 chickens and chicken feed for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living with this loan. She is 23 years old and the mother of a child who is still too young to work or study. 

All the members in this group loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Is requesting a loan to buy 150 chickens and chicken food for breeding.

loans.name: Mrs. Khorn Roth Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Khorn R. is the group leader of four members who all live in Niel village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Since her pig-breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets and pig food for breeding.

Mrs. Khorn R. is 56 years old and the mother of four children. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory, another is a car repairer, and the remaining one is attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Siem Nim, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and pig food for breeding

loans.name: Nhor

texts.en:
Nhor C. lives in Krang Touch village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land for cultivating rice. His wife, Suth Phun, is a duck breeder. Since her poultry business is going well, she wants to expand it. 

Nhor C. decided to ask for a loan to buy 1,500 ducklings for breeding. He hopes to increase their income and improve the family's standard of living with this loan. He is 38 years old and the father of five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the others are attending to local school. His wife is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy ducklings for breeding

loans.name: Nialing

texts.fr: Nialing B. est une femme de 38 ans, elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 8 ans, elle est très expérimentée en matière de crédit. Elle développe un petit commerce de thé, de sucre, d'huile, etc. Ce prêt lui servira à renforcer son activé et générer des ressources qui lui permettront de prendre en charge sa famille.
texts.en:
Nialing B., aged 38, is married and the mother of three children. She has been a member of a village bank for eight years and is very experienced in the credit process. She runs a small business selling tea, sugar, oil, etc. This loan will enable her to bolster her activity and generate a profit which she will use to provide for her family.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop her commercial activity

loans.name: Hoàng's Group

texts.en:
L. Hoàng Thị B. (10110040037) is a 44-year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh - Hà nội.  L. is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Lộc Hà (4).


L. is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, L. operates a family member's business venture running a general store where she sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community.  L. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3.500.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  L. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2.436.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5.014.000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị K. O. (10110040039) is a 31-year-old female who is requesting a 4.578.000 VND loan to support her clothing business.


2.  Ngô Thị C. (10110040041) is a 40-year-old female who is requesting a 1.962.000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business.


3.  Nguyễn Thị H. (10110040040) is a 40-year-old female who is requesting a 4.578.000 VND loan to support her service-based business.


4.  Đồng Thị H. (10110040038) is a 44-year-old female who is requesting a 4.578.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


L. Hoàng Thị B.  (10110040037) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà nội.  L. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Lộc Hà (4).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh dO. chủ yếu từ buôn bán các mặt hàng nhu yếu phẩm như dầu gội đầu, xà bông & kem đánh răng trong cộng đồng địa phương.  L. thực hiện công việc kinh dO. này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, L. kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND.  Vào 2008, L. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh dO. của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  L. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 2.436.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.014.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị K. O. (10110040039) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.578.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là vận hành công việc kinh dO. quần áo.


2.  Ngô Thị C. (10110040041) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.962.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là vận hành công việc kinh dO. sản xuất.


3.  Nguyễn Thị H. (10110040040) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.578.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là vận hành công việc kinh dO. trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


4.  Đồng Thị H. (10110040038) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.578.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực nông ngH..  Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các DO. NgH. Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Etamislada Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo, la señora Etamislada se destaca por elaborar unos deliciosos nacatamales que son una de las comidas típicas de Nicaragua y son realizados por ella misma y vendidos en su establecimiento siendo visitada por muchos clientes los que compran sus nacatamales.

Ella actualmente está solicitando un crédito con el fin de comprar la materia prima como lo es la compra de maíz, hojas de chagüite, arroz, cebollas, chiltomas, tomates, carne, entre otros. Espera que su crédito sea otorgado sin problemas y así proceder a su venta.
texts.en:
At the Mercado Mayoreo [Wholesale Market], Etamislada is known for making delicious nacatamales, a traditional Nicaraguan dish. She makes them herself and sells them at her market stall, where many customers stop by to buy her nacatamales. Etamislada is seeking a loan to buy ingredients, such as corn, banana leaves, rice, onions, peppers, tomatoes, meat, and others. She hopes her loan will be granted without problems so she can continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for nacatamales

loans.name: Kisowera Group, Mukono

texts.en:
N. Christine is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is a hard-working and devoted lady with a butcher shop in Kisowera. Christine sells raw pork meat by the kilogram, as well as roasted pork, to her customers especially in the afternoons and evenings. She is able to make 100,000/ UGX per week. 

For five years, her business has been running smoothly but lacked enough capital, and loans have helped this. Christine now needs a loan to buy two pigs that will be sold for meat at her shop.

loans.use: Buying two pigs for meat for her butcher shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi L. is 34 and married with 2 children.  She owns a business venture, selling pancakes (fried flour pancakes flavored with lemon or coconut jam).  Naomi has 2 years of experience in this business.  Naomi needs a loan of WST $1500 to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Naomi joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Naomi's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Naomi L. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                         1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            1.8 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags

loans.name: Margarida Gonçalves

texts.pt:
Margarida Gonçalves D.
