V. nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 25 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 3 filhos de 10, 7 e 1 anos de idade, os dois mais velhos vão a escola. Fez somente 8ą classe não continuou deviD. a gravidez precoce. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu de Namaacha para Boane com os pais ainda muito nova, mais tarde depois de se juntar com o mariD. decidiram ter sua própria residência. Tem um negocio próprio há mais de 2 anos em Boane, não possui nenhum empregaD. tem ajuda D. seu esposo que também é electrecista-auto nas bombas de combustível da Petromoc. Mensalmente consegue um rendimento de cerca de 4.000.00mt e com ajuda D. mariD. nas despesas de casa ela consegue poupar algum valor na sua conta bancária D. Millinium Bim.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de sua mãe que também desenvolve a mesma actividade e é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, barrotes, areia, chapas de zinco e outros) para continuar com a construção da sua residência. O empréstimo anterior foi de 9.250.00mt foi para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo afim de poder aceder a outros. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais crédito para continuar a aplicar na construção da sua residência.
texts.en:
Margarida Gonçalves D. V. was born in the district of Namaacha, Maputo province, in southern Mozambique. She is 25 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children who are 10, 7, and 1 years old. The two oldest go to school. She only finished the 8th grade; she was not able to continue on due to an early pregnancy. She lives in her own home with her family and does not support anybody else. She left Namaacha for Boane with her parents when she was very young. Later on, she married her husband and they decided to get their own place. She has had her own business in Boane for more than 2 years. She doesn't have any employees but her husband, who is an automotive electrician at a Petromoc service station, helps her out. She earns about 4,000 MZN monthly, and with her husband's help with household expenses, is able to save some in her Millennium Bim bank account. She has not had loans with other banks. She found out about Hluvuku through her mother, who works in the same area and is also a client of the institution. This is Margarida's second loan, which has a value of 15,000 MZN. She plans to use it to buy construction materials (cement, support beams, sand, zinc plates, etc.) in order to continue building her house. The previous loan was for 9,250 MZN, for the same purpose. She promises to pay back the loan in a timely manner in order to be able to have access to others. In the future, she would like to request more loans in order to continue with the construction of her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials (support beams, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of peanuts and other products

loans.name: Fight For Poor Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are petty businesswomen from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They named their group “Fight For Poor Group”. They have applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each person in the group from Kiva lenders through SMT. With the help of this loan, they can add more goods to their businesses, attract many more customers, make more sales and better profit, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Hawa K. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Hawa is a 45-year-old. She is married and has four children. One of her children is in secondary school and the others are married and living on their own. For five years now, Hawa has been selling foofoo (food made out of cassava roots), biscuits, mints, etc. Hawa will use her share of the loan to buy foofoo, biscuits, mints, etc. wholesale.

loans.use: Buy foofoo, biscuits, mints, etc. wholesale

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Mr. Meas P., age 28, is a fisherman who lives in the village of Peam Ta Aek in Kandal province. His wife is a grocery seller. Between the two of their businesses, they earn a small income to support their family. 

Since the grocery business is going well, Mr. Meas P. wants to expand it. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to expand his wife's business. 

The couple has four children: two are very small and two are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for sale

loans.name: Siguikafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Siguikafo de l’association Balemayaton est composé de 4 femmes mariées de la ville de  San région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Les membres du groupe Siguikafo vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelle et se sont connues à travers le voisinage. Elles ont en moyenne 40ans et au moins 6 enfants. 
Elles exercent le commerce depuis plusieurs années et ont intégré le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y’ a une année. Elles sont à leur 2è prêt solidaire. 
Elles font l’achat vente  des produits cosmétiques, de tissus wax à l’image de Djeneba D. et  des condiments alimentaires. 
Djeneba D. qui a un  kiosque au grand marché de San compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 20 balles de  tissus wax contenant chacune  50 pièces. 
Elle compte réaliser 15 000 FCFA de bénéfice par mois qui sera utilisé pour rembourser, subvenir aux besoins familiaux et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
The group Siguikafo of the association Balemayaton is composed of four married women of the city of San, Region of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The group members, averaging 40 years of age and six children, live in large traditional families, and they know one another through community ties.  They have operated businesses for several years.  They joined the Soro Yiriwaso loan program a year ago and are now on their second solidarity loan.  The group members buy and sell cosmetics, wax cloth (as does Djeneba D.), and also condiments.  Djeneba D., who has a stall at the big market of San, intends to use her loan to buy 20 bales of wax cloth each containing 50 lengths of cloth.  She plans on making 15,000 francs CFA in profit per month that will be used for repaying the loan, for meeting family needs, and for reinvesting in the businesses. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cloth

loans.name: Asylkan's Group

texts.en: Asylkan T. is the leader of this four-person group. She is 45 and her husband is a cook. She has four children: the youngest is still in school, two of them moved to Russia to work, and the other one moved to Kazakhstan. Years ago, Asylkan sold food in her homemade restaurant and her husband helped her with this business. She started the restaurant a while ago but for family reasons was obligated to close. Now she wants to reopen the business and for this purpose she needs loan. She wishes to reopen and improve her restaurant. Muhabat A. is the treasurer of the group; she is 39, and a widow. All of her three children are students and have been helping their mother with her business for six years. She grows and sells potatoes and makes 5,800 som (approximately 130 USD) per month. With the loan, she will buy fertilizer to improve her yield. Her goal is to build a house. For ten years Tolgon A. has been a construction worker – he learned this trade by doing an apprenticeship. He is now 32 and married; his wife does not work. He wants to use the loan to buy fertilizer so that he can grow healthy vegetables near his home. His wife will be able to help him with this task and, in this way, they can earn extra income. When they amass enough money, Tolgon wants to build a better home for his family. Masturahan A. cultivates potatoes and corn, which she then serves in her homemade restaurant. Her husband, a construction worker, helps her with the business. She also has two sons: one is a student and the other is still a toddler. She started her business twelve years ago by cultivating corn. Today, she makes 2,500 som (approximately 55 USD) per month and plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and a larger variety of seeds. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To reopen her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en un Asentamiento Urbano (zona urbano – marginal) del distrito de Cura Mori, un distrito de la provincia de Piura, situado en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de diez años a la preparación y venta de chicha de jora (una bebida típica del país que se prepara desde épocas remotas en base a un tipo especial de harina de maíz), ella prepara esta bebida dos veces por semana y conlos ingresos que le brinda su venta ayuda a su esposo con los gastos familiares. El negocio tiene buena acogida ya que esta bebida es bastante consumida en la zona, sobretodo en diversas celebraciones y festividades. Además los trabajadores del lugar la consumen antes de iniciar sus actividades ya que creen que la bebida les ofrece energía y vigor.

Candelaria desea adquirir mas ingredientes e insumos como harina de jora, azúcar y leña para seguir elaborando esta bebida e incrementar sus ventas. Por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr sus metas.

Candelaria es una mujer trabajadora y entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es ver progresar a sus hijos y ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Candelaria, age 32, lives with her husband and their children in an urban settlement (poor urban zone outlying the city) in the Cura Mori district in the Piura province. It is situated in the region with the same name, and it is over three hours from the city of Chiclayo. For over ten years she has been making and selling “chicha de jora” (a drink that is typical in the country, which has been prepared since long ago with the base being a special type of corn flour). She prepares this drink two times a week. She helps her husband with the family expenses with the income that the sales provide. The business is well received because this drink is consumed a lot in the area. It is especially consumed during the various celebrations and activities. Also, the workers in the area consume it before they start their activities. They do this because they believe that the drink gives them energy and vigor. Candelaria wishes to get more ingredients and supplies like corn flour, sugar, and firewood to continue making this drink and to increase her sales. That is why she has asked, for the first time, Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 500 PEN. That will allow her to achieve her goals. Candeleria is a hard-working woman who is devoted to her family. Her greatest desire is to see her children progress and to give her family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to increase "chicha de jora" production

loans.name: Yoeun's Group

texts.en: This group loan consists of four members who are villagers in Lekh Buon village in Kandal province. Mrs. Yoeun S., 49 years old, is the group leader. The other group members selected her as the leader. Each member will use a portion of the loan for different purposes. She and her husband, Mr. Lim Toeuy, are farmers who own a plot of land to grow crops to sell to raise their family. They are also laborers. Now they have an obstacle because they don't have enough money to grow their crops. So to improve production, Mrs. Yoeun S. is seeking a loan to do farming this current year to increase the yield. She is a mother of five children. Four of the children attend the local public school, and the other one is just five years old.

loans.use: To do farming

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom N. lives in Phnum Lonteah village, Takeo province, and she was born in 1972. She is a farmer who owns a three-hectare (7.5-acre) plot of land that she uses to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Moreover, she is also a Khmer cake seller.

Mrs. Mom N.’s difficulty is that her field has infertile soil, but she does not have enough money to support it. So, to improve production, she is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan she will rent a plowing machine to plow her field and hire farm laborers to reap her rice field.

Mrs. Mom N. is a widow with two children, both of whom are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rent a plowing machine and hire farm laborers

loans.name: Rinalyn

texts.en:
Rinalyn G. is from the village of Benhaan, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 31 years old. Rinalyn is single and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Rinalyn owns & operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for sale. Rinalyn has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rinalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rinalyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Rinalyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn V. is from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old and is married with five school-aged children. Arlyn owns and operates a business providing motor transport services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Arlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in her business. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. Arlyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in her business

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
Brigida es socia del Banco Comunal Las Golondrinas.
Brigida es conviviente, tiene 4 hijos que estudian, Brigida se dedica a la compra y venta de quesos, los ofrece de casa en casa sus ventas en mayor proporción son al crédito.
Brigida necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles para la compra de materiales para la construcción de su casa.
Brigida sueña con terminar de construir su casa y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Brigida is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Golondrinas” (The Swallows). She is in a common law marriage and has four children who are in school. Brigida buys and sells cheeses and travels house to house to offer her products. Most of her sales are made on credit.

Brigida needs a loan of 1500 PEN to buy construction materials for her house. She dreams of finishing the construction of her house and seeing her children complete their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for her house

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mrs Savoeun S. (pictured above at her loom) is 43 years old and her husband, Mr Sophal Hel, is 52 years old. They have been married for 25 years and have four children - two sons and two daughters. Both daughters weave silk at home, one of her sons is attending university and another one has full-time employment. The family lives on an island on Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Savoeun has been a weaver since she before she was married, a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband is a wooden-house constructor, alS. since before their marriage. Savoeun is requesting a loan of US$1,100 to pay school fees for her son and she will use part of the loan to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her son and buy silk material for her weaving business

loans.name: Potenciano

texts.en:
Potenciano R. is from the village of Brgy. Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 51 years old. Potenciano is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Potenciano owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling scrap metal and other used products in the local community. Potenciano has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Potenciano joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Potenciano has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Potenciano is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand his product offering. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Potenciano from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Sonia Esther

texts.es:
Sonia  P. M. Inició un negocio hace seis años en el barrio Concord de Malambo, un municipio a 10 minutos de Barranquilla,donde vive y tiwen dos hijos en las edades de 19 y 24 años. Ella empezó vendiendo pintura para telas  e insumos para la  fabricación de muñecos y   enseñaba a fabricar estos productos, de ahí se deriva su permanente clientela y  el  logró de Sonia de haberlo convertido en  un punto de venta reconocido; como ella es una mujer sabia, que todo lo aprende y todo  lo enseña, se capacitó en artesanías en foamy y en fabricación de sandalias a través del Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje “SENA”  y hace 4 años empezó a vender los insumos de estos mismos productos, aprovechando que muchas personas se capacitaron y  emprendieron microempresas de fabricación de estas artesanías, lo cual le ha asegurado un mercado permanente.  
Actualmente Sonia  vive con su hijo menor,  a quien le está pagando estudios de Psicología gracias su trabajo en la microempresa, donde vende lo que fabrica y también las materias primas, los materiales e insumos de muchas artesanías que ella también practica. En la actualidad está solicitando un credikiva para comprar forros para plantilla, galones de pegante, plataformas, hilos, botones, telas, foamy  y escarcha, preparándose para en el mes de Diciembre fabricar calzado y adornos navideños, arte que también conoce perfectamente. Ella espera   incrementar sus ventas en un 30%   ya que en esta época del año se aumenta considerablemente clientes que piden estos artículos y por otro lado  la producción de calzado y de artículos navideños también se incrementa en las microempresas dedicadas a estas actividades, las cuales  finalmente compran donde Sonia los insumos para su producción.
Sonia está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo hace 2 años y este es su segundo financiamiento y con el primero logró aumentar un poco su capital de trabajo y acceder a nuevos clientes. Su desafío mas grande ocurrió el año anterior cuando hubo disminución en sus ventas pero logró adicionar nuevas líneas de productos y así ha logrado sostener   su negocio. Entre sus logros está la compra reciente de su vivienda en este mismo barrio y sueña con adecuarla, teniendo en cuenta  definir un espacio locativo, para que su negocio funcione en su propia casa y poder trasladarse tan pronto como le sea posible.  Sonia tiene una meta, que es la que mas  estimula   su trabajo en la microempresa, y es la de   ver a su hijo siendo un profesional de la psicología muy exitoso.
texts.en: Sonia  P. M. started a business six years ago in the Concord of Malambo neighborhood, a municipality 10 minutes from Barranquilla, where she lives with her two children, ages 19 and 24 years.  She began selling fabric paints and supplies for the production of dummies and she taught people how to manufacture these products.  From there her permanent clientele grew and Sonia achieved the goal of becoming a recognized point of sale.  She is a wise woman   who learns and teaches everything she can.  She is qualified in foam crafts and in the production of sandals through the National Learning Service "SEINE".  Four years ago she began to sell the supplies for these same products, taking advantage of the fact that many people who were qualified in the skills undertook micro-businesses producing these crafts.  This has assured her a permanent market.  At present Sonia lives with her youngest son.  She is paying for his studies in Psychology thanks to her work in the micro-business, where she sells what she manufactures and also the commodities, materials and supplies of many crafts that she also practices.  Currently she is requesting a loan to buy linings for templates, gallons of glue, platforms, thread, buttons, fabrics, foam and glitter, in order to be prepared for the month of December to make footwear and Christmas decorations, an art that she also knows perfectly.  She expects to increase her sales by 30% since at this time of year the number of clients asking for these articles grows considerably.  On the other hand the production of footwear and of Christmas articles by other micro-businesses dedicated to these activities also increases, and they buy the supplies for their production from Sonia.  Sonia joined the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation 2 years ago and this is her second loan.  With the first one she managed to enlarge her working capital a little and to add new clients.  Her greatest challenge the previous year occurred when there was a decrease in her sales but she managed to add new product lines and thus has managed to maintain her business.  Among her achievements is the recent purchase of her dwelling in this same neighborhood.  She dreams of adapting it, keeping in mind to define a working space, so that her business can function in her own house and she will be able to get to work as quickly as possible.  Sonia has a goal, which is the thing that most drives her work in the micro-business, and it is that of seeing her son become a very successful psychology professional.

loans.use: to buy linings for templates, gallons of glue, platforms, thread, buttons, fabrics, foam padding and glitter.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mrs. Mao C. (in the photo), 56, is a widow. She lives with her grandson and granddaughter in a small village near the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Mao has been running a grocery store in her village for five years. She is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to expand her grocery store and provide capital for her sister’s farming business.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store and provide capital for her sister’s farming business

loans.name: Jyanbere Group

texts.fr: Jean K. et agriculteur du riz, et il est un membre du groupe Jyanbere.  Il a 32 ans, il est marie, et il a 4 enfants entre 1 an et 8 ans.  Un de ses enfants va à l’école.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter les fertilisantes urées et NPK, et aussi pour la main d’œuvre.  Il voudrait améliorer l’activité de l’agriculture du riz, et il voudrait aussi payer les frais scolaires pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Jean K. is a rice farmer and a member of the Jyanbere group. He is 32 years old, married, and has four children between 1 and 8 years old. One of his children attends school.

He will use his loan to purchase urea and NPK (nitrogen-phosphorus-potassium) fertilizers, and also to pay for labor. He would like to improve his rice-farming business and also pay his family's school fees.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and labor

loans.name: Snave

texts.fr: Snave K. G. a 30 ans, il est célibataire, et il est fini 2 ans de l’université.  Il est né à Goma, dans le DRC, mais maintenant il habite à Kigali.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour l’aide familiale.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’épargner pour devenir indépendant financièrement, et minimiser sa consommation pour élever son épargne.  Il voudrait avoir un nouvel emploi, et bien rémunérer après avoir terminé ses études.  Pour la vie, il voudrait terminer ses études, et se marier.
texts.en:
Snave K. G. is 30 years old and single. He has been in university for two years. He was born in Goma, in the DRC, but now lives in Kigali. 

He will use his loan to support himself as a home-health aide. His growth strategy is to accumulate savings that will allow him to become financially independent, and to reduce his expenses to increase his savings. 

Once he has completed his studies, he wants to find new employment that pays well. For the future, his plans are to finish school and get married.

loans.use: Home-health aide

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
As the saying goes, opportunity knocks only once. Maricel B. knows this truth and grabs every opportunity that comes her way. Maricel, 36, attended college and now is married to Salvador, who works as a branch manager of a pizza chain in town.  Maricel works hard to help her husband earn for their daily needs and prepare financially for the future of their elementary grade child. Together, they live in Pasay City, Philippines.

Maricel currently runs a sari-sari (variety) store, in which she sells items that are needed daily by neighbors in her community. Products on her shelves range from soap to candies and energy drinks to rice. Having been at least seven years in business, she knows how to pay her dues on time. She also has an excellent reputation with her fellow community partners in CCT* and, most important, her customers. Monthly, she is able to earn an average of 10000 Philippines pesos (PHP).

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a 20000 PHP loan. She intends to use this money to purchase more products for her store, all the more needed now that the Christmas season is here. Maricel plans to take this opportunity to drive her business toward more profitability.

Maricel is never without challenges, both in her business and personal life. Nonetheless, she stays focused on the opportunities that lie ahead and not on the failures of yesterday or the worries of today.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To replenish stock in her store

loans.name: Donna May

texts.en:
Donna May is a married woman who lives in Aborlan, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a business selling cosmetics. Her husband Joel D. J., who is 40 years old, works as a government employee to earn his living. They have two children who are 7 and 9 years old. The children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores. Donna May joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Donna May has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 22,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, improving the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 12th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000, which she intends to use for additional capital for her cosmetics business to continue to save up for the future education of her children. Donna May is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Hadiatu

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Hadiatu B.. Hadiatu is a widow and has an 18-year-old child. In 1998, Hadiatu established her drinks business because she wanted to improve her well-being. Working six days a week, and 11 hours a day, she earns about 1,900,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to rent a more spacious shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and rent a more spacious shop

loans.name: Beline

texts.en:
Beline, 43, is married with two children, aged 15 and 25. Her husband is a driver. For that reason, Beline works hard to provide everything necessary for her family. Beline owns a small business selling various handicrafts and clothes for weddings.

From her ten years of experience, Beline is is seasoned in her business and keeps it well-organized. She employs two people from her community. Her shop is open from 6am to 7pm every day.

Beline has now requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing more handicrafts and clothes for weddings. She hopes to earn more profit, which will allow her to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase handicrafts and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Fanny Sonia Margarita

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Palabra De Mujer. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora Fanny es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos a podido financiar un poco su negocio. Tiene 46 años de edad, en la actualidad está soltera pero de una relación que tuvo hace varios años tiene dos  hijos de 19 y 15 de edad que aun viven con ella y estudian en colegio y Universidad.

Se dedica al comercio en lo que es venta de gas de uso domestico, nos cuenta que es la primera que empezó con este negocio en Charapoto  hace 16 años y que por esto tiene la franquicia del ministerio, ella entrega el gas al por mayor a comerciantes de la zona y también vende por unidades. También vende productos naturales de la marca Winalite. Trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00  hasta las 20h00 esto lo hace con la ayuda de sus hijos.

Este crédito es para comprar más gas de uso domestico.  Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The Palabra de Mujer Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the city of Charapoto, which is known for its traditional culture and for being a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province – San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Fanny is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because she has been able to fund her business a bit with the loans. She is 46 years old and is currently single, but she had two children from a former relationship that are 19 and 15 years old and still live with her and are students in college and high school, respectively.

She works selling gasoline for domestic use. She tells us that she is the first to begin with this business in Charapoto in the past 16 years and as a result, she has the authorization of the ministry. She delivers the gas at wholesale to the area merchants and also sells by unit. In addition, she sells natural products from Winalite. She works every day from 7am to 8pm and her children help her.

This loan is to purchase more gasoline for domestic use. Her dream is to keep moving forward with her business.

loans.use: To buy tanks of gasoline for domestic use

loans.name: Yuryi

texts.en:
Yuryi is a farmer from Vodyanoye, where he lives with his wife, 11-year-old daughter and son. Yuryi grows different vegetables in his 6 greenhouses. Moreover, he has a separate greenhouse for seedlings. Every year Yuryi plants 10,000 tomatoes. He has invested about 180,000 UAH in his venture, which he has been operating for 10 years. 

Yuryi is requesting a loan of 15,000 UAH to install a heating system for 3 greenhouses. He is hoping to buy a gas boiler and hose pipes for this purpose. More consistent temperatures will help him grow timely harvests and receive a steady income. This business is the main source of income for the family.

loans.use: to install a heating system for three greenhouses

loans.name: Chy

texts.en:
Chy T., 32, is a married woman blessed with four single children. All of them are students in the local public school. Her husband's name is Nhoern. He is 37, and he is a firewood seller in and around his village in Kompong Tom province. 

Chy T. has built a pigpen behind her house, where she raises many pigs to earn a living. Because the pig-raising business is a very profitable one for Chy T. and her family, Chy T. has requested a loan in order to buy additional piglets to raise for sale.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise for sale

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan Y. is a 52-year-old farmer and mother blessed with five children, four of whom are attending public school, and one of whom is married. Her husband, Ban Phan, 49, earns an income by playing Khmer music in and around Kompong Cham Province. Recently, the family's living conditions have not been comfortable because their house is in the process of being built, so Chan is requesting a loan to purchase needed housing materials.

loans.use: to purchase housing equipment in order to build her new house.

loans.name: Alver Rafael

texts.es: Alver tiene 21 años. Vive con su esposa y su niña de un año en el caserío Monterrey ubicado en el distrito de Paijan, en el norte de Perú. Vive en casa de un familiar, no cuenta con casa propia. Gana la vida trabajando como mototaxista en su vehículo propio. Esta solicitando este nuevo crédito para dar mantenimiento a su vehículo, la herramienta de su trabajo. Con esta inversión, podrá brinda un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Éste es el segundo crédito que Alver ha solicitado de Edpyme. Canceló el primero de manera puntual. Alver tiene buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos y conocidos que lo consideran como una persona trabajadora y responsable.
texts.en:
Alver is 21 years old. He lives with his wife and his one-year-old daughter in the Monterrey hamlet, located in the Paijan district, in the north of Peru. He lives in a family member’s house, as he does not have a house of his own. He earns a living working as a moto taxi* driver with his own vehicle. The new loan he is requesting will be used for the upkeep of his vehicle, which is his working tool. Thanks to this loan, he will be able to offer a better service to his customers. This is the second loan Alver has asked to Edpyme. The first has been regularly paid off. Alver has received good references by his neighbors and acquaintances, who consider him a responsible and hardworking man.

<cite>*A “moto taxi” is a motorcycle with a tricycle-like attachment.</cite>

loans.use: To pay for the upkeep of his vehicle.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva N. lives in the Kyebando Nsooba neighborhood, in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, all of attend school. Eva has a business of selling second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for 3 months, and she works 6 days out of every week. Eva sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.  

Eva has requested for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She also generates additional income through rental rooms.The main business challenge(s) for Eva include transportation and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and to start importing clothes herself. Eva  lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama las Divinas se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Amilcingo, Temoac, en el estado de Morelos, México, está integrado por las señoras Valeria e Ignacia van a comprar con su préstamo dulces típicos para surtir su negocio, la señora Alfonsa va a comprar maíz y leña para elaborar tortillas, la señora Maribel va a comprar alimento para engordar sus cerdos y la señora Diana va a comprar blusas y ropa de dama para surtir su negocio. 
La señora Alfonsa tiene 34 años de edad, ella es casada tiene 3 hijos Blanca tiene 13 años de edad está estudiando la secundaria, Yesenia tiene 11 años de edad estudia la primaria y Cristian tiene 19 años de edad ya trabaja, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar verduras y frutas como chiles, tomates, jitomates, cebollas, mangos, plátanos, naranjas  para iniciar su negocio vendiendo en la plaza de Amilcingo, su esposo le va a ayudar a atender a los clientes y a poner y levantar el puesto, ella inicio su negocio por necesidad para tener ingresos y así poder ayudar a la familia, ella tiene la esperanza de vivir mejor, llevar una vida mejor, ella está muy contenta con este préstamo, se siente orgullosa y feliz por el préstamo que va a recibir y espera que sus hijos tengan una vida mejor. Amilcingo es un pueblo bonito elaboran dulces palanqueta de cacahuate, alegrías, tamarindo, jamoncillo, etc. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias porque nos han apoyado en todo y nos tiene calma para todo”.
texts.en:
This community bank group called Las Divinas is found in the community of Amilcingo, Temoac, in the state of Morelos, Mexico. It was started by Mrs. Valeria and Mrs. Ignacia. With the loan, they will buy local candies to stock their business. Mrs. Alfonsa is going to buy corn and firewood to make tortillas. Mrs. Maribel will buy food for fattening her pigs, and Mrs. Diana is going to buy blouses and women's clothing to stock her business.

Mrs. Alfonsa is 34 years old, married, and has three children. Blanca is 13 years old and studies in secondary school. Yesenia is 11 years old and studies in primary school. Christian is 19 years old and works. She is asking for the loan to buy fruits and vegetables like chiles, tomatoes, onions, mangoes, bananas, and oranges to start a business selling in the Amilcingo Plaza. Her husband is going to help her with the customers and set up the stand. She started her business out of a need to have more income and be able to help her family. She has the hope of a better life. She is very happy with this loan and feels proud and happy to receive it. She hopes for her children to have a better life.

Amilcingo is a pretty village where they make peanut, alegria seed, tamarind, and fudge candies. The members of this group want to tell Kiva and the Fundación Realidad “thanks, because you have supported us through everything and have helped us feel more calm".

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Adjoavi

texts.fr: Mère de 02 enfants et âgée de 36ans, Mme Adjoavi a démarré son activité (vente de mais) en 2007. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages et fermes du Togo et revend au marché d’Akodessewa. Elle veut renforcer son activité et prendre soin de ses deux enfants c’est pour cela elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter des stocks.
texts.en:
A mother of two and 36 years old, Mrs. Adjoavi started her business (corn retail) in 2007. She gets her supplies from villages and farms in Togo, and resells at the Akodessewa market.
She wants to strengthen her business and take care of her two children, which is why she is requesting this first loan to purchase stocks.

loans.use: to buy cereals (corn).

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a married woman with three children, ages 28, 23, and 20. She is a farmer who works in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. Evangeline grows rice crops. She sells her harvest at her town's market. Evangeline works hard to support her family. She requested a loan to purchase eight sacks of fertilizer and other farm inputs.

In the future, Evangeline hopes to have a stable business. She also wishes for her children's success and for them to be God fearing.

loans.use: to purchase eight sacks of fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Bilgeys

texts.ru: Bilgeys rodilas v 1958 qodu. Ona zamujem i imeyet 2 detey. Bilgeys i yeyo semya jivut v Absheron regione. Ona 8 let zanimayetsya vipechkoy xleba "Tandir", tak je ona v etoy pechke tandir delayet nacionalnuyu yedu iz kuricci i iz ribi "Lavangi". Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye produkti dlya vipechki v tandire. Vipechki v tandire ona nauchilas u svoyey mami.
texts.en: Bilgeys was born in 1958. She is married and has two children.  Bilgeys and her family live in the Absheron region. She has been baking tandir bread for the last eight years.  Additionally, she makes the traditional dish lavangi (stuffed chicken or fish) in her oven.  Now she needs 2000 AZN to buy the ingredients necessary for baking in the tandir.  She learned how to bake in a tandir from her mother.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients necessary for baking in a tandir

loans.name: Romelia

texts.es:
La señora Romelia es socia del banco comunal Sol Naciente del Distrito Calleria, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 63 años D. edad, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos mayores D. edad (todos con sus respectivas familias).  Su primer préstamo fue D. trescientos nuevos soles.
Es una D. las fundadoras D. este banco comunal y como muchas D. ellas ya están acostumbradas a encontrarse en las reuniones y se ven como una gran familia.  Romelia se dedica a la venta D. comida D. forma ambulatoria en la vereda D. su casa, y lo hace en horas D. la noche cuando las personas buscan algo D. cenar como  Juanes, pollo asado, chorizo, cuero, pescado asado (comidas tìpicas D. la zona) y chicha morada .
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 saco D. carbón, 3 fuentes, 2 metros D. tela  para mantel, 4 sillas D. plástico.
Este trabajo lo realiza desD. hace mucho tiempo porque tiene que trabajar duro para poder educar sola a sus hijos,  Manuela Ramos le diò la oportunidad, como a muchas mujeres que quieren sacar adelante a su familia, en recompensa a tanto sacrificio recibe la ayuda económica D. uno D. sus hijos mayores.
texts.en:
Mrs. Romelia is a member of the communal bank Sol Naciente in the district of Calleria, department of Ucayali.  She is 63 years old and a single mother of three adult children (who all have their respective families).  Her first loan was for 300 PEN.

She is one of the founding members of the communal bank, and many, like her, are accustomed to greeting each other at the meetings and feel like their are one big family.  Romelia sells food off the porch of her house during the evening hours when people go out looking for something for dinner, such as grilled chicken, chorizo, grilled fish (typical in this area) and chicha morada (corn-based drink).

With the new loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN she will buy a sack of coal, 3 serving dishes, 2 meters of tablecloth fabric, and 4 plastic chairs.

She has been in business for a long time because she must work hard to give her children an education.  Manuela Ramos gave her the opportunity, as with many women who want to see their family get ahead.  Because of all her sacrifice she receives financial support from one of her oldest sons.

loans.use: To buy a sack of coal, 3 serving dishes, 2 meters of tablecloth fabric, 4 plastic chairs.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel es una mujer de 42 años, que vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de 5 años de edad y desde hace 1 año, impulsada con apoyar a su esposo en la gestión de su hogar y su necesidad personal de sentirse útil a su familia, decidió en compañía de su esposo vender queso en el barrio donde antes vivía, pues allí tenía muchos conocidos amigos y familiares que apoyarían su iniciativa, como hasta la presente ha ocurrido, pues ellos en la actualidad son su principal mercado y también ha agregado empleados de la empresa donde trabaja su esposo y muchos referidos, que ahora conocen la calidad de sus producto. Cuando construyó este mercado,  decidió darle rienda suelta a su creatividad e incursionó en la venta de deditos de queso, empacadas en pequeñas bandejas, aprovechando su materia prima que es el queso, producto que ella compra en mayor cantidad ,  y es otro negocio que le suministra ingresos simultáneos y con el que le ha ido muy bien. Como también con productos complementarios que prepara y vende como los bolis de frutas , productos congelados a base de frutas naturales de la región, como guanábana, mango, coco y hasta chocolate.  Su mayor anhelo es que su microempresa tenga una mejor infraestructura y que logre apoyar la sostenibilidad y el crecimiento personal y profesional de su familia. Mientras esto ocurre trabaja en su negocio con un margen de contribución del 61,29%  y con muchas ganas de incrementar su capital de trabajo para expandir sus productos. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará implementos de cocina, como la mesa en lámina galvanizada, una vitrina calentadora, un horno para pizza, pues aprovecharía el conocimiento técnico que tiene su esposo en la preparación de este último productos, que planea impacte a la comunidad pues no hay mucha competencia en el barrio y en sus alrededores, para finalmente generar nuevos ingresos.
texts.en: Isabel is a 42-year old woman who lives with her partner and their 5-year old son. Last year she felt motivated to help her husband with the household finances and she had a personal need to feel useful for her family. So she decided to start selling cheese with her husband in a community where they used to live. They have many acquaintances, friends, and family there who supported their initiative and continue to do so to date. They are their primary market and they have also acquired as clients the employees of the company where he works and other referred clients who now know about the quality of their products. When built her business she decided to let her creativity run free and she began selling cheese fingers packaged in small bundles. She took advantage of the fact that the primary product is cheese and it is a product that she buys in larger quantities. This is another business that earns a second source of income and it has done very well. She also sells complimentary products that she prepares, such as frozen fruit snacks. She prepares them with natural fruits from the region, such as soursop, mango, coconut, and even chocolate. Her greatest dream is to give her business a better infrastructure and to be able to support the person and professional development of her family. As she works towards her goals she works with a contribution margin of 61.29%. She is very eager to increase her working capital to expand her products. This is exactly the reason why she requests a Kiva loan, a first time loan through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner). With it she will purchase kitchen implements such as a galvanized steel table, a heated display, and a pizza oven. She will be able to profit from her husband's technical knowledge with respect to the preparation of these products. She plans to have an affect on the community especially because there is not much competition in their neighborhood and surrounding areas. Her goal is to generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen implements such as a galvanized steel table, a heated display, and a pizza oven.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 27-year-old business man. He sells mobile-phone accessories to earn a living. He also sells clothes for more income generation. He has been running his business for two years. Previously, he was operating a grocery shop.  

Daniel dreams of expanding his business in order to attract more customers. He has requested a loan for 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy mobile phone accessories.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Akparchon

texts.ru:
Акпарчон женат и любящий отец 2 детей. Он честный и добрый человек. Акпарчон мечтает устроить своих детей в лучшую школу и поэтому усердно работает. Акпарчон занимается купля продажей продуктов питания. Он имеет свой магазин в центре города на населенном пункте. Он продает конфеты, печенье, соки, напитки и т.д. Акпарчон всегда старается, удовлетворят потребности своих клиентов. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и добавить новых ассортиментов продуктов питания. Акпарчон запрашивает займ на сумму 2000$ США для покупки нового ассортимента продуктов питания. Он заранее благодарит вас всех за вашу помощь и милосердие. 
     
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Akparchon is married and is a loving father of two children.  He is an honest and kind person.  Akparchon dreams of placing his children into the best school and works diligently for that.  He is involved in buying and selling food products.  He owns a store in a well-populated location of the city center.  He sells candies, cookies, juices, drinks, etc.  Akparchon always tries to satisfy the demands of his customers.  He wants to expand his business and add a new assortment of food products.  Akparchon is requesting a loan in the sum of $2000 for the purchase of a new assortment of food products.  He thanks all of you in advance for your help and mercy.

loans.use: to purchase a new assortment of products

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is 50 years old and married and with five children. He has a van transport business to earn a living.  He has been operating his business for six years.  He also does dairy farming for more income generation. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to provide better education to his children. Francis hopes to buy more vans for his transport business in five years.  He has requested 50,000 Kenya shillings to service his van.

loans.use: To service his van

loans.name: Lotis

texts.en:
Lotis is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Lotis provides motorcycle or habal-habal transport. Her husband is the driver. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy gasoline and tools for maintenance of the motorcycle.

Lotis has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lotis hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and tools for maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: C13013 Dukorerehamwe Group

texts.en:
Jacqueline, a 41-year-old married mother of three children between the ages of 10 and 17, is the president of a group called "Dukorerehamwe". This is her fifth successful year in the business of selling charcoal, vegetables, and fruit. She works every day from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m.

Jacqueline and her team have requested a loan to purchase more charcoal, vegetables, and fruit to sell. By using this loan, Jacqueline and her team expect to earn more profits which, in turn, will allow each member of the group to start saving as well as building a better future for their families.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal, vegetables, and fruit to sell.

loans.name: Rodrigo Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Rodrigo sigue laborando en seguridad, sus dos hijos creciendo y cursando el año escolar, su esposa sigue trabajando y ambos siguen haciendo las mejoras a su casa.
Su casa hoy en dia toda de concreto, parte de estos logros fueron atraves del financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado en varios creditos. Lo que para ellos ha sido de gran beneficios al mejorar la infraestructura de su casa. El no cuenta con inodoro y desea mejorar esta condicion por tal razon comprara inodoro,tubos para aguas negras, pegamento,cemento, arena, bloques y hacer esta obra. El cual sera para su familia de gran bienestar de salud, al realizar mas higiene.
texts.en:
Rodrigo still works as a security guard. His two children are growing and attending school. His wife is still working and they're both still making home improvements.
His house is currently made entirely of concrete. Part of this success came from the funding Afodemic has provided in various loans, which have helped them a lot as they improve the infrastructure of their home.
He doesn't have a toilet and wishes to improve this condition. For that reason he will purchase a toilet, sewage pipes, glue, cement, sand and cinder blocks, and get it built. It will mean a lot to his family in terms of well-being and health, because they will get better hygiene.

loans.use: to purchase a toilet, sewage pipes, glue, cement and cinder blocks, and to start building so that his family will get better hygiene.

loans.name: Diappo Moy Doole N° 1 Group

texts.fr: Diappo Moy Doolé N°1 est un groupe mixte composé de trois femmes et de deux hommes.Les membres du groupe pratiquent tous le commerce de produits ménagers.Les femmes vendent à domiccile alors que les deux hommes font  du "porte à porte" pour écouler leurs marchandises.Leurs activités générent des revenus assez important leur permettant de prendre en charge leurs besoins et de participer aux dépenses familiales.Le chef du groupe ( doigt pointé)est une femme mariée , mère de quatres enfants qui sont tous à l'école.Elle paie leurs frais de scolarité ainsi que leurs fournitures et s'occupe aussi de leurs habillement.Pour augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe sollicitent un pret de 250000f pour acheter des produits ménagers.Leur ambition est d'ouvrir chacun sa propre boutique.
texts.en:
Diappo Moy Doolé N°1 is a mixed group made up of three women and two men. All the members of the group sell household products. The women sell from home while the men go door to door to sell their goods. Their activity generates quite a good income allowing them to provide for their needs and to take part in the family expenses.

The leader of the group (with the pointed finger) is a married woman, mother of four children all attending school. She pays for their school fees as well as their school supplies and takes care of their clothing.

To increase their working capital, the members of the group are requesting a loan for 250,000 Francs to purchase household products. Their ambition is for each to open their own shop.

loans.use: buy household products.

loans.name: Abdou

texts.fr: Monsieur Abdou est un Marchand qui gère   un mini sélect à coté de la station de la municipalité de la localité de sa zone d'habitation.Il capitalise une expérience de plus  de 5 ans dans son activité de commerce.Il commercialise des produits alimentaires divers. Il est membre d'un des guichets de l'U-IMCEC depuis 2 ans. il sollicite un crédit de 500 000, montant avec lequel il compte acheter de la boisson sucrée qui est très demandée en cette période d'approche  des fêtes.Son souhait est de renforcer son fond de roulement pour réaliser d'avantage de bénéfices.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdou is a merchant. For the past five years, he has been running a small convenience store next to the City Hall station. 

He will use this second loan to stock up on merchandise such as soft drinks, a product in very high demand, which will be needed for the upcoming Tabaski celebration. His experience will help him to strengthen his working capital and increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks for his convenience store

loans.name: Akaki

texts.en:
Akaki is a joiner. He has a small workshop in the village of Ivandidi in the Imereti Region of West Georgia, where he lives with his big family: his wife Tsiala, their 34-year-old daughter, their son-in-law, and their two grandchildren, an eight-year-old boy and a one-year-old girl. Akaki studied joinery 20 years ago, and since then it has been the main source of income for him and his family. In his workshop, Akaki produces wooden doors and windows on order. His average monthly income is 800 laris. He loves his work and his workshop. Akaki’s son-in-law works as a night watchman for a local company. Tsiala and her daughter are housewives.
 
Akaki has requested a loan to purchase wooden raw materials. He will use the raw materials to complete orders from customers in Ivandidi and nearby villages. As usual, his profits will be used to satisfy the daily needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase wooden materials for his joiner's workshop.

loans.name: Sitan

texts.fr:
Sitan est une femme mariée de plus 41 ans et mère de quatre enfants , elle vit avec son époux et leurs enfants à Sanoubougou I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso.
 Sitan mène cette activité d’achat et vente de bois de chauffage et poissons fumé il y a dix ans. Elle jouit d’une forte réputation dans cette activité et reçoit beaucoup de commandes surtout en saison froide, mais ses ressources ne peuvent pas lui permettre de les satisfaire. Ainsi, elle a besoin de ce huitième prêt individuel pour acheter 15 chargements de charrette en bois de chauffage dans les localités environnantes de la ville de Sikasso  et 20 cartons de poissons fumés à Gao (7ème région administrative du Mali) afin de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’accroitre.
   Ses marchandises (respectivement bois de chauffe et poissons fumés) sont vendues au domicile et au marché du quartier.  
   Elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus cinq ans dont elle a bénéficié de quatre prêts solidaires avec une association des femmes de son quartier et est maintenant à son huitième prêt individuel, tous ses prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
    Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utiliser pour  réaliser l’essentielle de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Sitan is a married woman, 41 years old and mother of four children. She lives with her husband and children in Sanoubougou I, one of the working-class neighborhoods in the city of Sikasso.

Sitan has worked for ten years buying and selling firewood and smoked fish. She has a good reputation in this business and receives many orders, especially during the cold season, but she does not have sufficient resources to fulfill all her orders. Thus, she needs an eighth individual loan to buy 15 cartloads of firewood in the communities surrounding the city of Sikasso and 20 cases of smoked fish in Gao (the seventh administrative region of Mali) in order to meet the needs of her ever increasing clientele.

Her goods (firewood and smoked fish) are sold from her home and in the local  market.
She has been collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso for more than five years and has benefited from four group loans with a group of the women in her neighborhood, and she is now on her eighth individual loan. All her previous loans have been properly reimbursed.

With this loan, she hopes to make a monthly profit of 150,000 FCFA, which she will use to cover her basic expenses, contribute to the family's expenses and pay the interest on the loan. She will invest the rest in her business.

loans.use: to buy firewood and smoked fish.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 57 years old and single. 

Yolanda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her general store.

Yolanda has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as softdrinks, bread, canned goods, noodles, etc.

In the future Yolanda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
This is Elsa, 46, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Marcial, a security guard, and she is mother to her two children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Elsa operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also sells direct-selling products for additional income.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 350 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her business.

She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Elsa hopes her business will grow into a mini-grocery and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Marisa

texts.es: Marisa de 28 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos a su cargo. Reside en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, ubicada en la localidad de Comumpiari, donde tiene su techo propio. Hace 06 meses que Marisa empezó en la venta de bebidas como: gaseosas y refrescos; sus principales clientes son la gente de su localidad y la gente que llega a conocer el pueblo de Comumpiari. Gracias a este negocio puede solventar con los gastos escolares de sus hijos ya que es padre y madre para sus queridos hijos. Ahora bien establecida en su negocio anhela ampliar su tienda introduciendo nuevos productos, pero en mayores proporciones, para que así los venda al por mayor y menor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que la gente le da ánimos para que pueda seguir adelante y considera que lo mas difícil es cuando se le agotan las bebidas; por ello acude a los financistas para solicitar un préstamo que le ayude a trabajar tranquilamente y poder solventar a sus hijos.  Este será su crédito número 01 con MFP, lo cual se siente agradecida con la institución, por la oportunidad que le brindan, por lo que se compromete en cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas. Con el crédito solicitado de 1,500 nuevos soles, piensa invertir en la compra de más productos de primera necesidad, con la finalidad de que surta su tienda.
texts.en:
Marisa, 28, is a single mother; she has three children in her care.  She lives in the beautiful Ayacucho jungle in the community of Comumpiari where she owns her house.  Six months ago Marisa started to sell beverages like soft-drinks and sodas.  Her main customers are people from her community and people who come to visit the town of Comumpiari.  Thanks to this business she can cover her children’s educational costs since she’s both mother and father to her beloved children.

She’s now well-established in her business and would like to expand the store introducing new products but in larger amounts so that she can sell at both wholesale and retail.  What she most likes about her work is that the people encourage her to continue forward and she considers the most difficult part of it running out of beverages.  This is why she calls on lenders to request a loan that will help her work with tranquility and to be able to support her children.

This will be her first MFP loan.  She  is grateful to the institution for the opportunity it provides her and she commits to meet her installments.  She will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy more staple items to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy stock staple merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Lisseth Giovanna

texts.es:
Lisseth es una joven de 29 años que vive en la ciudad de Pisco, la cual sufrió un terrible terremoto de 7.9 grados en las escala de Richter y trajo como consecuencia desastres y mucha tristeza en la mencionada ciudad. Es en este lugar donde se han creado nuevas oportunidad de negocio, Lisseth por ejemplo se dedica a la venta de pollos en un mercado de la ciudad.

Ella es estudiante de la carrera de Administración, está muy entusiasmada y encantadísima con estudiar, cuando ella inició sabía que sus padres no podrías costearle su sueño y es por esto que se dedico a realizar este tipo de venta y así generar los ingresos que son necesarios para pagar los gastos que debe asumir, ella sabe que será una buena profesional y por medio de este empleo está solventando su mayor sueño.

Con la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, esta estudiante de Administración podrá comprar una balanza electrónica, que es lo que le hace falta y algunos otros implementos para su negocio, ella sabe que con esta ayuda podrá lograr atender mejor y mucho más rápido a sus clientes, está muy feliz con esta nueva oportunidad debido a que sabe que si atiende mejor, ganará más y esto la llevará a ser la gran profesional y empresaria que anhela ser.
texts.en:
Lisseth is a young 29-year old woman who lives in the town of Pisco. The town suffered a terrible earthquake (7.9 on the Richter scale) not so long ago resulting in serious disasters and a great deal of sadness. New business opportunities have been created. Lisseth, for example, sells chickens in one of the town’s markets.

She is also studying Administration and is very enthusiastic about her studies. From the beginning she knew that her parents couldn’t afford to pay for her to fulfill this dream so she began her business to generate enough income to cover the cost of her education. She knows that one day she will get a good job; her current business is providing the money for her dream.

With help from Kiva donors, Lisseth will be able to buy some electronic scales, something that she lacks, and also other implements for the business. She knows that with these items she will be able to provide better and faster service to her customers. She is very happy to have this opportunity as if she provides better service, she will earn more and finally get to have the career that she longs for.

loans.use: to buy electronic scales and other implements

loans.name: Gelesomu

texts.en:
Coffee farming has been Gelesomu's occupation for the last decade. The 39-year-old father of three says that he finds this business very worthwhile because the earnings from his coffee sales have enabled him to send all of his kids to school. Furthermore, he says that he has been able to improve his family's standard of living. Because his wife has been at his beck and call, he has been able to make many in-roads in his business.

Gelesomu says that this business generates sales revenues to the tune of UGX 400,000 each month. He will use his loan to purchase more coffee seedlings to replant.

loans.use: to purchase more coffee seedlings to replant.

loans.name: Lesbia Marina

texts.en:
I have had my business for fours years and it has grown little by little. Now, I have a good customer base since many people do not have enough resources to buy expensive clothes in stores. Most of my sales are made on weekends when people from other communities visit Choluteca in order to shop for food and visit banks. It is for this reason that weekends are when I offer a variety of clothes for the entire family.

This loan will be used to buy bundles of used clothing

Tengo cuatro años de tener mi negocio el que ha crecido poco a poco, ahora tengo una buena clientela ya que muchas personas no tienen muchos recursos para comprar la ropa cara de tiendas. Mis ventas son mejores los fines de semana ya que hay personas de otras comunidades que viajan a Choluteca para hacer sus compras de alimentos y visitar bancos, es por esa razon que los fines de semana surto para ofrecer variedad de ropa para toda la familia.

loans.use: Compra de fardos de ropa usada.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: F. lives in Abokobi, Accra, Ghana. She sells canned fish, tomato paste, dry fish, cooking oils, brooms, and other variety store goods. In order to increase her profits, she needs to have more goods to sell She requests a loan of $750.00 to enable her to buy the stock she needs to increase her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Nancy would like to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria runs a small store out of her home where she sells hand-painted tablecloths, shoes, sandals and hand-knit handbags. She originally went to beauty school but left that profession to get married. When it became clear that her husband did not look after the household finances, she went back to work, this time opening a small hair salon, but later lost everything in a robbery. She learned to make the handbags and shoes she currently sells by watching a neighbor.

She started the business 5 years ago with only $20 of capital. Since then things have been going well, and she would like to expand her business. She took out a loan from Mifex that allowed her to increase her sandal making operation. Things have been going very well and she was able to invest in cleaning products as well. She is seeking another loan in order to increase the space for her business, invest in new products and buy supplies for her sandal making operation.

Maria’s husband emigrated to the United States two years ago, so she lives alone with her three children. She would like to stabilize their economic situation so that her husband can come home.

loans.use: Improve her store and invest in materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue investing in new products and improve his store

loans.name: Aida Aly

texts.pt:
Aida is married and she is the mother of 4 children. All her children are in school. Aida's husband is a driver and his income is very low; that is why she decided to start her own business so that she could help him cover their living expenses. She joined the program this year. She wishes to apply the money on the purchase of more clothes and shoes to fill up her store. If business progresses successfully, she will eventually restore her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Aida e casada e mae de 4 filhos. Todos os filhos de Aida estao a estudar. O marido de Aida e motorista o salario dele e baixo, por isso Aida resolveu iniciar tambem um negocio para poder apoiar o marido nas despesas da casa.Ela entrou para o Programa este ano. Ela quer usar o dinheiro para a compra de mais roupa e calcado para rechear a sua banca.Se o negocio correr bem, ela pensa mais tarde reabilitar a sua residencia.

loans.use: Aida wants to use the money to purchase clothing in Maputa for her retail business.

loans.name: Haver

texts.en: Haver M. operates a woman’s clothing and accessories stand at the bazaar located in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. Haver is a widow and is currently living in Devechi with her four children. She is currently looking for funding in the amount of $800 so that she can increase the quantity and variety of her inventory.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and variety of her inventory

loans.name: Minerva

texts.es:
Ten years ago Minerva began to selling grocery items, buying small quantities of bread and milk to sell. She needed to start this business because her husband's salary was not enough to cover the education of their three children. The two oldest have now completed their university studies, and the youngest continues her studies and helps her mother with the business. During the last ten years, Minerva has expanded the range of products she offers.

However, lately her customers have been requesting items that she doesn't carry, so they've gone to the competition. Now Minerva can't generate enough income to cover the costs of her daughter's education, so she is requesting a loan, to be paid back in 6 months, to purchase additional merchandise such as office supplies (paper, pens and pencils, notebooks). By winning back her customers and growing her income, she will be able to achieve her dream that her daughter finishes university. With your help Minerva will be able to give her daughter a better future.

Hace 10 años que Minerva comenzó la venta de abarrotes comprando un poco de leche pan y latas. Minerva tubo que comenzar este negocio puesto que no les alcanzaba con el sueldo de su esposo para pagar los estudios de sus 3 hijos de los cuales los 2 mayores lograron terminar la universidad satisfactoriamente y la más pequeña continua estudiando y por las tardes le ayuda a Minerva en el negocio. En estos 10 años Minerva a logrado aumentar la gama de productos en su tienda.

Sin embargo sus clientes le han pedido últimamente artículos que ella no posee esto hace que su clientela se vallan con la competencia y por lo tanto no puede adquirir tantos ingresos como ella desearía para poder pagar los gastos de la universidad de su hija. Es por esto que Minerva esta solicitando un crédito de US $750, que esta dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses, con este dinero Minerva podrá comprar mas mercancía como papelería (libretas, lápices, plumas, colores entre otras cosas) y asi poder cumplir su sueño, que su hija termine la Universidad. Con tu ayuda Minerva podrá sacar adelante a su hija.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE ADDITIONAL MERCHANDISE FOR HER SMALL SHOP SO HER COMPETITION DOESN'T TAKE HER CUSTOMERS AWAY,  AND INCREASE HER INCOME SO THAT SHE CAN PAY FOR HER DAUGHTER TO FINISH UNIVERSITY.

loans.name: Sin

texts.en: Mrs. Sin S., age, 29, works selling a variety of vegetables, making on average around $2.50 each day. Her husband is a construction worker making on average around $3 each day in revenue. Her children are too young to attend school. She would like to request this loan of $800 in order to purchase two more cows to plow their rice paddy, thereby increasing productivity and output.
