loans.use: Sin would like to purchase two more cows to plow their rice paddy, thereby increasing productivity and output.

loans.name: Fahmeeda's Group

texts.en: "I am a group leader, Fahmeeda B.. I am married and a mother of two sons. One of my sons has a tailoring business and the other is a rickshaw driver. He has been employed as a rickshaw driver by someone for almost a year. Now he feels a need to buy his own rickshaw.  Please lend [to] us for this purpose. I have another friend with me who is in a need of loan: Riffat B. needs this loan for the fixing of her husband’s rickshaw (sic)."

loans.use: Buy a rickshaw and support the other business

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Every day for fifteen years, Carmen has entirely devoted herself to working at her soda fountain. She starts early to prepare everything for sale in the evening. It all started because she was unable to find work. She is trained as a social worker assistant and worked as such for fifteen years until the company she worked for went bankrupt. She tells us that before opening the soda fountain she spent some time looking for a job as a social worker’s assistant but since she did not find anything decided to work doing what she knows best, cooking. She now serves french fries and hot dogs, desserts, beverages, etc. What she most wants is to see her children grow up with a good education; thus together with her husband’s income as an electric technician almost all of their income is spent on their children’s future.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Todos los días, desde hace quince años, Carmen se dedica íntegramente a su fuente de soda. Desde temprano ella prepara todo lo necesario para sus ventas en la noche. Todo empezó para ella a raíz de que no encontraba trabajo. Ella es de profesión asistenta social y como tal, estuvo trabajando durante quince años hasta que la empresa que la empleaba quebró. Ella nos cuenta que antes de abrir su fuente de soda estuvo buscando trabajo como asistenta social por una temporada, pero como no la contrataban decidió trabajar haciendo lo que ella sabia, cocinar. Ahora atiende en su negocio vendiendo salchipapas, postres, bebidas etc. Lo que ella más desea es ver a sus hijos crecer con buena educación, es así que casi todos sus ingresos los invierte en ellos junto con su esposo quien trabaja como técnico electricista.

loans.use: Implement her soda fountain

loans.name: Plan De Lucha (Plan Of Attack) Group

texts.en:
Hilaria is a fun and vibrant woman, who, in spite of all of the hardships she has faced, continues to be optimistic and hardworking.  She lives with her eight children in a small and rural town in the interior section of the island The children range in ages from 4 to 19 years old, and she is raising them by herself!

Hilaria runs a small colmado, a kind of grocery store from her home. She also sells a small selection of used clothing.  She says she is planning to use this loan to buy rice, cooking oil, sugar, salt, jeans, blouses, and undergarments.  The loan will enable her to buy all of these items in bulk, and as a result she will be able to slightly increase her profit margin.  

She dreams that with the help of this loan, she will be able to give her children a good education, go back and finish school herself, expand her business into a big grocery store, and to one day own her own home and a motorcycle.  Before she never dreamed of achieving these things, but now she says she believes they are possible.

On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, and from Hilaria herself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To purchase larger amounts and a better variety, of used and new clothing.

loans.name: Seyfaddin

texts.en:
Seyfaddin was born in 1964 in the Khachmaz region. He is married and has two children.

Six years ago, Seyfaddin started his business.He is requesting a loan of $875 to purchase a calf and balling presses to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase a calf and balling presses

loans.name: Oussama

texts.en: Oussama H. is 41 years old, has four children and works as a janitor for a building in Saida in south Lebanon. He makes a living offering his services to residents and commercial tenants in the building. Oussama's house was destroyed during the war of July, 2006, and he needs a loan of $1,000 to renovate it and thereby assure a better life for his family. This is Oussama's first loan request from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To renovate his house

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia, a 40-year-old married woman with four children aged 20, 16, 13 and 9, owns a clothing shop which she started in 2006.  Working daily from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m., she can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Rukia now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes (khanga and vitenge) for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes (khanga and vitenge) for her shop

loans.name: Banovsha

texts.en: Banovsha is a mother of 3 children. She lives in the Khachmaz region. She was born in 1956. She has been in the farming business for 4 years. Now she needs a loan of $1000 to buy fertilizer and pesticides to improve her farming business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Rafoat

texts.en:
Rafoat Z. is 51 years old. She is a very wise and hard-working woman. She is married, with three children. This entrepreneur dedicates herself to the sale of clothing and socks for teenagers. Rafoat says that lending services from IMON have helped her business grow over the past 3 years.

Little by little, she has expanded her inventory and thanks to the good service she offers, her business is growing rapidly. She says that with income from her activity she is able to provide education and food for her children.

Now Rafoat needs a loan of 3000 Somoni (900 USD) which she will use to buy clothing for teenagers for the autumn season to meet the demand of her customers and continue growing her business. She is committed to paying back this loan in 12 months. This is the time to help someone who needs it. Please do not hesitate to help improve the quality of life of this family.

loans.use: Purchasing autumn clothing for teenagers for re-sale

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa Z. D. is a single mother with two children, aged 22 and 23, living in Ayacucho, Peru. She is a member of the community bank, Alborada, which means “dawn” in Spanish. Rosa can be found selling children’s clothing in the market on Jr. 12 de abril in Ayacucho. She travels monthly to Lima to purchase inventory for her business.

Her loan of 1500 soles will be invested in her business by purchasing pants, button-up women’s sweaters, workout clothing and jackets to sell. Her goals are to continue improving her business and to ensure her children become professionals.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: Juan Francisco S. T., guatemalteco, de 44 años de edad, casado, del Sector A-07 del paraje Chiambrocio, Cantón Chotacaj, Totonicapán,  él se dedica al comercio desde sus 32 años de edad, iniciando con un pequeño capital, ahora con la ayuda de su esposa María Graciela Velásquez Chuc han decidido agrandar el negocio para que así puedan mantener a la familia y también tener comodidades. Por tal motivo necesitan la ayuda de ASDIR para poder agrandar el negocio. Con el credito le permite compra materia prima, herramientas para producir mas y que le facilite el trabajo y ser competitivo, en el mercado y aprobechar las fiesta de fin de año y como la fiesta de la comunidad en el mes de Enero dos mil nueve  y como el inicio del nuevo ciclo escolar.
texts.en:
Juan Francisco S. T. is 44 years old and lives in Guatemala. He lives in the A-07 sector of Chiambrocio, Chotacaj County, Totonicapán. He has worked in his business since he was 32 years old and began with a small amount of capital. Now with the help of his wife María Graciela Velásquez Chuc, they have decided to expand the business so they can support their family and also have material comforts. For this reason they need ASDIR’s help to be able to expand their business. With this loan, Juan will be able to buy raw materials and tools to produce more products, to make work easier, and to be competitive in the market. He will take advantage of the coming New Year festival, the community celebration during January 2009, and the beginning of the coming school year.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Amaqella Village Bank, which means “don’t be lazy” in Quechua. 

Nancy is 35 years old and single with two children. She has a chicken restaurant, located on a very busy street, where she employs four staff to help her serve the public. Nancy is the head cook.

Nancy also sells a variety of clothing by special order. Nancy needs a loan of 2000 Soles to buy sacks of rice and sugar and a sign to hang outside her restaurant.  

Nancy’s dreams are for her children to graduate with professional degrees and to open another location for her restaurant. 

---
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Amaqella que significa No Seas Flojo en quechua. 
Nancy es soltera, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Nancy tiene un restaurante y polleria ubicado en una avenida muy transitada, el local es alquilado y tiene 4 personas que le ayudan en la atención al publico, Nancy se encarga de la cocina. Además Nancy vende ropa variada de acuerdo a los pedidos que tenga. 
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz por sacos y un letrero publicitario para su negocio. 
Los sueños de Nancy son que sus hijos terminen sus estudios profesionales e implementar otra sucursal.

loans.use: Buy sacks of rice and sugar and a sign to hang outside of restaurant

loans.name: Mohchehra

texts.ru: Акрамова Мохчехра жительница города Курган-тюбе. Возраст 28 лет , замужем и имеет двоих детей.Семь лет занимается торговлей . Торгует одеждой на рынке города КУрган-тюбе. Для завоза сезонного товара и увеличения ассортимента планирует получить кредит , сроком на 12 месяцев. Хочет привезти  зимний товар.
texts.en:
Mohchehra A. lives in the town of Kurgan-tube. She is 28 years old, married and has two children. She has been in the retail business for seven years. She sells clothing on the market of Kurgan-tube. Mohchehra decided to apply for a loan for a term of 12 months to bring in seasonal clothing and increase inventory circulation. She want to buy winter merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Evonne Mahle

texts.en:
Evonne is married with three children and lives in Ngomgham, Bamenda, Cameroon. She plans to invest this loan in her "buyam sellam" raw food stuff and her piggery and poultry. More specifically, she will purchase Irish potatoes, beans, maize, three piglets, and 30 fowls. Evonne also plans to contribute 100,000 CFA ($200 USD) of her personal savings towards these purchases.  
 
This is Evonne's fifth loan from GHAPE; she has been a member since 2004. She has been working in her "buyam sellam" business for a number of years now and has since found the items she sells from suppliers; this ensures she gets the best prices on these items. Evonne now has many customers who come to her for all of their vegetables. She allows some people to create tabs with her for their purchases and pay her at the end of the month. Her contribution to her community provides them with these items in closer proximity to their community, cutting down on their travel costs and the time involved in searching for these items.
 
With the profits from this loan, Evonne plans to send her children to school and support them after school. She will also consider adding other food stuffs to her stall. Her profits will also provide her the security of knowing she can afford hospital bills and health costs.  
 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her food stall

loans.name: Tserendolgor

texts.en:
Tserendolgor D. lives with her husband in the center of Uvurhangai, one of Mongolia's southern provinces. Her husband works as a receptionist in an elementary school, and her son is a soldier.

Tserendolgor worked as a tailor in a sewing factory for many years, but in 2000, she quit that job and started sewing a variety of clothes at home to sell. People come to her to order specific clothes with a specific design. In addition, she began renting a clothing stall at the local market last year, and moved her sewing machine there. Then she started sewing and selling at the same stall at same time. The orders people are giving her have increased day-to-day, since she has no competitors who run the same business. She would like to expand her business, and therefore she requests a loan to buy materials for sewing clothes.

loans.use: To buy materials for sewing clothes.

loans.name: Gorret's Group

texts.en:
Gorret N. is the leader of Ivunamba group in Jinja. In the photo, she is with Robinah L.. 

Gorret has a business selling matooke, a stew of plantains, beef, and dried fish cooked in a beef and tomato stock. She gets some of the plantains for the matooke from her farm. She buys the rest from other farmers for increased profits. 

Robinah has a poultry business in which she raises local and exotic chickens for sale. Both ladies would like a loan to invest more in their businesses.

loans.use: To buy matooke and chicken feed

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita owns and manages a sari-sari store (community based variety store) in their village in Alinguigan 3rd. Her weekly income of PHP 1,500 was being budget for the needs of her family and as a rolling capital for her business. However, this was not enough to support all their needs. For this, Merlita wanted to expand her business by purchasing more merchandise that she can sell for a bigger income. Thus, she is hoping to obtain a loan of PHP 10,000. She is hoping that her request is granted so that she is able to pursue her business plan.

Merlita is married to Espedito and he is working as a jeepney (small bus) driver. They are blessed with five children who are all studying: Marjorene -19 years old, a B.S. Information Technology student; Joana Marie - 16 years old and Dianne - 15 years old, both high school students; Mark Anthony - 12 years old and Christine, 9 years are in the elementary level. Merlita is happy that they have unity in their family.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Olubisi

texts.en:
Olubisi O. is 40 years old and married with five children. She sells foodstuffs.

She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase of more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Tuong

texts.en: Tường Thị M. Hạ was born in 1962 (no: 010114070017). She lives with her husband and two sons. She has a small confectionery at home (selling cold drinks, beer, Coca-Cola, tea, juice, cake, sweets, etc.). She raises chickens, too. Her husband is a builder. She has a monthly income of about 2,000,000 Vietnamese Dong (about US $113). She wants to borrow 4,142,000 dong to buy goods to sell and buy feed for her chickens.

loans.use: To increase store inventory and buy chicken feed

loans.name: Liliam

texts.es:
LILIAM NUÑEZ D. S., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS GEMAS II” vive en Jr. Piura Nº 131, en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, tiene 47 años D. edad, 03 hijos mayores , y su pareja se dedica al comercio D. bebidas.

Se inició en el negocio D. artículos para belleza y venta D. perfumes, lo hace a través D. catálogos.  El primer préstamo fue D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con el cual compró una pequeña vitrina para poder mostrar sus productos, ella es técnica farmacéutica y su negocio ha ido creciendo.  Paralelamente está ingresando, D. algún modo, al negocio D. la botica (venta D. medicinas)  en conjunto con su familia.

A la fecha el negocio D. venta D. medicinas ha mejorado e incrementado las ventas, por lo que requiere D. un mayor capital.  Con este préstamo D. S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles,  invertirá en la compra D. perfumes, cosméticos y medicina.

“Manuela Ramos me dio muchas oportunidades entre ellas trabajar conjuntamente con mi familia donD. además D. tener un ingreso económico también estamos unidos para seguir adelante.” refirió.
texts.en:
Liliam Nunez D. S. lives in the city of Pucallpa and is a member of the communal bank called Las Gemas II. She is 47 years old and has three grown children. Her husband sells beverages for work. She began her business selling beauty products and perfumes through catalogs. With her first loan, she purchased a small display case to show her products. Liliam is a pharmacy technician and her business has been growing. In parallel to her investment in selling beauty products, she also works together with her family selling medicines.

To date, medicine sales have improved and have increased sales, and now she needs more capital to invest in cosmetics, perfumes as well as more medicine. She says that Manuel Ramos has given her many opportunities to work together with her family, not only providing a source of income, but uniting them in improving their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics, perfumes and medicines for her business

loans.name: Kosiwa Nicole

texts.fr: Marié et mère de 02 enfants, cette femme habite avec son mari et ses enfants dans le quartier d’adidogomé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. Son mari est un chauffeur, le revenu de son mari n’arrive pas à couvrir toutes les charges de la famille, pour l’aider elle  s’est lancé dans le commerce de pagnes. le commerce de pagnes est très développé à Lomé, ce qui fait qu’elle réalise de  bonnes recettes tous les jours. Sa clientèle s’agrandit elle veut par conséquent agrandir son stock de marchandises pour mieux vendre, ayant déjà obtenu de WAGES un crédit qui lui a permis de démarrer son commerce, elle sollicite un autre crédit pour acheter 25 pièces de pagnes.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of 2 children, this woman lives with her husband and children in the Adidogomé neighborhood which is an outlying district of the city of Lomé. Her husband is a driver, but his income is not sufficient to cover all the family's expenses. To help him, she began selling "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth).

Selling "pagnes" is big business in Lomé, so she brings in a good income every day. Her clientele is growing so she would like to expand her inventory so as to sell more, having already obtained one loan from WAGES which allowed her to set herself up in business. She is requesting a second loan to buy 25 lengths of "pagne".

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing "pagnes" for re-sale

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty tiene 20 años, vive en la casa de sus padres. Desde hace medio año tiene su propia granja de cuyes, dedicándose a la limpieza y alimentación de sus animales. Todos los días por las mañanas sale a cortar alfalfa para alimentarlos y después de varias horas sacar el excremento, este método logra la salubridad de sus animales y de ella misma. Los fines de semana los lleva a las ferias ganaderas para su comercialización y también los ofrece a sus vecinos. Para un futuro cercano, Betty desea tener una granja grande e incursionar en la crianza de pollos. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella fue invitada a formar parte de su banco comunal y está disfrutando mucho de participar en cada reunión de coordinación de su grupo. Con el dinero que está solicitando comprará cuyes sementales para reproducir la cantidad de sus animales con una raza mejorada, también comprará conejos.
texts.en:
Betty is 20 years old and lives in her parents' home. She has had her own guinea pig farm business for the last six months. She takes care of the farm, cleaning and feeding the animals. Every day in the morning she cuts alfalfa leaves to feed them and then cleans after the stool to achieve the safety of her animals and herself. She takes the animals on the weekends to the livestock fairs to sell them, and also offers them to her neighbors.

For the near future, Betty wants to have a large farm and go into raising chickens. This is the first loan with MFP; she was invited to be part of the community bank and is enjoying a lot her participation at each meeting of the coordinating group. The money from the loan will be invested in buying guinea pigs to improve the race and rabbits.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and rabbits

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina is 30 years old and she is married with a child. She sells second-hand clothes and poultry. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more clothes and poultry to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothes and poultry to sell

loans.name: Nube Maricela

texts.es:
Nube es nativa de Azogues, ella vive por el parque central y nos cuenta que la mayoría de la gente en el sector  rural se dedica a la agricultura y comercio, y que los  hombres emigran al extranjero.

Ella tiene  24 años y divorciada desde hace 2 años, tiene un hijo de 2 años por el que tiene que responder sola, actualmente vive con sus padres.

 Es egresada en Economía y Finanzas en la Universidad Católica de Azogues  y esta realizando el seminario de graduación.

Nube tiene dos boutiques de ropa,  en la una tiene ropa variada para damas caballers y niños  y la otra exclusivamente de mujer;  trabaja con una prima de 9 AM a 9 PM, no cierra al medio día porque el trabajo  es rentable, sobre todo los fines de semana se vende mas, dice. 

Trabaja con ropa americana, panameña y nacional, tiene algunos  distribuidores y sus utilidades es más o menos de 400 a 500 dólares mensuales. Por  ejemplo en cada prenda tiene un utilidad de 5 dólares.

Le gusta la sociedad de crédito y el préstamo lo hará para adquirir más mercadería y ampliar su negocio. Su sueño es obtener el titulo profesional y luego comprarse una casa para así independizarse con su hijo.
texts.en:
Nube is a native of Azogues. She lives near the central park. She tells us that the majority of the people in the rural area work in agriculture and commerce, and that the men emigrate to other countries. She is 24 years old and has been divorced for 2 years. She has a 2 year old son for whom she alone is responsible. They currently live with Nube's parents. She has completed her studies in Economy and Finance at the Catholic University of Azogues and is currently completing the final "seminario de graduación", similar to a senior thesis on a particular topic, required before graduation. Nube has 2 clothing boutiques. In one she sells a variety of clothing for women, men and children, and in the other she exclusively sells women's clothing. She works with her cousin from 9 AM to 9 PM. She does not close at midday because the work is profitable, particularly on weekends, which is when she sells the most, she says. She works with american clothing, clothing made in Panama and clothing manufactured domestically, in Ecuador. She has some distributors and her profits are more or less 400 to 500 dollars per month. For example, she earns a profit of 5 dollars on each piece of clothing. She likes the local lending association and will use this loan to buy more merchandise and expand her business. Her dream is to earn her professional college degree and later buy herself a house so she can live independently with her son.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire more merchandise and expand her business

loans.name: Akpene

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce depuis 2008 le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, une partie de son stock a baissé, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour se réapprovisionner avec 4 bidons de 25 litres d’huile, 3 cartons de spaghetti, 3 sacs de riz et divers produits d’alimentation générale.

loans.use: achat de produits d'alimentation générale

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda D. started raising hogs more than a decade ago, to help with the family finances and send her children to school. Being a mother of three children, she had to work hard to grow her business to provide for her family's needs and help pay the school fees. 
With her membership in CEVI last year, she was able to purchase hog supplements to continue raising hogs. She hopes to receive a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy supplements for her hogs. Erlinda says that the income she makes helps her family in many ways, especially with her children’s tuition fees.

loans.use: To buy hog feed

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is a 33 married with four children aged between 4 and 10 years. Her children go to school .She takes care of additional family members. Juliet resides and rents a three roomed house where she is staying with five people. There is electricity and no piped water at home  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala in Mengo Mackay Kosovo zone. Juliet works seven days a week. She buys her chicken feeds from Owino Market and incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping.  She doesn’t pay rent as she works from her home.She sells to all categories of people both on retail and whole sale Juliet has been in this business for 18 years and with MCDT for seven, servicing her fourteenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of chicken feeds and chicks l. Juliet is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning 800 chicken .

loans.use: to buy more chicken feeds and chicks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita M. married at the early age of 19. Now she is 27 years old and has four children whose ages range from one to six. Her 32-year-old husband is a driver and a sweet lover. Her disappointments about life being poor are oftentimes overtaken by excitement to face more challenge because of the inspiration brought about by her husband and children.

In 2008, Angelita joined ASHI and requested a loan which she used to start up a buy and sell business. Now, she is requesting a much larger loan, wanting to grow her business, and profits as well, to be able to improve her family’s lifestyle.

Angelita’s husband supports her decision in this because he saw from her previous loan that she is happy having her business and spending her profits on the needs of their children, especially for their education. He knows that she has been dreaming of nothing else but for their children to enjoy life and graduate from college in the future.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and piglets for her livestock-raising business and also to finance her junk buy and sell business

loans.name: Toch

texts.en: Toch L., 54, is married with three children and resides in Phnom Penh City with her husband. To make a living, she sells food and rents parts of her house, earning an income of US $11 per day as a primary source of income for the family to help cover the household expenses. Also, her husband helps his wife with the current business. The family is partly assisted by one of her children who is an accountant for a private company. L. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living. Therefore, L. is asking for a loan of US $500 to expand the current business by selling more types of food to her new and existing customers. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To expand the food selling business

loans.name: Amigos Unidos 3, 4, & 5 Group

texts.en:
Paul, 36, is a borrower who lives near San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. He is the coordinator for his group, Amigos Unidos (Friends United), and his story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Paul and his wife have four children, ages 1 month to 11 years. Together with the rest of the Amigos Unidos group, they live in Batey Los Gunoco. Bateyes are small rural communities built by sugar companies to house their field workers. People who live in bateyes generally have no running water, little to no electricity, and poor medical attention. Despite these difficulties, Paul has found success in his business selling clothing to friends and neighbors. With this loan, he hopes to buy more used and new clothing, including shoes, blouses, and pants.

Paul has big dreams for the future, and with your support he can get there. Paul dreams of owning his own disco one day, providing a fun place for the people in his community to spend their time. With the profits from his business through past loans, Paul has already begun building his own H. for his family. He hopes to finish the house soon with additional profits. Paul also hopes to send his children to college so they can become lawyers, doctors, architects, or anything they want to be. Paul’s dreams for himself, his business, and his family are lofty, but Esperanza believes in his vision and in the vision of the Amigos Unidos group. Thank you for lending!

loans.use: New and used clothing

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
"T. Nguyễn Thị T. (10107010029) is a 33-year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh - Hà Nội.  T. is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Lực Canh 3 (6).

T. is married and has one infant child.  To make a living, T. makes and sells a variety of food products in the local community.  T. has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately $165 a month from this activity.

In 2006, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.028.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 4.578.000 VND which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell.  This will be her 5th loan from SEDA.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Lê Thị T. H. (10107010073) is a 28-year-old female who is requesting a 5.014.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  Đinh Thị H. (10107010070) is a 30-year-old female who is requesting a 5.450.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3.  Diêm Thị T. (10107010044) is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 5.450.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T. Nguyễn Thị T. (10107010029) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà Nội.  T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Lực Canh 3 (6).


Trong khi không pH. chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các loại thực phẩm khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương.  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 7 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2006, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.028.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.578.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Lê Thị T. H. (10107010073) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.014.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Đinh Thị H. (10107010070) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.450.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Diêm Thị T. (10107010044) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.450.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung T. hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Danilo Cruz

texts.es: Danilo tiene más de 10 años de trabajar con créditos individuales en  la Institución, mostrando un buen record crediticio, su actividad económica es la compra y venta de huevos y una pequeña pulpería donde oferta productos varios de primera necesidad. El habita en una vivienda que tiene todos los servicios básicos, agua potable, aguas servidas, energía y convive con su esposa .su meta ha sido siempre el mantener el negocio estable para ayudar al bienestar de la familia. el financiamiento que está solicitando es para la compra de mas productos para su actividad económica.
texts.en:
Danilo has taken out individual loans for over 10 years with the organization, demonstrating a good credit record. His business is the purchase and sale of eggs and a small shop where he offers essential household items. He lives with his wife in a house that has all basic services- potable water, a sewage connection, and electricity.

His goal has always been to maintain a stable business in order to see to the welfare of his family. He is requesting financing to purchase more products for his business.

Translated from Spanish by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Eyvaz

texts.en:
Eyvaz H. is 44 years old. He is married and has six children! He is a hard-working man who has fought to educate his children and provide for his family.

Eyvaz has much experience in raising calves because he observed it from a young age. With time, he has increased his sales and now he needs assistance in the form of investment in his business to allow him to buy more cattle. The business has been going well and he would like it to continue to grow.

Eyvaz applied for a loan to buy calves. He and his family thank you very much for the support that you will provide them by helping him continue his business and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Anna

texts.fr: Anna F. est âgée de 39 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc villageois de SAINTE ANNE1 depuis 5 ans et y a bénéficié de 10 prêts qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés régulièrement. Elle achète des porcs sur pieds, les abat pour vendre la viande au kilogramme. Son objectif est de renforcer son niveau d'épargne afin d'augmenter sa capacité d'autofinancement.
texts.en:
Anna F. is 39 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. She has been a member of the "banc villageois" of SAINTE ANNE for the past 5 years and has received 10 loans that she has always managed well and paid back on time. She buys live pigs and slaughters them in order to sell the meat by weight. Her objective is to increase her savings and become more financially autonomous.

Translated from French by Caroline Mrejen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop her lucrative activity

loans.name: Magda Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora MAGDA ELIZABETH B. Q. labora para CEPRODEL , es soltera , pero tiene dos niños a su cargo que son sobrinos de ella y ella les ayuda económicamente , los créditos anteriores lo ha utilizado para mejoras de vivienda , este ultimo crédito lo va a utilizar para matricula y compra de material didáctico para sus sobrinos ya que estamos en época de apertura de año escolar. Agradece a CEPRODEL `por la oportunidad de mejorar la calidad de  vida y ayudar a sus sobrinos a superarse.
texts.en:
Magda Elizabeth B. Q. works for Kiva partner CEPRODEL. She is single but is the primary caregiver and financial supporter for two children, who are her nephews. Her previous loans were used for home improvements. The loan currently being requested will be applied toward tuition and school supplies for her nephews, who are approaching the start of a new school year. She thanks CEPRODEL for the opportunity to improve their collective quality of life and to help her nephews to better themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tuition and purchase of school supplies

loans.name: Marilia Ivone

texts.pt:
Marilia Ivone S. M. nasceu no Distrito de Manjacaze, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, tem 52 anos de idade solteira e mãe de 2 filhos de 17 e 15 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez somente 8ą classe, não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com os filhos e ainda sustenta dois netos vivem com ela.
Saiu de Manjacaze para Xai-xai ainda muito nova quando foi transferido o seu pai pela empresa onde trabalhava. No ano 2000 sai de Xai-xai para Boane onde fixou sua residência. Tem um negocio proprio há mais de 12 anos, em media faz cerca de 12 horas de trabalho por dia e não possui nenhum empregado. Vende mais extenções para cabelo onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 6.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum atraves do Xitique mensal (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).
Já teve empréstimo na Associação de Credito GUEGUE mais tarde não continuou devido a varias razões. Conheceu a Hluvuku através da sua vizinha que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (fardos de roupa usada, produtos para cabelo, sapatos e outros) para aumentar a quantidade do seu produto. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 9.000.00mt, 13.000.00mt e 13.000.00mt, todos para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar ainda mais no seu negócio.
texts.en:
Marilia Ivone S. M. was born in the district of Manjacaze, Gaza province, in southern Mozambique. She is 52 years old, single, and the mother of 2 children who are 17 and 15 years old. Both of them go to school. She only completed the 8th grade and did not continue because of a lack of financial means. She lives in her own home with her children and also supports 2 grandchildren who live with her. She left Manjacaze for Xai-Xai when she was very young because of her father's job transfer. In 2000, she left Xai-Xai for Boane where she established her home. She has had her own business for more than 12 years. She works around 12 hours each day and doesn't have any employees. She sells hair extensions and earns about 6,000 MZN per month, which she uses to pay for household expenses. She even saves some monthly through Xitique (a traditional rotating savings system). She had a previous loan with the GUEGUE Credit Association, but did not continue with them for various reasons. She found out about Hluvuku through her neighbor, who is also a client of the institution. She is her 4th loan, which has a value of 15,000 MZN. She plans to use it to buy supplies (bundles of used clothing, hair products, shoes, etc.) in order to increase her stock. The previous loans were for 9,000 MZN, 13,000 MZN, and 13,000 MZN, all for the same purpose. She promises to pay back the loan in a timely manner so she can have access to others. In the future, she would like to request more loans to use for her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell beauty products (hair extension products)

loans.name: Josefa Del Carmen

texts.es: Josefa Del Carmen tiene 42 años de edad. Doña Josefa tiene 4 hijos. La actividad económica de Doña Josefa es una pulpería además posee otro negocio como la elaboración y venta de tortillas ella es muy responsable con su cuotas de pago por lo que siempre esta activa con ambos negocios, aunque es muy difícil ya que el cansancio de todo el día al realizar estas tareas le perjudica mucho en su salud, pero no se rinde pues ambos negocios le proporcionan el alimento diario. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que con esto pude comprar productos como frutas, golosinas, y productos de consumo diario. Su deseo es ampliar su negocio con mayor mercadería.
texts.en:
Josefa Del Carmen is 42 years of age. Doña Josefa has 4 children. Her business is a small convenience store. In addition she has another business making and selling tortillas.

She is very responsible about making her payments. This is why she is always busy with both businesses. It is very tiring to carry out all her tasks every day, and this has harmed her health a lot. She doesn’t give up, however, since both businesses provide her with her daily bread.

The loan is for working capital. With it she will be able to purchase products such as fruits, sweets, and other products that are consumed daily. Her wish is to enlarge her business with a bigger inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Melody

texts.en: In a big city like New York it can be very difficult to find a babysitter; people generally rely on word of mouth. With her entrepreneurial spirit, Melody saw an unfilled need and decided to launch a babysitting placement service in April, 2008. Melody's business has brought independence to her life. The flexibility of being her own boss allows her to still continue her career as a singer and performer in New York City and spend more time with her son. Melody found traditional bank loans too costly and difficult to acquire. She was recommended to ACCION USA for an affordable, small business loan. Melody will use her ACCION USA loan to purchase another computer for her growing staff, to provide age-appropriate toys for babysitters, and to ramp up her promotional efforts. Her vision is to expand her babysitting service; therefore, creating more jobs and at the same time raising awareness on the importance of child development. About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA Have you ever thought about how the new café on your corner and the delivery service that brings the fresh baked goods acquired the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated 10 million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis.” Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild the economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To purchase a new computor and toys and for marketing

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
Enriquita F. is a 70-year-old widowed woman who lives with her two children named Mosies and F.. The two children are 24 and 32 years of age and are very supportive and loving children to their mother. Mosies works sporadically as a hired laborer who earns a small amount of money. F. is a fisherman who goes to fish with other fishermen in their village, for he doesn’t have his own fishing boat to use for fishing anytime he wants to earn money for supporting their daily needs. 

Despite the economic status of her family, Enriquita feels fortunate to have children as responsible as her children. For her, being old is not a reason to not be productive, especially to help her loved ones. As a matter of fact, she joined ASHI in 2008 wanting to partner with her fisherman son to grow his business. The loans she has been requesting and is requesting now is her source of capital to achieve the desire of her heart. 

Despite her old age, Enriquita is still capable of selling the fish caught by her son to people around their village. The profits she earns provide her family with simple things they really enjoy; though for Enriquita, those things they have may not be enough. Her sons still have some desires for their lives kept in their hearts, yet she has never heard them complain about the kind of life they have. Through ASHI, Enriquita hopes that one day her business will flourish and bring improvements in their lives.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina M. is a small-business owner and a married woman. She runs a business selling food, both cooked and fried, to customers at Tandika market in Dar es Salaam. She also sells soft drinks.

Amina purchases her business goods from the food shops and food market at Tandika. The business income enables her to pay her children’s school fees and meet her family’s daily needs.

Amina is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Merly

texts.en: Merly Q. is from the village of Binahalan, Gingoog City. She is 48 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Merly owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Merly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Merly plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: German

texts.es:
El señor German W. L. vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba, y tiene 2 hijos mayores, uno de ellos en cantante en un grupo musical de la ciudad y su hija menor acude a la universidad. El señor German trabaja en la Empresa Nacional de Electricidad (ENDE) como topógrafo por más de 20 años. El señor German requiere el préstamo para la compra de una computadora que le ayudara con el manejo de su trabajo puesto que como él nos cuenta cada vez es más difícil por la manera como se actualiza y mejora la manera de hacer topografías.

El señor German nos cuenta que muchos sueños que tenia gracias a Dios ya se cumplieron pero que su próximo gran sueño es ver a sus hijos ser lo mejor que puedan y tengan un futuro exitoso, y poder estar algún día a lado de sus nietos.
texts.en:
Sr. German W. L. lives in the city of Cochabamba. He has two adult children, one is a singer for a musical group that performs in the city and his younger daughter attends the university. Sr. German has been working for the National Electricity Enterprise (ENDE) as a topographer for more than 20 years. He needs a loan to buy a computer to help him manage his work, since it has become increasingly more difficult to create and update topography maps.

Sr. German says he has many dreams and thanks God that many of them have already been fulfilled. However, his next greatest dream is to see his children become the best at what they do and have a successful future. One day he also hopes to have grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a computer for work

loans.name: Javier Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr.  Javier Antonio H. P., El trabaja como Gerente General en el Mercado Israel Lewite de Managua.
Es padre  de familia  de un hijo  y este  se encuentra en edad escolar.
El préstamo solicitado es para  utilizarlo en gasto de medicamento de un familiar que esta enfermo.

Javier Antonio  dice que gracias a los financiamientos  otorgados por ceprodel ha venido mejorando su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Mr. Javier Antonio H. P. works as the general manager of the Israel Lewite Market in Managua. He is married with a school-age son. He is asking for the loan to buy medication for a relative that is sick. Javier Antonio says that thanks to the loan from CEPRODEL he has been able to improve his home.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Powell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medication for a sick relative

loans.name: Mr. Narong Yin Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The 24 members of this village bank loan live I. Preah Theat village I. Kandal province. Each member will use their portion of the loan for their own purpose.

Mr. NaR. Y., born I. 1958, was selected village bank president. He and his wife, Mrs. Ven Sok, are farmers. They own a small piece of land and grow crops to sell to support their family.

Now they have a problem because their field is infertile soil. To improve production, Mr. NaR. Y. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pay farm laborers.

He is a father of six childR.. Two are seamstresses I. a garment factory, one is a driver, and the others attend school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay farm laborers.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia L. is from the town of Trento. She is 50 years old. Virginia is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Virginia raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 30 years. She wishes for her children to finish college and have a bright future. Virginia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Virginia from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social-performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients, but also offers savings, insurance and training programs, which are provided through regular cluster-group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Promesse Plus Group

texts.en:
Virginie L. is the manager of the Community bank named “Promesse Plus”. It is composed of 23 members, united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Virginie started her business in 2003 with a capital of US$ 20 selling yogurt. Today, she operates a general boutique. She is 42 years old, widowed, and has two children whose ages are 13 and 15. Both go to school. She has already received MFI HOPE DRC loans nine times and has fully repaid them. With the profit of about $80 earned per week, she intends with the next loan to increase the inventory of her business by buying canned goods, sugar, sacks of rice and beans and other items to resell at a profit. 

Currently, Virginie is happy to be part of one of Hope’s groups because her business has been reinforced through the loans she has received. Her dream is to someday become a wholesaler. She sells her goods in the western area of Kinshasa.

loans.use: reinforcing her working capital

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo.

Aquí conversamos con la señora Bertha, es casada y tiene tres hijos dos de ellos ya mayores de edad que estudian en la universidad, el menor  todavía está en el colegio, es muy feliz porque que  todos viven aun en su casa.

Se dedica a la  venta de ropa, en especial la de niños ya que a ella le fascina esa ropa y dice que tiene más salida que las otras. Su estrategia de venta es de puerta en puerta. Empezó con muy poco y ahora su negocio ha crecido mucho porque tiene muchos pedidos.

Es así como va a emplear su nuevo crédito para comprar más mercaderías, en especial vestidos de niñas por que tiene varios encargados. Ingreso al Banco Comunal hace 46 ciclos y está muy contenta.

Su meta es darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, the members of the Communal Bank “Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo” (Toward Development with Love and Faith) gather together in Los Bajos de Montecristi. This city is known for a great diversity of traditional products such as straw hats that are famous both inside and outside of the country.

Sra. Bertha is married and has three children, two of whom are adults and studying at the university. The youngest is still in high school. Bertha is very happy because they all still live at home.

She sells clothing, especially children’s clothes because she likes these types of garments and says that they are more popular than other types of apparel. Her strategy is to sell door to door. She started with very little and now her business has grown tremendously because she has many orders.

Bertha will use this loan to buy more merchandise, especially girls’ dresses because she has several orders for these items. She has participated in 46 loan cycles with her Communal Bank and is very pleased. Her goal is to provide her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase girls' dresses

loans.name: Patricia Gina

texts.es: La Señora Patricia  se dedica a la venta de productos a pedido, desde edredones, ropa, vajillas  hasta vehículos a medio uso, es muy joven y trabaja con el capital propio y del esposo, solicitaron el préstamo ya que tuvo demanda de pedidos ella deja sus productos a crédito y va cobrando semanalmente o quincenalmente, ella es muy trabajadora y tiene dos pequeños hijos, quiere a futuro tener un negocio grande de vehículos a medio uso ya vio que en este negocio existe un poco mas de ganancia, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Patricia sells products to order, including comforters, clothing, tableware, and even used vehicles. She’s young and works with her own capital and that of her husband. They requested this loan because they have orders to fill. She sells on credit and collects payments weekly or biweekly. She is very hard working and has two young children. In the future she wants to start a large used vehicle business, now that she realizes that this type of business brings in a bit more income. She is very grateful to the institution for its support.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Lê's Group

texts.en:
Huệ Lê Thị (20209020025) is a 32-year-old woman living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Huệ is the group leader for a five-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Thôn Đoài 1 - nhóm 05 (Nhóm 05).


Huệ is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Huệ owns a tailoring business.  The main source of income for the business comes from providing specialty tailoring services to local community members.  Huệ has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 4.200.000 VND a month from it.


In 2008, Huệ joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Huệ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6.048.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials.  She is now requesting a new loan of 7.392.000 VND, which will be used to purchase a new sewing machine.  The loan will be her fourth loan from SEDA.  Huệ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Ngô Thị S. (0) is a 51-year-old woman who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector.


2.  Nguyễn Thị M. (0) is a 45-year-old woman who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.


3.  Nguyễn Thị L. (0) is a 31-year-old woman who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.


4.  Lê Thị T. (0) is a 26-year-old woman who is requesting a 4.256.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a clothing business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Huệ  Lê Thị (20209020025) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Huệ  là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Thôn Đoài 1 - nhóm 05 (Nhóm 05).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ may mặc trang phục đặc trưng cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Huệ  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Huệ  kiếm được khoảng 4.200.000 VND.  Vào 2008, Huệ  đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  S. hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Huệ  đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 6.048.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua vải & vật liệu bổ sung.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Ngô Thị S. (0) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


2.  Nguyễn Thị M.  (0) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


3.  Nguyễn Thị L. (0) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


4.  Lê Thị T. (0) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Tem

texts.en:
Tem S., 45, is married and resides with her husband and six children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean Temples. S. and her husband are farmers and raise cows, earning an income of USD 5.00 per day. Two of her children are employed as a driver and a garment factory worker, earning an income of about USD 4.00 per day. The family has to spend USD 30.00 on food, USD 10.00 on public transportation, and USD 15.00 on other necessary expenses every month.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase cows and a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S.'s husband appears in the photograph because S. was not available.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike and cows.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: La señora Rosa Maria M., tiene la edad de 42 años habita en el barrio Sabana Grande, es casada y su esposo labora en un taller como fresador, ellos tienen 2 hijos uno de ellos adolescente y el mayor que estudia la universidad, la señora se dedica a vender Ropa, Plásticos, y Recargas telefónicas, desde hace 11 años, sus ventas bajan según las temporadas, por ahora solicita un préstamo para la compra de Plastico que favorezca el aumento en las ventas, ella ha observado que esta inversión tiene bastante demanda en su emrcaxdo meta, puesto que la situación del país no permite que la población compren piezas de vidrio o porcelana en los Centros Comerciales, a corto plazo brindara un mejor solvento en el gasto en el que se incurre en la universidad del hijo mayor, que es una necesidad para su formación académica adecuada de su desarrollo socioeconómico en beneficio de su futura familia.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa Maria M. is 42 years old and lives in the Sabana Grande district. She is married and her husband works as a miller in a workshop. They have two children, one is a teenager and the elder one is at college studying. For the last 11 years, Señora M. has been selling clothing, plastic items and rechargeable phone cards. Her sales fluctuate with the seasons. 

She is currently requesting a loan to buy plastic items, which  will allow her to increase her sales. She has noticed that this investment has an adequate market demand, since the country's situation does not allow people to buy glass or porcelain items in shopping centers. In the short term this will allow her to better afford her eldest child's university expenses, which are necessary to provide him with academic training suitable for his socioeconomic development and for the benefit of his future family.

loans.use: To buy plastic items

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina J. is from the village of Sinamar, Roxas, Isabela. She is 58 years old. Marcelina is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Marcelina plants and harvests corn for sale. Marcelina has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2007, Marcelina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcelina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 33,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Marcelina is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Marcelina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Theodole

texts.en:
Theodole is 30 years old and is married with one child who is three years old. Theodole sells clothing in Kabarondo district in Rwanda. This requires him to work hard so that he can provide for his children with all their needs.  Theodole has been working in this business for three years and his store is open from 6am to 7pm every day.

Theodole has requested a loan from Kiva lenders to help expand his business and purchase more clothing to sell.  He hopes this will help increase his profits and allow him to build his own house.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Daniel Mwania

texts.en:
Daniel, age 35, is married to Joyce. They have four children, ages 6, 8, 10, and 12. He owns and runs a retail shop where he sells various food items like bread, cereals, sugar, milk, and many others. He sells items in small quantities.  

Daniel was introduced to Kadet through a public awareness effort organized by the local chief. He has been running this business for 10 years. He intends to use this loan to buy more cereals, cooking oil, flour, and other items. If the loan improves the business, he will pay school fees for his children's education.

loans.use: To buy sugar, flour, and cereals

loans.name: Buyanhishig

texts.en: Buyanhishig E., 52 years old, lives with his wife and two daughters in the Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent and fence. His youngest daughter attends a local high school and his wife is retired. Buyanhishig operates a construction business specializing in interior and exterior decoration of buildings. Buyanhishig has owned this business for almost 20 years and over this long time he has gained a lot of experience. For the future, he plans to build his own house. He is a hardworking man and is requesting this 800,000 MNT loan in order to purchase necessary materials and supplies for his construction decoration business.

loans.use: to purchase necessary materials and supplies

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is from the town of Plaridel. She is 40 years old. Wilma is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Wilma is just starting this business.

In 2002, Wilma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. 

Wilma is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 10th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana forma parte del banco comunal “Cuentas Claras”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Rancagua. Ella tiene una amasandería hace 3 años en un local cercano a su casa, sin embargo hace 30 años que trabaja en este rubro. Además vende colaciones para obreros de la construcción. Su hija mayor trabaja con ella en este negocio. 
Gracias a los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza ha ido adquiriendo diferentes máquinas como una congeladora, cortadora de cecinas y una máquina conservadora de alimentos, ya que su sueño es incorporar más productos a su negocio. Ahora que cuenta con las máquinas necesarias, con este préstamo comprará mercadería como por ejemplo: lácteos, pollos congelados y cecinas.
Su sueño es tener un mini restaurante para atender mejor a sus clientes de las colaciones.
Juana es maestra de cocina, le gusta mucho su trabajo y está muy agradecida del apoyo de Fondo Esperanza, ya que con los préstamos que ha recibido ha logrado ir creciendo en su negocio.
Rancagua pertenece a la región del Libertador Bernardo O´Higgins. Es una moderna ciudad que regula el principal proceso productivo y exportador agrofrutícola y vitivinícola de Chile. Es también una ciudad minera, debido a que en su cordillera se encuentra la mina subterránea más grande del mundo “El Teniente”, con 4.500 km. de túneles.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the communal bank "Cuentas Claras" and lives in the city of Rancagua.  She has owned a bakery near her house for 3 years now, however, she has 30 years of experience in this profession.  She also sells snacks or light meals to construction workers.  Her oldest daughter works with her in the business.  Thanks to the loans from Fondo Esperanza she has been able to purchase various appliances such as a freezer, a meat slicer and a cooler.  Her dream is to incorporate more products into her business.  Now that she has the necessary appliances, with this loan she will buy  merchandise such as dairy products, frozen chicken and dried meat.  Her dream is to have a small restaurant so that she can better serve her customers that buy snacks from her.  Juana is a master in the kitchen and she really likes her work.  She is very grateful for the support from Fondo Esperanza since because of the loans that she has received, her business has grown.  

Rancagua is in the Libertador Bernardo O'Higgins region.  It is a modern city that regulates the main fruit-growing and wine production and exportation in Chile.  It is also a mining city because, located its mountain range, is the largest underground mine in the world, "El Teniente", with its 4,500 km of tunnels.

loans.use: Dairy products. frozen chicken and dried meat

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa est née à Tsévié et habite  quartier Adidogomé.  Elle est mariée et a  4 enfants à sa charge.  Elle fait le commerce de chaussures d’homme et de la femme. Elle les revend au marché d’Adidogomé et s’approvisionne au grand  marché  de Lomé.  Elle a commencé  en 2000 cette activité et a reçu 2 crédits  qu’elle a  parfaitement   remboursé.    Elle  sollicite un prêt  pour  acheter  20 paires de chaussures d’homme et   25   paires de chaussures  femme.
texts.en: Akossiwa was born in Tsévié and lives now in the neighborhood of Adidogomé. She is married and supports four children. She sells shoes for men and women. She gets her supplies at the great market in Lomé and retails the shoes at the market in Adidogomé. She began this activity in 2000 and received so far two loans which she fully repaid on schedule. She applies for a loan to buy 20 pairs of shoes for men and 25 pairs for women.

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is 32 years old, married, and has four children. She sells groceries from a small store in her parents' house. She will be using her loan of 600 PEN to purchase rice, sugar, and other supplies for her store. Business has been a bit slow during the rainy season, but she expects it to pick up once the school year begins in March. Elena is a member of the communal bank "Los Laureles," which is in its 38th loan cycle. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for three years and was invited by a friend. She enjoys that the loan officers teach her how to save and have informal guidance sessions during bank meetings.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, and other supplies

loans.name: Tabethsu Finoh Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), Kiva's partners in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you the members of the “Tabethsu Finoh” group. They are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Malikie S. is the leader of this group. Makikie is 33 years old and married, with 3 children who attend primary school. Malikie has been operating a business selling cigarettes, toothpaste, toothbrushes, sardines, and other items for five years. With the help of this loan, Malikie will invest in her business by buying the above mentioned items in large quantities.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, toothpaste, toothbrushes, sardines, etc. in large quantities

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en:
Merilyn is 54 years old and married with five children. Merilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Merilyn runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Merilyn has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, candies, etc.

In the future, Merilyn would like to expand her business and take care of family needs.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her general store

loans.name: Mwanamisi Ali

texts.en:
Mwanamisi Ali S. is 49 years old. She is married to Ali S. and they have been blessed with seven children. For the past three years, Mwanamisi has been in the poultry business. Her business is doing well. She is requesting her second loan from KADET LTD to purchase more chicks to raise and sell. 

Mwanamisi will use the surplus income generated from her loan to expand her business. Her dream is to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase chicks to raise and sell

loans.name: Til

texts.en:
Til S. has been in farming business for a long time.  She had learned from her grandparent when she was still unmarried. She is now married and has four kids, three of whom are unmarried and the other is married and lives independently. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. Growing crops is an annual activity with which she has had great success. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. Til S. is going to use her loan to buy a cow, fertilizers and seeds for planting in the dry season. 

Note: Til S. and her husband are shown in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a cow, fertilizers and seeds for planting in the dry season.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet N. lives in the Mulago neighborhood, in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 2 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (a sister and brother). 

Harriet has a business of selling second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. She sells her products from home, by means of retail.
